Reviews.Title: “Just-about-average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: vcchicago
Reviews.Content: If your priority is singularly on location near the airport, this hotel is a convenient choice. However, if you are looking for a nice, relaxing, slightly upscale hotel, this is not the one. The rooms reminded me of motels in the US -- aging rooms, fittings, and amenities. Staff is overloaded due to high traffic volume. Lots of flight crew in the hotel as well. I went to the Dragon Inn restaurant, and it took them so long to get me my order, it was ridiculous. Internet access was great. I booked a reservation that gave me 24-hour checkout which was great. I had business in the airport area and less than 24 hours on the ground, so that is the only reason this hotel worked for me. But the quality is sub-par, sadly.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ardene
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Hong Kong after a long crowded and cramped flight from the UK it was great to walk a short distance to this hotel, all under cover. The female receptionist was efficient but lacked any warmth. The concierge's staff (Johnny and Leon) were helpful and gave good advice about how to get places. The bedroom had two double beds (I was travelling alone) so plenty of space to spread out. The bedroom and bathroom were clean though I felt the inside of the bath could have benefited from an extra scrub! Also I found a drawerful of coins from a previous guest so housekeeping could be improved. Tea and coffee making facilities, an iron and board, in-room safe, hairdryer, slippers and bathrobes contributed to a pleasant stay. Very minimal noise from the airport and the view from my window was across the end of the runway to the sea. I ate in the airport where food is apparently cheaper than the hotel. Check out was at 12 noon but as my flight was not until the evening I was able to store my luggage with the concierge at no cost, and take the free shuttle bus to a nearby mall. From there I took the cable car up to the giant buddha - quite an amazing trip and a good way to spend the afternoon. There are nice spa and pool facilities at the hotel (the former quite expensive, I thought) but I was not in a mindset for them. I would use this hotel again for a one night stopover for the sheer convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Poor interaction with staff, coffee shop staff rude”
Reviews.Author: sanjay744
Reviews.Content: Rooms are quiet, no aircraft noise. swimming poll nice. Walking distance from the terminal. Food is okay, Well connected by bus. 35 min ride by express train to city, ticket 100 HK dollars.But the staff at coffee shop are very rude

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kongvenient!”
Reviews.Author: Naninofro
Reviews.Content: Airport terminal is a short walk from check-out desk. The Hotel is not luxuriant but it is definitely comfortable enough. The pool & spa areas are nice and even on a rainy day you can go for a swim. Concierge Johnny and all the others are so accomidating it makes up for what the hotel lacks in ambiance. The souvenir shops are 'cents' above alley prices. Bus stops right in front of the hotel and the train is just minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: LordHow
Reviews.Content: Hotel very convenient to airport and only 5 minutes walk to terminal. Staff very friendly and efficient, room compact but tidy but totally adequate for transit purposes. Got a very good price online so overall very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Short visits only”
Reviews.Author: Wally R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to the airport terminal. I have stayed here dozens of times: Sometimes it is more tolerable than others. The plumbing is getting older--and some rooms have disturbing noise levels from it. It seems they have some sort of "closed system" for their toilet waste water--and some bathrooms smell quite badly--as though they are overdue for treatment. It is a "transient hotel"--and prone to having tour groups trying to check-in at all hours of the day and night. Seems many Chinese cannot read room numbers--and often you will awaken to the sound of some hapless traveler trying his key in your door. Very annoying and ongoing. Their breakfast buffet used to be quite decent--but the selection has diminished and I often skip it--even though it is included. Of better quality--but quite pricey--are room service selections. Some rooms' climate control is ineffective: It can become too cold or quite humid. It is not uncommon to return to the front desk and request a room change for such reasons. My company forces me to stay at Regal--so I try to make the most of it--but there are better options (Marriott & Novotel) within 10 minutes of the airport--with courtesy transportation--either of which would be my clear preference to this airport Regal.

Reviews.Title: “Handy overnight hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane K
Reviews.Content: If you want to break the long haul trip to London, this hotel is very convenient for that purpose. While expensive, it is clean with modern amenities. The concourse entrance is near Starbucks after arrivals. It's important to note that if coming in before 2pm your room is unlikely to be available which was annoying for us as we came off a 7.30am aircraft! Still, after 4 hours we managed to get in a room but not before walking around the airport complex to while away the time! Prior to check-in at reception you will be approached by a concierge who will take your luggage and issue you with a card. Luggage is delivered to your room which is great! Free Internet for 2 hours is available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Richard D
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and very convenient for transit stops and early morning departures; only 300m from the Arrivals Hall. Very expensive if simply turning up but an advance booking through a hotel agency can bring the cost down by 75%. Also convenient for short trips to Central and the sights of Lantau. Wi-fi is expensive but at the nearby airport it is free! The downside is that there is a slightly unfriendly attitude at the front desk, storage space in the rooms is limited and the decor needs a little refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Handy Transit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BizVoyage
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a few hotels around Hong Kong International Airport on my way to the People's Republic of China. All the hotels in the area offer a free shuttle bus to and from the airport, some are attached to shopping malls or subway stations. However, for ease of access none really beat the Regal. Having said that, it is often not the cheapest option, so shop around before booking. My last three stays at the Regal have been for about eight hours each - purely transit. It is always busy and understandably so. The Regal is the only hotel at HKIA that you can walk to. Unlike Singapore's Changi, you have to clear customs and "arrive" in Hong Kong before you can get to your bed. I should hasten to say that this is not the hotel's fault. However, that extra time spent clearing customs is deducted from your all too brief sleep before your next flight. The hotel is fairly typical for a Hong Kong business traveller's class of hotel, in that it is modern, clean and well appointed without being luxurious. The rooms are "compact" without being cramped. There is a flat screen LCD TV on the wall, mini bar, complimentary bottled water, a comfortable bed and desk area. The room has a reliable alarm clock and there is a wakeup call service. Annoyingly, there is a charge for internet access. The bathroom is equally modern and well appointed with a bath/ shower and a sit-down style toilet (although the squat variety are just about extinct in Hong Kong hotels, I still get asked by first time visitors to China). There are the usual bathroom supplies plus the very handy shaving kit and toothbrush. The bed in my room was excellent and the room quiet enough for even the lightest sleeper. My last trip coincided with a level 8 Typhoon warning (gale force winds), strong winds and heavy rain were causing quite a noise outside, but I barely noticed it and slept through. The staff are efficient and courteous. I've never found them to be less than polite. However, this hotel is busy 24 hours a day, seven days a week. The front desk is under relentless pressure. I could well imagine getting a little jaded if my working day was like that, so I think they do a great job under tough conditions. There is a gym and a pool, but with an eight hour stop over they were not on my to-do list. The Regal fulfils the role of transit hotel very well, and I could imagine staying for two to three days if there was something that kept me in the area. This is not a hotel for a tourist visiting Hong Kong for a holiday, there are better located options in Kowloon or on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Carfield0830
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay (my first stay was almost five years ago), and unfortunately, the hotel has shown clear signs of rundown. To make things worst, the front desk staffs were rude and unfriendly. I felt like someone was pointing a gun at them and they did not smile at all. When I checked in, the agent did not realize that I bought a package that allowed a 4pm check out. My runway view room was never honored but after the incident with the broken TV, I was too tired to ask for another room change. BTW, their 24 hours policy advertised at the website does not apply to normal room rate unless specifically mentioned. I considered false advertisement. The check-out was worst - the staff rather chatted with her colleague and instead of handing me a proper receipt, she just threw one at me. She did not care about my well being or wanted my business again. The room was in the same state as five years ago with no update. Lots of scratches and marks in the sofa and walls. The television set was broken and required two different staffs to fix it. The only staffs that smiled were the bell boys and the engineer that fixed the TV. The rest of the staffs were stressed out and showed no incentive to provide good service. The only benefit was the location of the hotel, which was at the airport, but I still felt both Novotel Citygate and Marriott Hong Kong airport are much better accommodation options, even with the shuttle ride. So go with these other two hotels unless you have a late arriving flight or a super early morning flight. If you choose to stay here, expect the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Convience and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Ed L
Reviews.Content: We stay here for a week while travel to a convection which meant for excellent Convience, however the staff and service was expected from a large unfriendly property Limited! We enjoy the 24 hr gym for those that cannot sleep and the pool which was rarely use among the 1200 guests . It also had a laundry facilities which was great for the long term traveller. The best things was its location near the airport which gave us the opportunity to meet friends for dinner and get the train into town. The hotel also offers a free shuttle to city gate an outlet mall where one can take the train at a discounted price. Don't expect too much and you will be surprised, a good doorman joe will lead you in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here for the location”
Reviews.Author: DakotasDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the airport because we were in transit and didn't want to travel into Hong Kong, so for convenience it was fine. But, there is nothing special about this hotel other than location. The rooms are average and had the worst toilet paper I have ever encountered in a hotel, especially considering the price of the room. The restaurants are incredibly overpriced (even by Hong Kong standards) and so we wound up going back into the airport for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: notavailableee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night before a conference near the Hong Kong airport. The hotel is conveniently located near the airport T1 and is connected via bridges. So there are a lot of choices of food because I can easily get to the T1 and T2 buildings. However the hotel is a little bit run down and old. I think some renovation is needed. Overall it is a comfortable hotel for the occasion.

Reviews.Title: “not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: tony w
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times in this hotel last year, wow what a change, no one new my name and my account details were lost, again one hour to check in, this was only the start the coffee shop outlet breakfast used to be one of the best, regal what happened, I know you have recently changed chefs but seriously, I was informed you have staff shortages, which is not acceptable, you did not give a discount rate of the food, which you need to, I asked to see the new chef to explain my issues to which I was informed he is new and does not talk to the guest, and that I could write him a message, this I took as an insult, I left him a message and my contact details, to date no reply, the old team would not have treated guest this way, I will take my money to the Marriott next time

Reviews.Title: “Long wait to check-in but at airport”
Reviews.Author: UselessJRPass
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and had to leave early the next morning so this hotel was the obvious choice. It was on the airport so we walked from the arrivals hall only a few minutes. The only reason to stay here is for an overnight transit. The check-in wait was about 25 mins. The Internet didn't work properly and the view was overlooking ordinary buildings and not as advertised. The room was OK but only just. 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise and impossibly convenient”
Reviews.Author: dgcubfan
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was skeptical of staying here and almost stayed 1.5 mi away at a Marriott just because I had never heard of Regal. I am glad I didn't. This hotel could not be more convenient -- you literally don't ever leave the airport -- and was a pleasant surprise in terms of atmosphere and quality. The property is beautiful, the rooms very nice and spacious, and the staff friendly and helpful. I liked the pillows so much that I asked to purchase 4 of them; the staff is packaging them up for me to pick up on my next visit in a few weeks -- when I won't even be considering the Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, short walk to airport”
Reviews.Author: grip652
Reviews.Content: Arrived late and had an early morning flight, so we didn't spend much time here. Check-in and out easy, room clean and comfortable. We did not hear any air traffic during the night, though you can see the airport from the window. Good western and asian offerings for breakfast. A quick walk to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: Peggynz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for a short stopover, the entrance and foyer is more impressive than the rooms, which are very basic. I have previously stayed at the Novotel which I think is better value for money with the added bonus of being located by the shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Take a trip to town”
Reviews.Author: Gene L
Reviews.Content: Not impressed due to a misunderstanding with my Chinese host I ended up having to pay twice for a one night stay, the reservation department were non obliging and reception staff in cooperative and only interested in getting more money out of me. Even wanted £10 for Wifi which was free next door. Hotel looks fine but has no character and if there were other hotels in the area they would go bust. Would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Layover Superb”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth D
Reviews.Content: Location location! We have stayed 4 times over the past few years due to the convenience of breaking our travelling hours. To rest over for 12-20 hours assists with the jetlag. On return to Australia this month we arrived at 7am and did not leave till 6pm the next day...reception kindly extended our checkout to 4pm for an extra AUD$79 we had the use of 11th floor Regal Club complimentary drinks, breakfast Internet and superb customer service. Variety of restaurants is impressive. Most helpful pleasant staff!!! Fully recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Nicinici
Reviews.Content: Check-in time is 2:00pm and we arrived at 2:00pm sharp and there was already a queue for 10+ people. Waited for 30 minutes and check-in process was slow. The reception also made mistake by assigning me a room which belonged to other guest. We booked 3 rooms and after the check-in process, the reception told us that all the rooms were not ready and we need to be back at 3:30, and needed to queue again to get the room keys. We waited and waited and finally got 6 room cards, 2 for each room. Out of 6, 3 of the cards did not function! The size of the room is OK but the room is a little wear-out and the toilets smell. All the fridges were locked and we need to call the staff to open. To access the gym, you need to swipe your room card to open the door as no one was inside. But you need to register in the reception and add a code to your room card first which means another queue. Overall, the hotel is poor and won’t stay again, Hong Kong is such a small place and I would suggest travelers to stay where else.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for any flight schedule”
Reviews.Author: Esperanza L
Reviews.Content: We've stayed twice at this hotel. Rooms were good but the more important factor for us was the hotel's location. For both times, the hotel's location allowed us to make the most out of our short visit to HK. We did not waste any travel time between hotel and airport, either at arrival or for departure, since it was interconnected. We are not hassled or stressed with rushing to the airport to catch our flight. The hotel also had regular free shuttle service to Tung Chung (outlet mall) and several stops at downtown HK. This also saved us bus/train fares. The hotel also has a pool and gym which unfortunately we were not able to try since we were always out exploring HK.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey - worth every cent flying home from HKIA”
Reviews.Author: Mike_JB
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Regal Airport Hotel at HKG four times now. The rooms are very nice, and you really don't get all that much noise considering the location. Buffet breakfast it good, selection typical for HK. It is a little pricey (though not outrageous) yet the convenience of being that close to your flight is worth it! You just walk across a skybridge and you're in the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: SADLYCHANGED
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for one night on a stopover from Adelaide to Beijing, Great location, we had an executive room, the room was nice but the bathroom could do with a renovation, Room service was a bit of a let down, the rice with shrimp was just lukewarm and the bread on the club sandwich was burnt., Breakfast in the executive lounge was just average, It was more expensive than other hotels but we were willing to pay for the convenience as we arrived at 10 in the evening and had a 10am flight and the hotel is just a 5 minute walk through the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over property”
Reviews.Author: Seat_1A_1B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a single night on our way back to Melbourne from Paris. I had booked a normal room via the net well before, and asked for late checkout, as our flight did not depart to 2100. We had arrived late, and was disappointed to find out that late check out was not available, and we would need to be out by 1200. Not a good start, with a long time to wait the next morning. Thankfully, we were offered an upgrade to there premier longe for 500hkd, which included late check out till 1800, free Internet access, breakfast and afternoon tea. A real bargain! The room was a good size and clean. We have stayed here several times, and this time was by far the best. While there was a small delay at check in, I found the staff helpful and polite. I would stay here again, as a transit hotel, if required.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Sanjay255068
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice recently.... Nice hotel although floor confusing if come by Taxi. No one to guide to reception rally but found it finally. Reception seemed slow and inefficient. Long waits every time almost at counter. Staff seem busy and stressed. No relaxed but still pretty friendly. Free wifi in lobby area but not free in room. If you want the full package you can upgrade on arrival but HKG550 or so fee. I skipped that as a bit too much for what I required. Room ok... A little dated. Could do with refurb.... but clean and tidy. A short walk to airport which was most convenient. buffet dinner good but expensive... The OM spa was excellent and Sara Thai masseuse very very good... Highy recommend the spa........

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary!”
Reviews.Author: Marc L
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here in July. I was on a late flight arriving into Hong Kong before moving on to Guangzhou in China. I arrived tired, there was about a twenty minute wait just to check in. The girl seemed quite tired herself and was rude and disinterested. Eventually i went to my room, wanting to have a shower and go to bed. My luggage took forever to arrive and required two calls to reception/concierge before being delivered. The room was okay, without being anything special. Checkout wasn't much quicker though the staff were polite. The WORSE part of this hotel was the breakfast. The restaurant is down on the bottom floor set in what looks like an 80's disco (even I am too young for that, but you know what i mean) It was the worst coffee i have ever drank and the food was terrible. I decided not to eat and take a chance with an Air China breakfast (congee and beans) which was slightly better. Would not stay at this hotel again. Lastly, despite being told i had "complimentary internet", i was charged at Check Out. It wasn't until i complained that they paid a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, reception appalling”
Reviews.Author: Spinnaker3
Reviews.Content: Arrived off a long haul flight with reservations made months earlier to be told the rooms were not ready! Complained and the rooms were sorted out, meant to be near each other, which they were not. Rooms were dirty and pillows were not washed. Complained again to management and we were upgraded to better rooms adjacent to each other. Tip if you complain ask for management straight away.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogance, rudeness and ripoff”
Reviews.Author: DavidALamond
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times and, given its convenience, tried to like it. Each time I stay though, there's something else mightily annoying. Arrived from Beijing and checking in, to be told I couldn't have frequent flyer points because I'd booked on a special rate! Duty manager duly called and FF points OK'd, then proceeded to tell me the "complementary" benefits I was getting, when I knew they'd already been paid for. Next time, I'll bite the bullet and travel into HK proper for my stay - poor, poor, poor.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you have to”
Reviews.Author: Wadstorm
Reviews.Content: Really overpriced hotel & they charge extra if you want to use wifi. Rooms are tiny. Only stay here if you get in too late, otherwise your best option is to take the MTR to the city and spend considerably less to stay in a better hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a one-night stop...”
Reviews.Author: JTW_CB
Reviews.Content: A strange hotel. Public areas are great and I ate in twice and the food was superb (although both restraunts were almost empty). Service at both was a bit of a joke as none of the staff seemed to speak English - which was very unusual for HK and almost a crime for a hotel situated in one of the world's busiest and premier airports. Whilst comfortable, my room was very dated and jaded and in need of a major overhaul to bring it into this decade. I've stayed in far more nicer Premier Inns in the UK. Only one power-point which meant it was really difficult to use / power up my lap-top, phone etc etc at the same time. But check-in / out and the Concierge was good and helpful. The Conference facilities were also good - but not brilliant. This was the main purpose of my trip. Catering associated with this was likewise good (although way OTT in terms of the amount of food v delegates). I just get the view that being the only airport directly next to the airport which is used by a massive amount of flight crews, they have a captive audience any have got lazy in many respects. However, it is far from bad as there are some really good points. A good example of the Curates Egg

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Regal”
Reviews.Author: lovepp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at regal airport again in June. I met some new staff at the hotel. They are very helpful and friendly. They offered a upgrade package to the executive room just for 550 HKD. That included my breakfast, WIFI in room and access to the lounge. The lounge was quiet so that I can have my work done there. I will take the package again when I stay there next time

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Items”
Reviews.Author: Victor T
Reviews.Content: When I left my room to go downstairs for coffee my items were stolen by the cleaning staff. 2 watches and a Samsung Y android phone was stolen. They took the items from the box and left the box empty. I felt my backpack was slightly off and did not realized the items were stolen until I landed in at my distination. Overpriced room, Wifi is not free, you get charged per session and not the 120 min max they claim, and one simple international call less then a min was $10.

Reviews.Title: “free internet would have rather paid”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: Great location and this is where it stops.The internet in the hotel was free, but totally useless would have rather paid and got a better service. The room had mold in the bathroom and the bed was old and needed a new mattress, not to mention the pillows also needed to be changed. The waitress at the lobby bar needed to be put in another section some where away from the guest. While lying around the outdoor pool in 33 degree heat, i had a bottle of water that i was consuming and was told by the pool attendant to put it away as no beverages were allowed. This hotel has one best airport hotel in the world 4 times, i must have missed something. As i said great location and a great base to get to all parts of Hong Kong. The spa in the hotel was great. I had a 1 hour massage just before i left for my flight home one of the few positive experiences whilst staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Average”
Reviews.Author: GeneralManagerTokyo
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly in transit to Australia and what it does deliver is a clean quiet room that is convenient. If it was not connected to the terminal the Marriott is a far better hotel and I suggest anyone with lots of time that it is better to choose the Marriott or HK Central hotel. What really annoys me is that check in/out is always incredibly slow and every time you have to complete the same paperwork (despite 15+ stays). Staff are not friendly and not welcoming and after a long flight you just want to get into your room. Porterage is never offered and everyone just lugs their bags down very long corridors. Given high rates charged I also expect not to have to check in/out with masses of air crew further delaying the process. Restaurants and bars are very average (service, food and condition), room service consistently poor/slow, breakfast is tour group crazy and decor throughout garish.

Reviews.Title: “Works with short stay”
Reviews.Author: OlliFIN
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located at HKG int airport (walkway access from T1). Staff is friendly and happy to help. Stayed in a single room which was a bit old in decoration but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. Gym is also nice. Works for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag - bad front desk, stay if you have to”
Reviews.Author: fretlessb
Reviews.Content: This is definitely extremely convenient if you need an airport by the Hong Kong Airport. The walk is basically as far as the parking garage. The rooms are ok... bigger than some in HK that I've stayed at (although for the price, probably could have expected more). My big problem was with the front desk. I got in at 12:30am wanting nothing but a bed to sleep in. With reservation made well in advance, they still managed to not have a room available! I had to wait almost 45 (very long) minutes. Again, this is after paying ~$315 for a night. Staff was not sympathetic or apologetic and was often simply available. One of the worst customer service experiences I've ever had a hotel. My advice - stay here only if you have to.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and quality”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night in between flights (actually, stayed for a total of about 9 hours). When we got there, we had been upgraded which was nice. Very convenient to get to - you do still have to go through customs, but once through, it's only a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Our room was spacious which makes the high price worthwhile. Very glad we spent the money and actually managed to get some sleep between flights!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for transiting passengers, nothin else”
Reviews.Author: ray167
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night as my US connecting flight was too early for me to connect closer. Was either a night at Regal or on the benches. HKIA should have a transit hotel within checkiin area. Location was great. Room looks tired and worn out. Cupboards were scuffed and won't close all the way. breakfast and Internet were extras and not included as part of booking. Seems all airport hotels dont care. corridors were narrow, staff were indifferent when walkin to my room with my suitcase, bellhop had his trolly blocking the corrider, sa m coming and did nothing i had to move bags out of way myself.

Reviews.Title: “5* price but 1* room and service”
Reviews.Author: Hkshan3
Reviews.Content: Reception service is bad as they did not have my booking record. End up giving me a 2 single room when I'm alone. Call reception to ask for a double room but no answer. Went to ask them directly but got a cold reply "no room". Room is lousy without basis bathroom amenities like comb and sanitary bag. Bath tub choker and standing lamp not working. Can't even find a pen to write complain letter. No master light switch, have to switch off all the lightings one by one. What worse is they cut off the electricity supply for my room before my check out time, so I was struck outside the room door. And it took numerous call to the reception before someone came to open my door. I had written the feedback form. However, it has been a week and I have yet to hear another explanation from the hotel. Never going back.

Reviews.Title: “location can't be beaten for layover”
Reviews.Author: reins76
Reviews.Content: inside the airport and accessed by covered walkway the convenience for a stay in between flights can not be beaten. check in a bit slow, checkout speedy and effecient. no hot water when i wanted to shower on arrival (although this did come through later) good sound proofing to outside (obviously important in an airport) but internal sound proofing (to lifts snd hallways was poor. a bit expensive but well worth it and savings made on transprt (and time saved)

Reviews.Title: “layover next time i will stay in the lounge”
Reviews.Author: kingsley c
Reviews.Content: Missed my connection to Brisbane so had a layover at this Hotel,the staff were rude this i find quite normal in Hong Kong having stayed there many times,I know airport hotels don't care much for layover customers as all there guests are transient,and wouldn't stay there out of choice when i got my room it smelt like an ashtray i phone reception and asked if i could change rooms no was the reply.I then asked if they had wifi i was told i would have to go to reception to arrange i was then told that i would have to leave a deposit of HK500 for wifi that cost HK120 they then charged my card HK500 this i thought strange the wifi worked spasmodically but beggars cant be choosers i had to send emails etc the next day i went into town to mcdonalds as there free wifi worked better, Dinning breakfast was a buffet it was 3 star Lunch & Dinner was Identical 2 star i especially enjoyed the pkt Asparagus soup and the tinned apple crumble on Check out i inquired about my deposit HK 500 for the wifi they said it would be returned eventually they then asked for HK120 for the wifi that didn't work properly i will recommend this hotel to all my many friends never to stay there

Reviews.Title: “About the Regal club room / lounge”
Reviews.Author: Fleetcat
Reviews.Content: We were in transit in Hong Kong for one evening with an early flight the following morning. It is hard to imagine a more convenient location and for this reason I would recommend this bulk standard airport hotel. We took a club level room which was fine although - while designated non-smoking - had that tell-tale odour of fabric cleaner signifying a previous guest had not understood the rules. The lounge was OK and during our stay pleasantly quiet. The food wasn’t great so unless you plan on merely snacking you will not get away with eating solely there. We arrived mid-afternoon and this seemed to fall nicely in time for the evening ‘free’ alcohol period which was perfect. I did not note the times but I think we had three hours of complimentary drinks which – with our consumption – rendered the extra cost of the room moot! So if like us you enjoy an early evening libation this is the way to go. I fancied a manicure and a pedicure but the hotel does not have a facility for these services.

Reviews.Title: “Convient location”
Reviews.Author: Reaganspopy
Reviews.Content: I often fly into Hong Kong from ATL and arrive too late to catch a flight out so I end up spending the night. When I was younger I would have just slept in the airport but that's just not going to happen now. The rooms are a little on the pricy side but everything in HK is expensive. The location can't be beat. It's just a short walk from the arrival hall, no need to catch a taxi. The rooms are clean and the staff seem to always be there to help. But the beds are the usual hard as heck Chinese beds. But after 18 hours in the air who cares.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty basic choice - only if you are stuck”
Reviews.Author: tnu
Reviews.Content: A fairly typical airport hotel... if you aren't stuck overnight at the airport after a midnight cancellation like I was, you should never need to stay at this basic hotel. Before midnight you should take the competitively priced Airport Express into Kowloon and Central where there are many more equally convenient and much better hotels. Unfortunately, the Airport Express doesn't run after midnight (as the Airport Express seems to believe that the airport closes at midnight, or that passengers who arrive or depart after midnight should only take cars.). Be prepared for a slight walk (especially if you have luggage) as the airport is so large that even though the hotel is nearby, it is stuck in an awkward location where it is too close to have transport and a little too far to walk comfortably when you do have luggage. Rooms are basic (almost hospital like) as befits a hotel who's customers really have no choice. Nobody is there for the food or the facilities, so don't even bother.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, but you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: With a short night in transit at Chep Lap Kok, it's not worth the hassle of travelling to and fro a hotel. Airport hotels know this and as a result they are able to extract a premium. It's simple economics, but annoying nonetheless. I had an executive room with a high ceiling which was very spacious with all the amenities you could want, although after an eleven hour flight I just needed a bed. The staff advised me that for a 10am flight I needed to leave the hotel by 6.30am. Nonsense. I could have done with the extra time in bed. And if you're going to tell me to leave that early then at least make sure the exec floor lounge is open. Also, if you're going to charge that much, it would be a nice touch if there was exec floor check-in and portering inside the airport terminal itself.

Reviews.Title: “Can do a lot better”
Reviews.Author: YQTA
Reviews.Content: The hotel has good infrastructure however rooms are seriously getting old and may appear to be dirty. The services are efficient but could be more friendly to give comfort to weary travelers who, for one unfortunately reason or another, have to stay in the airport hotel for the night. Other areas for improvement include providing adopters for using the power socket, and providing free internet access to help travelers contact their loved ones and making new travel arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Internet /WIFI charges”
Reviews.Author: James T
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from a Friday @ 9 pm till the Saturday @ 11:30 and was slugged 240 HK $ for Internet / WIFI. Fair enough but any time I tried to log on they kept doing password checks. The fact that the service kept dropping out meant that this became very frustrating. On check out staff did not care just demanded their money. Seems all set up for their profit and not for the convenience of the traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Jackster17
Reviews.Content: Very overpriced for what you get. The rooms were smelly with stained carpet, I asked to be moved because the first room stunk and was in need of a refurb. If you just need a room for the night you this is very convenient as its a short walk from the Airport Arrivals Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: MukeshSingh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night in transit to Kathmandu. Average hotel to stay only if you are in transit, otherwise, why one should spend more money here at the airport rather than staying in city areas. Everything was expensive but some of staff were nice and room facilities were okay. So many things in my room was initially not working and I had to call house keeping to fix it such as safety deposit box, TV remote, Refrigerator (with anything inside).....and so on. There was nothing that really attracted me so much. But in general I saw they have different facilities within hotel complex, including many restaurants and bar, pools etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good stopover hotel - even if it is a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: traveljane_8
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online to take advantage of the 24 hour check in/check out facility. The room was well equipped with flat screen TV, modern and clean bathroom. I took the train to down town hong kong (which is easily done from the airport). I also had a massage at the hotel (20% discount off the standard prices being a hotel guest), which was great! There was no noise at all in the hotel. I stayed on the 10th floor - which was the Club Room (I'm not sure if I was upgraded!) I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: Forbery
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night to break the journey from Sydney to London. Staff very helpful from check in to check out. Shuttle bus went to Citygate shopping centre which was good to fill in some hours. Location was excellent and no airport noise at all from room. The ability to check out 24 hours later was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cooyal222
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel overnight as was flying to Rome the next morning. Easy walk from the terminal to hotel. Although the reception area is large, could not locate it easily and spent time going up and down the escalators. Found a small sign to reception but it was hard to see and stood a bit away from the escalators. Staff at reception were most helpful as was the staff in the business area. Free Wifi good in the lounge area attached to the reception. Had a very nice meal at Rouge restaurant downstairs. Best fried rice I have ever had in a restaurant. I had booked a deluxe room but was upgraded to a Regal Club room which was very nice. Very clean and a good sized room with desk and sofa. No hesitation to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steven E
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May for the evening after flying in from Cairns. It's very convenient located directly to the main terminal via enclosed walkway. We were on Executive Club level which provided us with a large quiet room, very comfortable king sized bed, great linen and all the five star inclusions such as upgraded bathroom amenities and access to the very comfortable lounge where we had breakfast the following morning, it's a lovely large room with internet access and a geat view of aircraft take off and landings. We took advantage of the late check- out (4pm) the following day for our early evening flight to Europe. We did have lunch in the hotel which was also very good. This is the best airport hotel I have ever stayed at and would have not hesitation in recommending it to anyone. It is also the only hotel that I know of that allows for a full 24hour stay. i.e. you arrive at 7pm you stay until 7pm the following day, however this must be booked online only. We only found out about this when we checked in. I had booked the room by phone from Australia. All in all faultless and very convenient

Reviews.Title: “Awful service”
Reviews.Author: keir h
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay for an 11 hour stopover and it took 2 hours to sort our rooms out. Tired kids and our obvious frustration didn't bother them, indeed they ever seemed to be provoking us into an argument. Facilities were nothing to write home about either and everything was slapdash, grubby and tired, much like us.

Reviews.Title: “There is a difference between a 5 star and a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline C
Reviews.Content: Yes this is located within 5 minutes walk from the arrival hall, and you'd probably won't expect much from an airport hotel as all you need would probably a shower, a bed and that's all, but calling this the World's best airport hotel got into my nerve. First off I work at a 5 star hotel in Hong Kong myself so i was hoping for a special accommodation deal after landing hong kong in late afternoon. Called up the reservation department and told them I would have my brother checking in first as he will arrive at 11AM and I'll be arriving later at around 6PM, they refused as under hotelier rate the hotelier person needs to check in first. Now I've stayed in many different hotels around the world and I always got special deals without me checking in first, this is the first time ever i got rejected. I've offered them my business card via e-mail, even allow them to offer me BAR rate then later on honouring the industrial rate in case i failed to show up, all got rejected by their reservation manager. I was furious and just hang up the phone. Then turned out Ctrip offered the exact same deal but even better - room with breakfast and complimentary late check out until 1500hrs with 1 free welcome drink, boom! My brother changed his flight so we both arrive late in the afternoon. Read the other review on having massive Chinese group checking in was not the case for me, the counter was emptied. So this lady 'J' at the reception greeted us with no smile and I gave her the ID and the luggage tag for check in, I've actually punched in a non smoking room twin beds but yet she have to ask again (note here not reconfirming), that got me into thinking whether the request was in placed at all. She returned me the ID and the credit cards by placing on the counter without even tried to say here you go thank you, i was amazed. And when i asked to have the late check out confirmed at 1500 she said no latest is 1400hrs, I then showed her the confirmation on my cell which stated LCO until 1500 free of charge and 1 welcome drink, she looked confused and started asking her colleagues and supervisors around, and of course she did issue out the coupon. We were then assigned to room 7066. Room key given, no smile still, no thank you whatsoever, didn't even bother pointing where the elevator was until we asked. fantastic service this. Went up to the room, perhaps this was the best part of our stay - the view, I overlooked the arrival runway with the sunset, very good sound proof as well with the double layered glass windows. The room looked dated, curtains seemed dirty (there were dusts falling off we we tried to close the curtains!), kinda disguisting. Waited for 15 minutes the luggage won't come, so I called reception and the lady "R" transferred me to the bell desk, and they actually asked where my luggage tag was and what's the number! so I told him i gave it to the lady at check in, he then advised the bags would be up in 10 minutes, pfff... We then headed out straightaway as we had dinner reservation made at the disneyland hotel, we then noticed the toilet won't flush properly, guess what's the reason? it's all rusty! So we had to pay a visit at the reception desk and asked for assistance. Just glad they had that fixed before we returned. The pillows were way too soft i could hardly sleep. Anyway the next morning we went for breakfast, it was ok but way too crowded. When we returned to the room to enjoy the view just before we leave, i couldn't help but to notice there was a consumed water bottle stucked in the bottom of the sofa! How disguisting was it! On top of this the maid knocked on the door and asked whether we would like to have the room being serviced. I told her we were due to check out so there's no need for that. On normal occations if a room is due to check out you won't go and ask, if a guest wants the room to be serviced he/she would either call or leave the 'clean up' sign lit, this amazed me. Check out was even appalling. The girl 'M' served a western couple with full smile and personalized conversation however when I reached the counter she turned into blank face again, and funny how every time she presents me with something (for e.g. a bill, pen receipts...) she would just look down and just her hands offering me the items as in she's making a bow. Why? Never to the Regals....

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed, but overstretched and a little tired”
Reviews.Author: dave_bish
Reviews.Content: Stopped off at the Regal overnight during a flight connection... nothing much to say, good or bad - it's just a couple of minutes walk from the airport terminal, which is great although the checkin is frequently overwhelmed as large numbers of guests arrive at once. The hotel is enormous, which means that there are long delays on room service (the only food option if you arrive late) and the rooms are ok but a little tired around the edges. Probably the best option for a HK layover, but don't let their website get your hopes too high.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for stopover in HK”
Reviews.Author: Amy M
Reviews.Content: I was flying to Singapore from New York and only had a one night/half a day layover so I decided to stay at the Regal to save myself the hassle of lugging my stuff into the city and back. I used to live in HK so I knew exactly where I wanted to go with my one day to shop and the Regal was super convenient because it's right next to the airport express train which takes you straight to Central. The staff were all very courteous, the room was clean and functional. Maybe a bit dated which is why I give it a 4 instead of 5 but really, it's a business hotel not a fancy vacation hotel so it was perfect for what I needed. They have free wifi in their lobby which was great and also you can walk about 100 feet to the airport and use the HKIA free wifi as well.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed many times”
Reviews.Author: KikiWorld
Reviews.Content: I am a Hong Konger but have stayed at the regal many times over the years if my flight has been very early or my arrivasl has been very late. In terms of convenience this is an awesome location. I stayed here when it first opened I really believed it to be one of the best airport hotels in the world. Sadly, each time I have stayed it has been worse and worse, which is ironic because the room rates have gone in the opposite direction - higher and higher. The last time I stayed (November 2011) will be the last time I stay. The rate I was charged was over US$200 for just one night (actually about 10 hours to be literal). The room smelled both of cigarette smoke and mold. The fittings were simply tatty. I had no access to wireless. The carpet was stained and dirty. The place was more like one that should charge by the hour rather than the night. It's a shame because this is so convenient but therein I suspect is the problem - they get the guests because people do not realise they have other options so I feel very much like they are taking advantage of that fact. But there are other options - the Marriott as well as the Novotel are very close by. Next time I will be going there and not back to the Regal unless they make some serious upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Best airport hotel to spend the night after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: TownsonKowloon
Reviews.Content: My family and I concluded our two-week Easter trip to Berlin and London and returned to Hong Kong. After a long flight, we landed in Hong Kong's international airport around midnight despite very bad weather - raining cats and dogs. As we were very tired and the weather was terrible, we decided to spend the night at the Regal Airport Hotel before returning home in the city centre the next morning. Thanks to the convenient location of Regal, the heavy downpour did not get us wet as the hotel is connected to the airport by an enclosed link bridge. As a regular hotel guest, we got an upgrade this time. Our suite has a family room and a bed room, large and comfortable enough for my family of three. We had the best sleep in days amd woke up the next morning refreshed. The buffet breakfast at the cafe on the lower ground floor was very good too, not to mention the good and friendly services provided by its staff. No wonder, Regal was awarded the best airport hotel title for last couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “No regret to stay at Regal Airport.”
Reviews.Author: lovepp
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the airport at 7am, and it only took me less than ten minutes to the hotel. The staff was friendly and he gave us the room at 8am as the front desk staff realize a little baby and a senior were with me. They gave me the room earlier as cortuesy. I am really appreciated. Excellent services from the front desk and the bell counter staff. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stranger came in, midnight call from reception. Just AWFUL.”
Reviews.Author: GradKavana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just terrible. I stayed one night for an overnight flight with my wife and a small child. After a very long flight, being very tired, we checked in and finally went to bed. But suddenly, the door of our room opened and a stranger came in. We're all astonished saying "who's that?" That stranger said "oh, I am sorry...I've got a room." He got out of our room immediately, however, my wife and child were very frightened and scared. That was over midnight, at 2 am. 15 minutes later, the phone started ringing. It was from the reception. The receptionist repeatedly asked me over the phone " what is your name? how do you spell your name? Who are staying that room?" IT WAS VERY MUCH RUDE and ANNOYING. The reception not only gave our room key to another guest, but also made a terrible phone call at 2:15 am! Did they know what time it was? Did they know why we made a reservation with the airport hotel? Just to sleep! But THEY DIDN'T MAKE US SLEEP AT ALL. We all awoke, couldn't sleep at all. I deeply resent their awfully poor service management. This was the worst ever in my long travel experience. If you need a peaceful night to sleep near the HK airport, don't choose this hotel. The reception might be calling you in midnight to disturb your sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities, convernient for airport, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: PJT99
Reviews.Content: Based ourselves here when staying in Hong Kong on a round the world tour. Rooms were extremely comfortable, pool is very nice, staff were extremely accommodating, and the restaurant choice in the hotel was pretty good. Easy access to airport metro station for quick ride to down town HK. Overall very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel...”
Reviews.Author: bracomo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and it was clean and nice. The beds were so soft and comfortable. They even use memory foam pillow and it was so nice to sleep on. The room was big considering we had two kids with us. the food choices at the buffet was okay. I would definitely come back here to stay

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay, ripoff, just regular rooms”
Reviews.Author: BeNeLuxSoloFemale
Reviews.Content: this hotel you should only book for the location if you really need it, and even than think twice. next time i will for sure make the hassle of taking a shuttle bus to another hotel, for this hotel is totally overpriced and really not worth it. the facilities and luxury is really overstated. the rooms are like any average 4 star hotel, really nothing special at all. in the regular rooms, there is a centralised airco system, which means you cannot regulate the temperature in your room. since the airco was freezing, i had to call 3 times before they brought me a small heater that made a noise like in your grandmothers camper, ridiculous. than there is the internet hassle. ofcourse you need to pay extra, since they try to rip you off at each step in this hotel. it took me again 4 times calling till the internet finally worked. not really a good rest since i had to arrange all this crap. than there is only 2 good sockets in the room, which is far not enough for a modern business traveller, really crazy. so again had to call the concierge, and again 3 times till they understood that i needed extra sockets. so finally after 3 hours trouble i had all i needed, a normal room temperature, internet, and some extra sockets. than due to a customer's appointment i had to stay an extra night in this hotel. i could not stay in the same room for some reason, so i had to move. the bellboy that helped me move my stuff yelled at me that i could not take the heater and the extra sockets with me, i had to call the concierge from the other floor and ask it all again there. i was so angry that i carried the heater myself. than he finally helped me taking it to the other room. settled in the other room, again 3 times calling to get the internet up. on the checkout, i was charged 2 times internet cost since i had used 2 laptops. never ever again this hotel, anywhere but here next time. Hotel Feature Tip: Take the shuttle bus to another hotel, best tip I have.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: UlziijargalS
Reviews.Content: On December I have stayed in this hotel with the group when we back from Saigon to Ulaanbaatar. This hotel is very good option if you have to stay near airport. Comparing with the Saigon's hotel it has very big and clean room, beds were comfortable. Breakfast was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: Smallmars
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located next to the HK Airport and is a direct 5 minutes walk through a covered corridor. Disappointed at the rooms as it looks old and unclean especially in the bathroom area. Actually had coffee stains in the cups of the room also.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view (and a weather system)”
Reviews.Author: burnsy133
Reviews.Content: Lost count of the number of times i have stayed at this hotel but i can say with honesty that this is the first time i have ever had a problem, regardless of that people need to know. Upon arrival i was allocated room 1148 on the club floor, bags arrived as planned and all was well, logged on to check my emails but the Wireless didnt work, rang the club reception to ask and was told to bring my iPad down and they would get it working, that i did and true to her word the lovely lady got it working. Backi n in my room it stopped working again....rang the reception and was invited down again, again she got it working...back to room....stopped working. This time i asked the recptionist to come to my room to fix but she explained she couldnt leave the desk. After another visit she told me that the wireless sometime did not work in 1148 as it was out of range, she explained i should use the ethernet cable. After explaining that the ethernet cable wont work on a iPad i was tyold she could do nothing for me as all the rooms were booked. I left the iPad problem and eventually went to bed, only when all the lights and television were closed down and silence fell on the room did i notice the worlds worst form of torture...drip..drip..drip, I got up to look round but for the life of me could not find out where the dripping noise was coming from, eventually after using my earphones on noise reduction mode i was able to get to sleep...but sleeping in headphones aint the best, after a restless night I woke to open the curtains and tadaa.....the dripping showed its ugly face, in between the outer window and the inner window it was pouring in, I advised reception and she said someone from housekeeping would come...they never did. As i was checking out later that day i decided not to make a fuss about it as i would be leaving soon. I was made aware at 5.30 that my flight had been delayed, I rang the reception to ask about the possibilty of being able to check out at 8pm and not 6 pm, I was told i could at a price of HKD 1650, thats HKD 825 per hour, the reason given was that the hotel was full and my room was booked. I explained that the room still had the leak and was not in a fit state but it all fell on deaf ears. What puzzles me is how could i pay the extra money to stay the extra hours if the room was already booked ???? The other thing to note is that they have installed a coffee machine in each room which they give you 1 pod for, its makes approx 1/4 of the cup they give you to use, if you want more you have to ring reception, even then they can only give you 1 at a time, useless if you want a morning cup of coffee. After being treated this way i think i would try the new marriot at the airport for my future trips..

Reviews.Title: “Convenience for airport but expensive for the quality of the rooms”
Reviews.Author: lee_bear
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on my way from Manila to Thailand and it did its job in that all I wanted was a shower, 7 hours sleep in a well air-conditioned room, another shower and then to leave for my next flight and that's what I got. It is about a ten minute walk from the arrivals at Hong Kong airport and really not well sign posted, I found a Regal Hotel desk and they gave me a map, it only as you get very close there are a lot of signs, you really need them earlier since airport workers didn't seem to know where it is. Check in was thankfully reasonably swift but surprisingly busy at 9.30pm at night. They tried to tell me they had no rooms left with double beds but as soon as I said "well that's kinda what I paid for" they found one. The rooms are quite basic, very similar in feel to some UK budget chain hotels where you might pay £40 to £60 a night. If it wasn't that I completely considered I am mostly paying for convenience and I was so hot, tired and sweaty then I might have felt ripped off at £140 for a few hours in there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Ducksbottom
Reviews.Content: If you are doing a long haul and want a lovely and yet convenient location to stay this is it. The hotel is adjoined to the airport (not airside) so its a very short walk and you're there. We used Club facilities so the rooms were spacious. The hotel was very clean. Staff are great, there's several restaurants within the hotel with heat food. If you want to go into the city centre you catch the train from the airport terminal at minimal cost, so all on all it's very convenient. There is a great spa on site if you've a weary body. This would always be my first choice of location while having a short stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: JohnStinger
Reviews.Content: Great location but your gonna pay for it. Credit card machines didn't work for myself or 5 other guest. I paid cash in by doing that they actually sent attended to lock the minibar/snack area in your room. For what you get it seemed very expensive, and is no better quality than you would find at say a holiday inn or marriott. The bar was expensive, but overall the inconvenience of having to go somewhere else was worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: singhsaurabh1
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel right inside the HKG airport. Best to see the take off landings from the window if you nothing to do at all. Food at its best. Staff tries to do the best they can. Just cross the customs and take a left turn and you are in the lobby of the hotel. No need to go to the city for a short business trip. Hotel also has transport facility to mainland china and manufacturing hubs in guangzhou.

Reviews.Title: “Take a ride downtown to avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: BeachedExplorers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 712(6?) for one night, on 19 April 2012. This room was paid for by Dragonair, as their delayed flight caused us to miss our connection.  Hotel: It is around an 8-12 minute walk from immigration and customs, and is convenient for terminal 1 check in desks (just a walk along the corridor, an up-escalator ride and you're by check in desk J - it's about a 5 minute walk if you need desks at the lower end of the alphabet).  The lobby and other public areas were nicely decorated.  Room: We were first allotted room 2108, with two single twin beds that couldn't be pushed together. The room stank of drains, bed linen was damp, and it overlooked a indoor car park with a light shining through the very thin curtains.  They kindly moved us to the seventh floor, to a room with one queen and one single bed. This smelt better, although bed linen was still damp and signs of damp up the walls, especially around the queen-sized bed.  At the right hand side of the queen sized bed, the 'night light' had been pulled out of the wall, so although the light worked, it did so from an open socket. I was glad we didn't have a young child crawling around the floor to find such potential hazards.  Amenities were the bare essentials, but at least they were there.  Bathroom was clean, although the bath mat stank of mildew / damp.  Service: This wasn't particularly good. We waited over half an hour just to get the room key.  When we changed room, we were told we should not go to sleep (it was now 12.45am!) until someone had locked the minibar in the new room. When no one had come by 1.30am,  we called reception, who said someone would be right up and to wait for them to arrive before retiring. No one came. Eventually, at 2am, we put the do not disturb on and went to sleep.  Room Service: Unbelievably, room service had run out of ice cream, and large bottles of water. The baked cheesecake was acceptable.  Overall: Appalling service, appalling levels of damp in the rooms. For one night, it's almost acceptable. Almost.  Stay again? No way. We'd seek an alternative airport hotel, or stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and customer care”
Reviews.Author: peter l
Reviews.Content: Check in took for ever, so did check out, staff at the desk are unpleasant, no bell boy to help with luggage,the operator told my daughter who tried to reach me by phone that I was not a guest in the hotel, she insisted and he told her that indeed I had been there but had checked out five hours before..which was not true, I was waiting for the call in my room.Key did not work to enter the room and I had to go back to reception crossing the super long corridor and wait in line ten minutes before I was finally given a new key which worked.I wonder why it is rated among the best airport hotels when service is so pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary B
Reviews.Content: We were coming home from a two week trip to China, and needed an airport hotel due to an early departure. We chose the Regal over the Marriott, and wish we had not. The Regal is a tired hotel, the staff doesn't try, our room was not incredibly clean. Check out was frustrating, huge lines of people, not enough staff, and we were charged twice for our room service from the night before, further delaying our departure. I will say that the covered walkway over to the airport was a plus, but in hindsight, I'd take the Marriott and it's quick free shuttle over.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: pvdg
Reviews.Content: I usually avoid airport hotels like the plague, but the Regal at HK is very good. Clean spacious room, good dining facilities and a reasonable room rate.

Reviews.Title: “The Regal Airport Hotel, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Smile888
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and have stayed at numerous hotels all over the world, I have to rate the Regal Airport Hotel one of the best I have stayed in. - It is right at the airport, ideal for you if you are passing through, if you are not, they have their own shuttle going into town daily. - Rooms are big - Service is excellent, esp. the concierges. Don't be afriad to ask them for anything. Their can do attitudes are what sets them apart from the other hotels I stayed in - Godd restaurants, their Rouge restaurant serves great Cantonese food. The coffee shop and the other restaurants are not far behand - One of the best gym. It is a good size, with a lot of machines. Really like the yoga room they have. Very, very few hotels I have stayed in have a yoga room. - One of the best Club Lounges.

Reviews.Title: “Paying for convenience of location”
Reviews.Author: Avid_Reader_10
Reviews.Content: Location! The only reason we booked this hotel was for 1 night as we were meeting friends and immediately off the next day for mainland China departing from HKG so this was most convenient. Arrival at HKG around 18:00, over 14 hours cummulative travel time so we wanted a place close, no fuss, no hunting, no maps. Connected to the terminal and didn't even have to go outside into the heat and humidity. Price! Ouch, yes, it was the priciest hotel of our month long trip but you are paying for convenience. Will admit the 1 night cost choked at booking time but by the time we arrived, we were ever so thankful we made this choice. Food! Well, can't say we at there because the airport terminal was right next door and there were so many choices there. Dinner and breakfast at airport was tad pricier but it was good, adequate and being tired, you are not really in the mood to look long or far. Convenient Location! Yes, will say it again. Worth the $$$ as due to a luggage plane transfer mishap, we went back to the airport to find the office for the airline after check-in and a quick nap to discuss how our luggage was going to catch up to us. Much easier to do this in person than over the phone - and we tried over the phone first. Room! Nothing special. Nicely appointed as expected for Hong Kong. The bed was described as a queen but is really a double. It was fairly firm and hard and on a good day might not be the most comfortable but for exhausted travelers, was sufficient. Little noisy in hallway at times but nothing terrible, again we were pretty tired. Recommend? Yes, if only for a single night between travel or business trip. Probably find much better places and value for longer stays elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Legend26
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Regal Airport Hotel Hong Kong (1200 rooms). Excellent standard of accommodation, english speaking and very helpful staff. Direct rail, bus transportation to Hong Kong (20 minutes by train, 1 hour by bus). There are several good restaurants in the hotel complex, the rooms are quiet and very clean. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for transit through HK airport. Very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: CarKri02
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at the RAH for transit through HK with a long stopover enroute between Australia & Canada. The hotel is perfectly located an easy 2 minute walk from the immigration/arrivals hall area via an enclosed signed walkway - simply allow 1-1.5 hours to pass back through immigration/security and make your way to the gate (in actual fact this has only taken us 20 mins each time, but you should of course allow more time than that!). Day Use enables you to stay at the hotel for a 10 hour period between the hours of 9am-9pm. Unfortunately, you cannot book Day Use via their online booking engine, but I used the "contact us" link on their website and arranged everything easily via email. We opted for a Regal Club Room with Club privileges - on arrival at reception we were politely directed to the Club Lounge for check-in. The Club staff were excellent - polite, courteous and helpful. Check-in and check-out was efficient, and despite arriving at 7.30am our room was available immediately. I was disappointed that our room did not have a view of the runway as expected with a Club room, but then was delighted to see that we had actually been given a suite which had a separate living area and small private courtyard which was perfect for us travelling with our 2 children. The decor in the rooms is plain, but they are clean & comfortable, and whisper quiet with good blockout curtains if you are trying to catch some sleep before boarding your next flight. In our short stay, we managed to use the swimming pool, get a massage (lovely health spa and excellent masseuses), and have a buffet breakfast (good range, ok quality, but feels a bit like a cafeteria but not really an issue for a short stay - if you have Club Privileges you can have breakfast in the Club Lounge instead which is a nicer atmosphere but less range of food and children are not allowed). Overall, a great hotel for day use or a short stay where you do not want to travel into the HK CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: psa_jl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel numerous times. Excellent service. Good food and attentive staff. The hotel has a complimentary shuttle to Regal Kowloon for hotel guests. Transportation is not a problem at all wherever you intend to go. Taxis, buses and trains abound aside from the fact that the airport is its neighbor. The connecting walkway provides protection for the hotel guests from the cold or heat outside. The rooms are pretty much what you generally see in 4-5 star hotels. I was with my 2yo daughter this time around and it was easy to get transportation to the nearby Disneyland resort via taxi, and to downtown Hong Kong via the AEL.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: Chinx259
Reviews.Content: Absolute must for the exhausted traveller. Is at the airport and a perfect place to recharge your batteries. Hotel decor is lovely with lots of water features etc. Free internet for an hour for guests on the in-house computers. Friendly staff. Rooms and bathroom super clean. Overall a nice experience for a first time visitor to Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel - and no noise....”
Reviews.Author: exozzie
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights here and was pleasantly surprised at how quiet the room was given the location. The room was very large which made the layover bearable and it was easy to work here. There was a mix up with the cost of wi-fi and breakfast which my travel coordinator insists was in the rate. The wi-fi wasn't a huge rate (about $20 for 24 hours) anyway and guests can always go to the business centre and pick up a token for 2 free hours of wi-fi (works in the lobby area, which is a nice location to work in). I got the business centre to do some scanning for me - no problems at all and very reasonable pricing. Staying at the airport makes it so easy for an early morning flight, and if you want to go into the city for a look around the Airport Express train is a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DanW725
Reviews.Content: The huge plus for this hotel is obviously the fact it is right in the terminal....perfect for when you are totally chinstrapped from a flight from the US or Europe. The hotel is nice and stylish, the rooms are good (beds a little hard but no big deal). The desk staff seem a bit hit or miss...had some great ones, others not so hot. I'm giving this a 3* mainly based on price - I think its a bit excessive. I understand you pay for convenience, but to my mind it ought to be more in the US$200 range per night rather than US$260+ I will stay here again after a mega flight with a connector in the morning again...but if I were not traveling so far and didn't have severe jetlag or the flights arrived at reasonable times, I'd go to one of the other close by hotels and save $100+

Reviews.Title: “Beds fall short and too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Shudjan
Reviews.Content: Pro's Location at airport. China Bar and Grill Restaurant O.K. Good links to transport networks. Con's Rooms are noisy as housekeeping could be turning over a room at any time of day/night Aircraft noise frequently heard if room is on runway side of hotel. Beds are quite hard and pillows are a waste of time. This contributes to a bad neck.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stopover”
Reviews.Author: ChikitaLyn
Reviews.Content: We chose to stopover at the Regal Airport Hotel in Hong Kong enroute to Europe to break up our trip. Had made a reservation for a triple room and on arrival into the allocated room was confronted with two single beds. Not very happy with that as it would have been helpful had we been told that early check-in was the reason for being allocated the two singled bedded room. On returning to the reception desk a suitable room was allocated and the reason for oddity explained. Unnecessary when the adequate room was available. Hotel room was clean and the staff otherwise polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pure convenience”
Reviews.Author: inspectors001
Reviews.Content: Arrived at HK International at 21h30pm from Dubai, we could not connect to our flight to Taipei Taiwan that evening we decided to overnight at the Regal airport hotel for the night, reception staff were friendly and the room was average, the bathroom was dated and old, the room rate was pricey given the standard of the room, but it paid for convenience since the hotel is just 5 minutes walk from the airport. The restaurants and bars closed fairly early, but we managed to have a drink at the casual bar on the ground floor. We recommend this hotel for its location and easy access to airport.

Reviews.Title: “One if the best airport hotels ive been”
Reviews.Author: Antonio A
Reviews.Content: Great location, good rooms, staff is nice and competent, food is good, very clean! Basicallt everything you could expect from a good hotel! Really liked it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stop over hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marnie S
Reviews.Content: We had a very smooth check in service even though we were behind a massive group- would recommend paying extra like we did on a short stop over for a 24 hr reservation to check in straight away if you are coming in from an over night flight (came to) $280 AUD. We checked in had a couple of hrs sleep had a shower to refresh and then went sight seeing around midday- very easy to navigate to central hong kong from here also very easy to catch a taxi back to late at night if you miss the last train. As wee checked in online we only really had to leave the hotel 1.5 hrs before our international flight which was great. Rooms were large and clean- perfect toiletry range for a stop over. Staff friendly. Only negative was that we requested a non smoking room due to severe allergies. We were on a non smoking floor but the aircondition must cycle through the whole building carrying the disgusting smoking floor smell with it it permeated everything in the room and made me feel a little ill. This is typical of most asian hotels though- I just wish they would have a smoking room only on the ground and leave the rest of the hotel smoke free- I guess its hard to argue when so many people smoke over there though. All in all it was a good stop over

Reviews.Title: “NOISY, uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: carrisi
Reviews.Content: The good: 1) 5 min walk to terminal 2) can fit family of 4 into two queen beds in one room The bad: 1) Unbelievably NOISY - paper thin walls (locals dont talk, they shout), incredibly loud plumbing, poor insulation from aircraft noise, occasional loud events downstairs. MAKE SURE you bring ear plugs if you are not a heavy sleeper. 2) Uncomfortable beds - they seem to have replaced the old mattresses with ones that rise (not dip) in the middle. This means I kept rolling to the edge, and was unable to sleep on my side without rolling over (a real problem). Worst night sleep ever. 2) Terrible bathroom - you can only sit on (not in) the bath because it is so shallow, sometimes its dirty, water unable to hold constant temperature, bath sometimes doesnt drain 3) Check in/out can take forever if you arrive at the wrong time Overall, very inferior to the Novotel Tung Chung which has better rooms, bathrooms, local amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: lovepp
Reviews.Content: My third time in this hotel, excellent staff from Front desk. Luggage was sent quickly and quick check in. There is no other hotel closer to the airport. Good location for early flight visitor like me.

Reviews.Title: “The slow and the dirty”
Reviews.Author: mrsmupps
Reviews.Content: We arrived with our 10 month old son from a long haul flight hoping to find a clean, quiet place to rest....uh not likely if you stay at the Regal Airport Hotel. There were hairs on the bed, towels, in the bathroom and marks on the linen that looked a bit suspect. We asked to be transferred to a clean room, and were moved to another room on the same floor which was even worse...dirty bathroom, plugs in the sink and bath were broken so we could not bathe our baby. Had to ring down to front desk to request a cot THREE times, also our bags took 40 minutes to get to our room, which when you have a hungry baby waiting to be fed is not fast enough. Rooms are old, noisy: could hear people in other bathrooms, corridors smell of smoke and the decor is a bit dated. I'd stay at the Mariott or the Novotel if you are staying overnight with an early flight, avoid the Regal Airport Hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Only if your flight leaves early the next morning”
Reviews.Author: aabucko
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong's airport—while spiffy—is set on a pretty remote island. So with only 2 hotels nearby, you can't beat the convenience of this place (especially when you're arriving at 11pm). Given its near monopoly status, all-in-all it wasn't too bad.
