Check-in took less than five minutes, our room was clean, service efficient. Some drawbacks however: -Upon check-in, I was asked what time I planned on leaving the next morning. In all my years of travel nobody's ever asked me that, it doesn't seem like the most hospitable question. (Later I learned that the hotel also rents by the hour to weary travelers needing a shower/nap, so it behooved them to know I'd be leaving by 8am). -Our tub/shower didn't drain, and accumulated at least a foot of water after each use. -A mid-sized plastic bottle of Evian placed on our nightstand cost $9USD. Come on. My advice: If you're arriving after 6pm and need to depart again the next morning, it's really one of your only options. (Just be sure to stock up on water and snacks at the airport druggist first). If not, take the 24 minute Airport Express into Kowloon, and get yourself a nice dinner (and handbag) with the money you save!

Reviews.Title: “For one night it would be ok”
Reviews.Author: JanSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok but would prefer to stay at the Novotel Citygate which is far superior for similar money.The good points are Is that it is in a very good position, walking distance and close to the terminal and would be ok for a one night stay.It is clean and adequate and has a nice gym and spa. The main problem for us was the food in the restaurant was expensive and awful. We had to wait a long time to get Chicken and Rice.The wait staff did not speak English and the Manager was very rude.We ordered a bottle of water which never came and waited far too long to get the food.As this hotel is close to right at the airport it is very noisy with the planes coming into land at all hours of the night.If you are not a light sleeper than it may not disturb you but it did me.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and dreadful front desk”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel and probably our last. It classes itself as one of the best airport hotels in the world but it isn’t even close to, say, the Kempinsky in Munich or the Fairmount in Vancouver. On the plus side, the rooms are spacious, quiet and clean, internet service is fast (but overpriced) and the restaurants were quite good. It is also of course convenient for the airport. On the minus side, check-in was appallingly slow, inefficient and unfriendly. It took half an hour before we were checked in and there were only two couples in front of us. Each check in required about a half dozen treks into the back office and searching through files of documents. And there were only two people on duty. When asked if there could be more staff available for check in we were curtly told that they were the only ones on duty. Not a smile during the entire experience. That was by far the worst thing wrong, but by no means the only one. The hotel is hideously overpriced for what it is. Next time we will pay the Airport Express charge and stay downtown. And there were other inexplicable deficiencies. In the room there was NOT ONE spare plug-in. To use our laptop we had to disconnect a lamp, and most lamps could not be unplugged because they were hard-wired into the wall. Fortunately, we always carry an extension cord and power bar; otherwise we would have been stymied for cell phone and kindle rechargers. Lastly, there were two pens in the room. Both were out of ink! Hopeless, and a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a hotel adjacent to a major airport”
Reviews.Author: MarionBurkimsher
Reviews.Content: We were arriving late in Hong Kong and leaving early after our 2nd night, so wanted to stay as close as possible to the airport. This hotel provided exactly what we needed. It is large, but not a high rise, and the rooms are completely soundproofed, so there was no aircraft noise. Considering that it really is only 2 minutes walk through a covered walkway from the terminal building, then it was remarkably reasonable in price - especially considering that this is Hong Kong! We enjoyed swimming in the pool, although it is only small, and also used the (single-sex) sauna. The breakfast was expensive, so we walked through to the airport terminal and had a big choice of cheaper eateries. It was wet, cool and very grey weather when we were there, but if it had been nicer, I think there would have been lovely views. We would certainly stay there again if we travelled to Hong Kong - it would be a peaceful getaway from the overcrowded life of Hong Kong island or Kowloon, but they are easy to reach by train when you are fully rested. Sadly you have to pay extra for wifi, something that always annoys me.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for a quick stopover.”
Reviews.Author: couscous74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. It was an easy short walk from the airport Arrivals Hall to the hotel lobby. I was upgraded to Executive floor. The room smelled faintly of smoke, but it faded once the A/C got running. I was facing HKIA's South runway and could occasionally hear aircraft as they were taking off. It was not loud enough to wake you, but once you were awake, you could hear it. The gym was well equipped and available 24 hours. The free breakfast on the Executive floor had very few options, although the wait staff were attentive and very polite. For food choices, you are really better off walking a short distance back to the airport terminals and eating there, where there are many eateries to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: lovepp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I had a very early flight back to Australia. The staff was professional and friendly. Quick check-in and out. Best choice for a business person who has transit at Hong long Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Smells like cigarettes”
Reviews.Author: stockholmharriet
Reviews.Content: Avoid! Dirty, sink is backed up with water, and rooms and hotel aisles reek of cigarette smoke. We were switched to a non-smoking room only to be greeted with a smell of strong chemicals. Old furniture and uncomfortable beds. In no way a 5 star...I would say it is a 2 star on it's good days. Walking to our room took too long..not enough elevators! AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Better than average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris2421356707655
Reviews.Content: No complaints at all, although be aware the walls are thin (seems to be typical of airport hotels...) so you'll hear the neighbours if they're noisy...!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient overnight hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolinerevell
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Australia we broke our trip for an overnight stay in Hong Kong. We chose this hotel for the sole reason that is actually within the terminal building and for an early morning flight this was absolutely convenient. The hotel run a shuttle bus to their sister hotel in the city so you don't have to miss out on the sights and sounds of Hong Kong main. Reception was uncrowded but I have read reviews that say that this is not always the case. We were given rooms on the 11th floor which were right next to the elevator. The noise from them was constant and annoying. As soon as I complained we were moved immediately to a quieter room. The restaurants are overpriced and poorly staffed and we waited far longer than we should have done for service. The meal was not up to the standard one would expect for this calibre of hotel. Bedrooms were adequate. Ours had mountain views but I know there are others with sea and runway views. All in all a good place to stay if you are touching down for a night but I certainly wouldn't use it if I had more time in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Stay if you want the easiest way to airport”
Reviews.Author: kaartma
Reviews.Content: I often stay in this hotel but not for the service and definitely not because of the price (expensive); it is so conveniently located where it takes 3 minutes from check-out desk of the hotel to arrive into check-in desk of the airline! For a business person who loves sleeping long - this is my choice for early flights from HK. Price - usually high but can be lower than the Novotel further away from airport, service - not good, check-in - usually crowded, internet - costs a lot unless you book via their own website. (so better to use their website when booking!)

Reviews.Title: “Check the bathroom's drainage first!”
Reviews.Author: widespreadvisitor
Reviews.Content: After a 14 hour flight, we were looking forward to some nice dim sum and some good sleep. Although we got both eventually, the first impression of this hotel was appalling, to say the least. If there is one thing I cannot stand in a hotel, it is one where the bathroom drainage holes don't drain. And this is exactly what we encountered!!!!! Initially when we checked in, we were told no rooms with king sized bed. I had to insist on it, after which they found one non-smoking king sized bedroom. We lugged our baggage up and .... beware... the next part of this story is highly dramatic... so if you have a weak heart - don't read any further. Imagine, after a 14 hour journey, the desire to use the toilet was intense. I went in to use the toilet and afterwards, naturally, had to clean myself. When I did - I realized that the drainage hole in the shower area didn't drain at all, AT ALL!!! Can you imagine the disgust I felt? I called the receptionist immediately, but got some silly answer from the operator that they will get the receptionist to call me back. I waited two minutes and kept calling back the same number three times. Finally, I got an answer from the supervisor, who said he will change the room for us and I told him I want a change IMMEDIATELY. I then got a rather rude person, a butler, who came and took us to another room with a king sized bed, non-smoking. (By the way, where from did this room suddenly appear? as we were told no single king sized bed room was available, initially) I really feel sorry for the poor soul who had to clean up that bathroom that day.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient when stopping over, but that's all”
Reviews.Author: OnetwentyOTR
Reviews.Content: The only reason to stay at the Regal is the convenient location if you are stopping over between flights in Hong Kong. Exit from the arrivals level, turn left, and walk about 200 metres through the covered bridgeway, and there you are. The hotel itself is getting tired--clean but showing the wear and tear, and the rooms have always been noisy--you hear the adjacent rooms and cleaing staff in the hallway. On this visit, the TV did not work well--an intermittent problem with reception, and the internet (not free) worked well in the evening, but the next morning could not connect. Not that big a deal since I was headed to the airport and its free high speed wifi, but still inconvenient. The Mariott near the airport is nicer, but has the inconvenience of having to take a shuttle bus. If you are in Hong Kong for more than connecting flights, there are lots of better options. If you are connecting, then the Regal with all its flaws may still be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: i_travel_2_eat
Reviews.Content: Contrary to many reviewers' inconvenience, our check-in/out was smooth. You can go in and out of the airport terminal building, where you can eat and do a little grocery shopping, even buy park ticket vouchers at a cheaper price! Rooms are comfortable and spacious, pleasant staff. If only this hotel were located in the city center...

Reviews.Title: “An unpleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Serene T
Reviews.Content: My husband was there for a conference and we were given a place to stay at this hotel as it was near the Asia World Expo. I read the reviews and like what was reviewed by other travelers, service at the hotel is really quite appalling. It took us a really long time to check in. We arrived in the evening and with 2 toddlers in tow, we wanted to check in fast. But we waited for almost 30 mins before some one attended to us. I asked why there were only 3 staff at the reception and he replied that the hotel is understaffed. Considering that this is a hotel with a few hundred rooms, surely more staff should be employed to meet the large number of guests? The funny thing was, there were a few people who kept coming out of the room and they didn't bother to attend to the long line of travelers waiting for their turn to be checked in. And what made matters worse was, the receptionist wrote the wrong room number on our card and we had to travel down again to get the right room. Not only were they understaffed at the reception, they were also understaffed at the cafe where the buffet breakfast was served. No one comes to serve u and basically everything is self-served. So when you require a cup of hot milk,you need to hunt for the waiter. Why? Because they are either trying to replenish the food, running in and out of the kitchen or they are busy clearing away the plates. Food was alright but not the best I have eaten. Cuppaccino was dispensed from a DIY machine and somehow this doesn't do much when you have a large number of guests attending a conference and having breakfast before that. We also had dinner at the Chinese restaurant and we waited for almost an hr before our food came. Reason: the chef had to shuttle between the restaurant and an on-going dinner event held that night. My husband and I stayed at the club room while my kids stayed with my mum in a deluxe room. The club room was small but comfortable. At least the shower was good. The shower in the deluxe room wasn't working well. The Hot n Cold water shower was erratic and showering was quite a pain. This hotel is best for just an overnight stay. We stayed there for 5 nights and we took the airport express to the city. It was convenient but if given a choice,I would not have stayed at this hotel. And why this hotel was voted the 'World's best airport hotel' beats the heck out of me.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: emkolb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in January as a stop over in HK between Guangzhou and the US. The Regal connects directly to the airport though a short enclosed skywalk, so very convenient! You can even take your free airport luggage cart to the bell desk when you check in and when you check out your bags go down and are loaded back onto a luggage cart to return to the airport. We were a couple with a newly adopted child so this was a nearly stress free transfer. We also had dinner in the basic hotel resturaunt which looks like a buffet but has off the menu selections as well at reasonable prices. The kids menu is extensive and also reasonably priced. Our room was clean and comfortable and quiet for an airport hotel. They brought a nice crib for our child right up and I do not think there was an extra charge. The gym was nice, uncrowded and open long hours. Remember that HK requires a UK-style plug for electronic devices which is different than what you need in Mainland China. For a single night between flights this hotel is hard to beat, if only there were more like this in the US! I would not stay here if planning to spend time in HK proper as it is a long and fairly expensive taxi ride and (we were told) a little expensive by train as well, plus why would you want to miss the hustle and bustle and views of staying right in HK or Kowloon?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: BruceWyder
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Hong Kong Regal Airport,since it opened. It is in my opinion one of the best Airport hotels in the World. They have a great indoor outdoor pool, several different restaurants, a couple of great bars including my favourite, the China Coast, where Marco is the best bartender. The food is excellent wherever you go and what amazes me, I go into the bar and my drink is poured immidiatley! The rooms are spacious and the executive level club is very nice and you can get great snacks daily and they also serve breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best Airport Hotel in Asia”
Reviews.Author: DivingUK
Reviews.Content: I havbe just stayed at The Regal for 2 nights and I must sayby far the best airport hotel I have stayed in for a long time./ It desrves its awards of the best airport hotel in Asia. The team there has gone beyond the call of duty to accomodate my particular times for cleaning my room, my special diat requirements. All team members I have engaged with were very pro-active friendly and would not rest until I was satisfied, they have really gone beyond...and this for a hotel of this size (1200rooms). This is the first aiport hotels I felt they are really trying to give you a personalised experience...well done to The Regal Team. Seeing the GM in the lobby actively engaging with guest was something I have not seen in an airport hotel for ages...my respect, your recipe for success is surely right! Based on my experience I can only highly recommend The Regal to frequent travellers! Thank you to the entire team to make my stay such a positivbe experience, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: mjgdlg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for one night because we missed a connection from London to Auckland. Cathay Pacific provided us a voucher for bed and breakfast. This followed the snow delays at Heathrow. We checked in at about mid-night, amongst about 180 others (we counted the vouchers the next morning!). A young female receptionist took our voucher to check us in, but did not say a word to us until she told us our room number and pointed one direction, then changed her mind and pointed the other way. When we went to the room, we found it was a smoking room (having got used to not having to ask in the UK). It smelled awful, so we went straight back to reception to the same receptionist, rather than going to the back of a very long queue. She was finishing off serving another guest but was talking on her i-phone. We noticed she was extremely animated on her phone, smiling and joking to whoever she was talking to, something she failed to do with us or the guest in front of her. The receptionist finished her call and then continued without speaking to the guest in front of her except to tell her the room number. When the guest she was dealing with was leaving, she was given the same vague waving of arms in both directions we were given and the receptionist wasn't paying any attention. We told the receptionist we couldn't stay in the room we were given, because it was a smoking room. Again, there was no communication with us. Whilst we were being dealt with another guest spoke to the receptionist asking for directions to her room, the receptionist looked up and waved in a general direction to her right. The young female guest looked confused and ended up standing to one side waiting to speak to another receptionist. We were given a room number and yet again were given two directions to go in, having already been to the lifts, we knew where to go. The room was ok, functional and clean. We struggled to get the shower working but then whilst my wife was showering I read a letter on the table in the bedroom. This explained about the hotel doing repairs to the hot water system overnight. At this point I remembered seeing a guest checking in with another receptionist who was being shown a letter and the receptionist pointing out something in it. When we went for breakfast, we were asked for a voucher, but we didn't have one. The staff in the restaurant made enquiries with reception whilst we were eating but at the end we were told by a male member staff that reception had told him we needed to pay. After a discussion, he gave us the bill and asked us to go to sort it out with reception. As this was an unscheduled stop, we didn't have all out toileteries, so decided to pop into the airport terminal immediately adjacent to the hotel to go and buy some deodorant, before we went to reception. As we were about half-way down the walk-way the staff member from the restaurant caught up with us and demanded we go to reception to sort out the bill. We tried to explain that we hadn't checked out and we were planning to deal with the bill in about 20 minutes. He was agitated and wanted it dealt with immediately. We went back with him to reception, it felt as if we were being escorted back as if we had been trying to sneak off without paying. Back at reception, we were dealt with by another female receptionist who was efficient and helpful, the member of staff from the restaurant standing constantly by our side. The receptionist found the vouchers from Cathay Pacific (she told us 180) and looked through them. She didn't find us the first time, so my wife and I took a third each and helped her. I found the voucher which clearly showed it included breakfast. The member of staff from the restaurant was given our vouchers and left without saying another word to us, no apology for our inconvenience. We asked to speak to a manager to complain about the poor service the previous night and the receptionist promptly brought back a supervisor. He was helpful and appeared to listen to what we said. He said he would speak to her and suggested the receptionist ahould have dealt with the guests as a priority. He said he would make a note of our complaint and would see if the receptionist needed some training or a warning. Although he was helpful, my wife and I were not convinced anything would happen.

Reviews.Title: “Awkward.”
Reviews.Author: MissAfternoonDelight
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night on the way home from a business trip with a friend from work. We booked a twin room, but they had obviously overbooked, and gave us a room that was actually a spa treatment room. We had to sleep on a double mattress on the floor, which was pretty awkward. Oh, and the room had no windows. The airconditioning didn't seem to work very well. And check in was disorganised, and they made us feel like it was our fault they didn't have it together. We weren't expecting much; we were just looking for a place to lay our heads. Still, we expected more. I'd have to be desperate to go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, spacious and all as you would expect really.”
Reviews.Author: HellFireandDamnation
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we are lazy ultimately and had an early morning flight and you can’t beat the convenience. It does seem quite expensive at first (which it is) and initially you do think you are paying for the convenience but actually we worked out that go a little further out and pay for the extra travel back in it isn’t that much more. (plus what is an hour in bed extra worth!) In fact, we stayed there incoming and outgoing and one of the stays was cheaper than the other so you may be lucky. Restaurants were good. Lots of choice. We went to the Japanese one which was empty. (Odd, you got the feeling that the whole hotel is not busy at all but it must be! Just vast.) Something was off the menu due to the earthquake and no food being allowed into Hong Kong but didn’t affect our meal at all! Was a reasonable price. There was a steak restaurant I think, or one that did that type of food, that was expensive. Two pools. Don’t know how cold the outside one was but the inside one was freezing! It had rained for most of our holiday and we wanted to let our 3 year old swim as much as possible before going home but we couldn’t stand being in it for very long! Bed was lovely, really comfortable and big. Check-in and out – they needed more staff, the queuing time is not good. It was not because of an extra party either, it was individual travellers queuing. I note that this has since been addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, at the airport, but bad service”
Reviews.Author: TFK79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basically quite nice, the problem was that I arrived late at approx 23:00 and there were just 2 check in guys at the receiption and approx. 30 guests (i'm not exaggerating) queueing up to check in... It took very long, just to check me in was 15min - I was lucky and was first in the queue... The location of the hotel is very good for business travellers for stop-over lodging...

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: hargar
Reviews.Content: Located at Hkg international terminal. Rooms very clean but on the small side. Friendly staff and great choice of restaurants. Perfect for o/night stopover

Reviews.Title: “Double-edged sword if you stay during a typhoon or storm”
Reviews.Author: IvanAlan
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at the HK Airport Regal Hotel due to weather problems in the region. Lots of flights cancelled and what seemed like hundreds of passengers from said cancelled flights queuing for miles on arrival to check in. The check-in staff, as mentioned, were slow and while they were trying to be friendly, their patience was obviously wearing thin with so many passengers having to stay the night because flight had been delayed. That being said, the hotel has been open over a decade - you'd think they'd have experience of managing the unexpected? The rooms are pleasant enough and perfectly comfortable - though we found clipped toe nails from a previous guest scattered over part of the carpet. The views are okay. We stayed in two rooms, one looking over airport, the other looking towards the bay that lies north (?) of the airport. The second room (on the northside) felt far smaller than the first. As for food in the hotel, there are a few outlets. But because there were so many people in the hotel, we were compelled to go back to the terminal buidling to find food because the queues (again) were so long at the hotel restaurants. One final

Reviews.Title: “Well placed for those transiting Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: jcerovac
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to overnight in Hong Kong, but I needed a hotel convenient to public transport and to the airport. The Regal Airport Hotel filled that niche, but did so with style and grace. I found the room to be remarkably comfortable, and the service of the staff to be on par with the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. The room is a comfortable size, and the bed makes for an excellent nights rest after a long flight. The breakfast buffet, though a little pricey for breakfast in general, more than made up for the cost in variety and quality. After such a good nights rest and an excellent breakfast, I was ready to tackle this quick visit to Hong Kong. The only complaint I would have is the front desk, for check-in and check-out, was short staffed, leading to a longish queue. I would happily stay here again, despite the long queue, the comfort and ease of transport into Hong Kong via the Airport Express Train, make this an ideal hotel for those in Hong Kong for only a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Deplorable Service”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: The check in staff is just plain horrible. I booked through American Express and the staff could not find my reservation, and after a 9 hour flight just to get there it was 12AM already. Instead of doing something proactive the young man at the check-in simply shrugged his shoulders. I had to boot up my lap top to give them a confirmation number, and he made me wait again in line for the check in. He could not find the reservation number again and simply ignored me from there. After i got a little short a young woman came over who was more motivated and she suggested we sort it out in the morning so I could at least get a room and sleep. I agreed and they made me sign that i agreed to pay a lot more for the room in case they would be unable to find the Amex res. I was so tired I agreed and went off to bed. In the morning it was all sorted out. It took more than 45 minutes to check -in, not acceptable at all for a 200 a night hotel. Terrible Service.

Reviews.Title: “Best airport hotel in the world---- far from the truth”
Reviews.Author: MarteinnE
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times for the past 6 years as I´m a airline crew. This hotel used to be good however, after my 5-10 stays I must sadly say that the quality has deteriorated a lot. The check in and check out is terrible. The check in normally takes up to an hour and check out around 30 minutes. Last time I tried to enter my room my key didin´t work so I had to go back to the reception where I had to wait for 30 minutes for them to reprogram my key. The rooms are dirty, the toilet didin´t flush, the shower/bathtub was dirty and full of hairs from previous guests and logging into the the very slow and expensive internet really is some experiance, something like you´re logging into NASA stage 5 access.. Food options in the hotel are very expensive, food is good thoug and the staff is friendly I stay in hotels around 190 days a year. My rating for Hong Kong Regal Airport hotel is 3 stars at maximum

Reviews.Title: “Stop over haven”
Reviews.Author: watercolourpainter
Reviews.Content: Arriving from Sydney late in the evening, we were pleased to find we were able to have a very nice meal and a couple of drinks before retiring. The hotel, as most Hong Kong hotels, had an amazing reception area. The staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms were very spacious and clean with huge beds. The hotel joins the airport via a walkway so is ideal for a short stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel For Hong Kong, but a Good Transit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TranspaciFlyer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the past few years. Initially, it really did deserve the high marks and it was perfect in many ways. However, after my two most recent stays in the past month, I regret to advise that the hotel quality has deteriorated. Checkin used to take a few minutes, now it is a wait of 10-15 minutes. Same for checkout. My rooms were supposed to have come with internet access included, but no such luck, My room rate was supposed to allow FF points, but the desk clerk(s) said no. If you book 45 days in advance you can take advantage of the reduced non refundable rate. Food options in the hotel are quite expensive. Seriously, HK$130 for a bagel? The airport itself has a Starbucks and food options and a 7-11 if one is put off by the prices. I think the small 10ml bottle of mouthwash in the room was HK$18. Nice. Overall, the hotel is a convenient & comfortable airport hotel that is superior to anything found in North America or Europe. However, for those unaccustomed to HK prices, there will be sticker shock. The rooms are showing their age; Remote TV controller in room didn't function on many buttons, room carpet was a bit worn, towels a bit threadbare etc. On two most recent visits, 1 time card to turn on lights was tempermental, and on other, door was not aligned so the lock was difficult to use. Consider this as a transit hotel and it is fine. Any other use and IMO it's a mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Only reason to stay here is for the location”
Reviews.Author: foodieMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overpriced and a little bit of a dump. It's connected to the airport, however, so if you have an early morning flights, it's very convenient. I was given a room with 2 Twin beds (what hotels still have TWIN BEDS?!), and when I tried to order breakfast I was told they would call me back , I waited 20min for them to call me back and then they told me the breakfast would take 30min more, which I no longer had!! The staff wasn't especially nice, the rooms and mirrored hallways were pretty dumpy. The toiletries were about the only good thing I can think of. For the exorbitant price of $250+/night, if you have the time, go stay in one of the better hotels in Hong Kong... like the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “thanks to air pacific for delayed flight”
Reviews.Author: BanditoUA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really very very good. We got it FoXY for one night due to flight delay. Rooms are good and big. We had electric pot and coffee set in our room. Bathroom was big and clean. We also got dinner couppns. Restaurant (hotel has few of them) is nice. Big selection of dishes of good quality. Sea food is especially nice. The hotel is connected to Terminal2 with indoor path. So it takes 5 minutes to het to check-in counters.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Douliketotravel
Reviews.Content: This airport hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff was friendly at check in and rooms very clean and equipped with exactly what you needed. We had a function at the nearby convention center and this was so convenient. Also, many restaurants and a Starbucks in walking distance without even having to go out side, a bonus! So convenient to all the public transport. Would definitely stay again whether it is for short or long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but worth it?”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night (in transit to the city) during Christmas season in 2011. Location can't be beat; it's literally connected to the airport arrivals hall! Lobby is spacious yet comfy; plenty of bell boys and other staff on hand, even late at night. I received a room upgrade which included access to the Regal Club Lounge for breakfast (which I had not been expecting and in fact did not use) as well as free wi-fi (which I certainly did use). Check-in staff were friendly enough. Room was perfectly fine, though there is a definite 80s vibe to the renovated upper floors, with lots of purple, pink, gold flecks in the wallpaper, and mirrors everywhere! It was also rather overpriced... renovations were obviously quite recent, but when all you want from an airport hotel after a 10-hour flight is a bed and a shower, US$200 per night for a single room seems a bit steep. Besides price, the only real complaint I have about this stay is that I was never given any sort of receipt at check-out. The guy at the desk just took my key card and said "okaythanksgoodbye" as he quickly moved on to the next customer. I literally had to stop him and remind him to give me a receipt! Overall, this is a near-luxury hotel at near-luxury prices... but is that really what you need from airport lodging?

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: ishralene09
Reviews.Content: Once again I've booked this hotel through Asia Web Direct so I got a good value for my money. Still a little high but it's a Saturday and a day before Christmas so I don't expect that much savings on my side. I decided to book a reservation because our flights on Christmas day will be early, so it's much more convenient to be nearer to the Airport than travel from L'Hotel Island South. Anyways we arrived at around 7:40PM in the evening and I was expecting a fast check-in since I got a reservation. What happened was that there are too many people on the line, and too many complaining that every employee on the reception are a little, I don't know, stressed up? And there were only like 3 receptionist. I waited for around 40 minutes on the line just to be checked in. That was the worst part, since we weren't able to visit much of the Citygate Outlet's shops. I was hoping we can get checked at around 8PM but it took longer so we arrived at Citygate around 9, which was closing time for most of the good shops. Anyways enough of that, back to the hotel part. So my check-in wasn't really that of a hassle. I just think that more receptionist can make it faster since people like me were able to finish checking in a short time, but other people have concerns far greater than us, so in a sense all people in the line suffer, no matter how long or short the time we spend talking to the receptionist. You all get my point. After that line, we were able to get to our room. It's a superior room by the way, double bed. It's good, with (very big) bathrobes, toiletries, iron and ironing board, safe, TV (with more channels), complimentary coffee and tea with hot water already in the pot, complimentary water, and a stocked but overpriced mini-bar. The bed was good and comfortable, the noise level of the planes minimal. Very spacious if you asked me. I can even sleep on the sofa. Very comfortable and relaxing stay. So I can say that it's worth the value that I've paid for it. But I hope that the people lined up on the reception gets to be attended faster next time. I think that most people have the same complaint too.

Reviews.Title: “Neat and environmentally friendly”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn_09
Reviews.Content: A quiet place despite the airport. Free transport was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from front desk”
Reviews.Author: Jackief1962
Reviews.Content: I had booked a day room only - from 7am till 7pm. Arrived very early at 4.30am - staff member at front desk was wonderful. He organised for us to be in a room within 10 minutes and arranged for us to depart the room at 9pm. We found the room (overlooking underground car park) clean, quiet and just want we needed - somewhere to sleep for a couple of hours before we went off to explore Hong Kong. Check out was easy. Be aware though that queue's for check out can be longer the later you depart due to popularity of late leaving flights. An easy walk to the departure gates made for a stress free experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: promo2000plus
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel in HK Airport as it is a 5 min. walk when exiting custom in the arrival hall. No need to cary luggage for miles but just to the entrance of hotel where bell boys take it to your room. Rooms are good and clean and all restaurants are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Under Staffed and Incompetent”
Reviews.Author: HDog43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel extensively all over the world. We booked this hotel because we arrived late one night from Beijing and had to leave the next morning for the USA. Wanted to be convenient and close to the arriving and departing flights at the Hong Kong Airport, which this hotel is perfectly located for. The bad news is that we had to pay a ridiculous amount of money for a room, in comparison to other high end Hong Kong hotels. The check in process was a nightmare, having arrived late from Beijing and just wanting to get to bed. The desk clerk messed around forever getting us checked in working with her computer screen, running back and forth behind the counter, and asking as associate for help. All this with no communication about what was going on. Next morning got a total run around by the business center trying to print our boarding passes and trying to get access to the free wifi in the lobby. Check out was just as bad as check in. Poor staff and lousy communication in a process that went on forever with desk clerk running back and forth, checking various papers and files, going to a nearby office etc. The hotel required a 500 HKD deposit the night before and we had no charges to our room. On check out they refused to clear or credit the deposit and said it would take their bank 2 - 3 weeks to credit our credit card for the deposit. I have never ever heard of any hotel doing this including other hotels in Hong Kong, Xi'an, and Beijing. This hotel need to focus on beefing up their staffing, doing effective training, improving communications with international travelers, and improving their business processes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stopover in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Papofurado
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regal for a two night stopover in Hong Kong and found this hotel a very good option. I chose an airport location as my inbound flight arrived at 6.30am afer a long overnight flight from Auckland and didn't want to face travelling into a city centre hotel with baggage - I also had an early morning departure to London on my outward leg of the journey. Within 15 minutes of collecting my bags from the carousel, I had checked in after walking through the arrivals hall - the hotel is linked to the hall by way of a covered walkway. Check in was efficient - by the time I had filled in my registration card and found my way to my room, the bags had already been delivered by the porter. After showering, I made my way back to the terminal ( a 3 minute walk) and caught the train into the city centre. I chose not to eat in the hotel - you pay tourist rates, but the choice was good for those of you who choose to eat in house. To give some idea, I paid $60HK for a 660ml beer at the bar, whereas earlier in the evening I had eaten a large portion of delicious fried noodles and a litre jar of beer in a local 'restaurant' in Kowloon - this cost me $40HK. The room rates were a little pricier than some equivalents in town, but I found my stay at this location maximised the amount of time I spent in Hong Kong itself. It is brilliantly located and would stay there again, given my flight timings. The room was very clean, and despite the location adjacent to the runway, I didn't find noise a problem. Didn't use the internet connection as my laptop decided to crash on me the day before I arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Best Airport Hotel for a reason!”
Reviews.Author: JonGagne
Reviews.Content: Directly connected to the Hong Kong Airport arrival terminal, this is the best hotel for an overnight stay. Checking in and out took very little time and it is the closest hotel to the airport. If you want to eat in, the hotel has a very nice lobby and restaurant or you can go to the airport, From the airport, you can take public transportation to go to Kowloon and go shopping and eat. One of the nicest hotels I've ever been at, though do not expect the best scenery as it is an airport hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine43
Reviews.Content: It's basic and convenient. Nothing more than that. Receptionist and all else are straightforward and no nonsense. Yet our comfort are fully provided for. Though to me, it is a little more expensive than anticipated but I guess any price for convenience and comfort at the same time is worth it. Btw, the chicken rice (room service) was yummy. My little one had it for lunch and dinner. :)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: SJN514
Reviews.Content: If you're on an overnight trip, this is a convenient hotel to stay since its in the airport premises connected by a short bridge to the main building. The rates are a bit high but the airport's choice of restaurants is available. The room was comfortable and modern. Commuting to town was quick and easy. Fine for a short business trip but if you're trying to get a feel of the hustle & bustle of Hong Kong, stay in a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOEFUL”
Reviews.Author: MC-7
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this hotel purely for the proximity to the airport, which is the only reason it gets a one out of five rating. When travelling through Hong Kong, I usually stay at the Novotel CityGate, however their shuttle bus to the airport only commences at 6.30am. As I had to check out at 4.30am, I chose the Regal because it's connected to the airport and is a convenient one minute walk to the terminal. This is the ONLY benefit of staying at this hotel. Upon check in (after 10pm), the staff could not locate my booking, despite it being booked directly on their website. When it was finally found, I handed over my frequent flyer card, as they have a large promotion card on their counter. I was promptly and rudely told that because I had already booked "the cheap rate", I couldn't be awarded any frequent flyer points. I explained that I did not book a "cheap rate" and it was actually the full rack rate on their website, because it was booked last minute. I was told "oh well". When I then enquired about wi-fi connection, I was told that would be an extra HKD150 - for a mere 6 hour stay. I had booked a non-smoking room and when I exited the lift on my floor, the entire hotel reaked of cigarette smoke. Expecting my room to be the same, I wasn't surprised when there were ashtrays and a smoky smell in there. I went back down to reception to complain about this, and was told, yes of course other people smoke in there - it's a non smoking room for my stay!! The room itself is large enough, however it was untidy and clearly has not been renovated since the 1970s. The decor is horrible and the bathroom leaves a lot to be desired. The amount of money they charge for this hotel is disgraceful, when considering the state of the rooms - and then they have the audacity to charge HKD18 for a miniature bottle of mouth wash, something which any other decent hotel would provide free of charge. Obviously all the money goes towards the lobby and lounge bar - they actually look quite nice, but that's it. I travel quite a lot and stay in higher end hotels almost everywhere I go, so I have a number of other hotels to compare this to. This hotel, although claiming to be marketed towards international travellers, fails to meet even basic standards. They do not have any universal power points in the rooms and when asking for an adaptor at the front desk, the staff look at you like you have two heads. This hotel is more like a 2 or 3 star mainland China hotel, rather than an expensive Hong Kong hotel which is supposed to provide respite for weary travellers. If you have a need to stay near the airport - avoid this hotel, it is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Right at the airport”
Reviews.Author: Plus2kids
Reviews.Content: Got into HK late and walked to the hotel via the connected bridge right at the end of Terminal 1. It's about 300+ meters. No free wifi. Breakfast wasn't included in my rate. Was assigned a Suite on the 5th floor. Bottled water was provided. AC thermostat didn't seem to work. Room and bathroom was clean. The room was a tad old but ok. Checkin and Checkout could be faster.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Front room staff let it down”
Reviews.Author: Susiei
Reviews.Content: I booked via wotif and the '24 hours from time of check in regardless of time of day' was a big draw. When the reception eventually found my booking they told me that the 24 hour was against hotel policy. Found myself having to argue with receptionist whilst fatigued and desperate for sleep. Eventually agreed I could stay until evening but phoned me at 11am anyway!I gave up then and left. Have looked at hotels OWN website which also repeats the 24 hours from time of check in claim. Go figure! It's a pity as the place is actually rather nice.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NicTF
Reviews.Content: I had a nightmare since making reservation via emails. Hence, I don't expect a good service but it is still very disappointed. The check-in took a decade eventhough there are not many guests in-queue. And most frustrating is, the check-in staff never inform our room is at either north or south wing. So, a long walk for us again. The buffet breakfast was worse than any 5-star hotels I had stayed before. Limited choice with low food quality. Luckly the room is comfortable and clean. Plus, the concierge boys are the great asset to the hotel. However, forget about their shuttle service if you are not with kids or elderly.

Reviews.Title: “Average but worth it for the convenience.”
Reviews.Author: SWINGLINE34
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night with our two kids as we travelled through Hong Kong from China. We liked the convenience of being so close to the airport for our early flight the next day -- especially since we had our two children with us and didn't want to struggle with getting a taxi to the airport the next morning. The room was nothing special -- just your standard room. The only thing I didn't like about the room was the shower "curtain." There was no curtain, just a half of a glass door, which didn't seem to keep the water in the shower. We were impressed that the rooms were quiet -- even though the jets were just outside the window taking off and landing at all hours, we couldn't hear a single one. Lastly, we were disappointed that our reservation did not include breakfast. Otherwise, it was okay, nothing special but worth it for the convenience of easy access to the airport terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a layover”
Reviews.Author: BigIslandRox
Reviews.Content: Spent 16 hours in Hong Kong and this hotel was extremely convenient to the airport - a short walk. I stayed on the executive floor and it was all redone with sodas/waters available while the lounge was open. I missed the food in the evening but the set-up was impressive. Morning breakfast was nice in the lounge with eggs made to order and a variety of other options (fruits/meats/cheeses/cereals). If staying on the executive level the check-in area is not on the main floor, so after waiting in a line for 15 minutes I was directed to the executive level for check in. No indication of that anywhere so be aware. Bathroom was pretty dark and the set-up of the shower got water all over. The bed was pretty small, but comfortable. The room itself was very nicely decorated with all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience is not everything.”
Reviews.Author: EltelUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 night on Saturday. We booked a Club Room to be able to use the club "lounge" all day as we had a 23.30 flight. The lounge is disappointing compared to other HK hotels club floors and is expensive for what is provided; and it's not especially comfortable - no sofas just ordinary tables and chairs, the breakfast is limited. You pay for convenience of close proximity to the airport, but bear in mind this comes at price with guests coming and going at all hours so it's not that quiet. We had to call security to stop a noisy party in an adjacent room at 1 AM - but they dealt with it quickly. We stayed at the Langham Place earlier in the month their Club offering is much better and cheaper and the room better - but of course not so convenient - there's the catch, but I know where we'll go next time.

Reviews.Title: “not a happy experience”
Reviews.Author: pat318
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight in October. Never again, the check in line was very long and very disorganised, people jumping in front. When finally checked in told to go the the 12th floor, with no advice that the lifts only went to the 11th floor and an escalator to the next floor. Late at night after a long flight you don't want to be looking for a lift that has 12 floors which isn't there. The check out the next morning was not much quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic convenience, otherwise average”
Reviews.Author: AmataH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hard to top for convenience, making it easy to stroll to or from your flight via the enclosed walkway from the terminal into the hotel itself. However, its other features only barely met my expectations. Check-in staff weren't rude, but nor were they warm or friendly. The hotel's decor is tacky but not unpleasant. My room was characterless, clean, perfectly OK but not luxurious (especially given the hotel's tariff, even via discounted sites). Having to pay for wifi was outrageous, but it can be avoided by periodically ducking out into the airport terminal and using the airport's free wifi network. Room service was reasonably swift and not too expensive. I did appreciate having a kettle and tea and coffee making provisions in the room, which showed an attention to detail - and to travellers' needs - not evident in so much of the hotel. There were no robes in the room, only slippers, but housekeeping were happy to deliver a robe when I called and requested one (but, again, I'd have thought this would come as standard). The hotel's pools are looking pretty tired and, during my visit, neither pool was heated, despite claims on the hotel's website that the indoor pool is heated. In short, this hotel is a mixed experience: overpriced and characterless but extremely convenient. However, if you are in Hong Kong for 24 hours or longer and are trying to decide whether to stay at the airport or venture into the city, I would recommend the latter: the Airport Express gets you into Hong Kong Central in 25 minutes, round the clock, and you can check in to your flight at Central, making it a stress-free and seamless exercise even if you have a very early or late flight. You will get a better sense of Hong Kong, and quite possibly better accommodation for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Hong Kong stopover”
Reviews.Author: MarianneandDavid
Reviews.Content: Once in the arrivals hall, turn left, walk a short distance directly into the hotel lobby. A wonderful convenience for a short HK stay. We stayed one night in September, caught the train into the city after checking in and the ease of it all was a good experience. The only down side really, as the room was very good and quiet, was that the front desk seems to be always understaffed and we had to queue to check in for longer than necessary. It was so easy the next morning to walk to the lift, the up into the departure hall. One word of warning is that someone we know who was there at the same time, got well and truly conned by a 'taxi' driver, who said he could take them to the very same hotel. They got into his van, then he met someone else who took them around in a circle, dropped them off at the front of the hotel and demanded AUD$200. The walk to the hotel is less than 5 minutes - don't get caught by these people!

Reviews.Title: “How on earth does it get rated best airport hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: RoadwarriorLynne
Reviews.Content: I returned to this hotel for the first time in 7 years as I had really not enjoyed my previous stay, but based on all the accolades the hotel had been receiving, I decided to give it another try. Although the previously horrendous 101 dalmatians spotted decor with glaring purple accents had been replaced with a more neutral and tranquil decor, I did not experience anything whatsoever to entice me to return to the hotel any time in the future. I checked in at the Executive floor - two calls and 30 minutes later, my luggage (which was supposedly 'on its way' was finally delivered to my room. When I attempted to order a simple room service meal of stir fried noodles at 11PM, I was told that the waiting time would be a MINIMUM of one hour because the hotel was 'so big'. The washroom in my room was supposed to have upgraded toiletry amenities, yet the miniature bottle of mouthwash on the counter had a big note saying that it would cost HK15. How chintzy can you get? Finally the club floor breakfast did not even have any western breakfast options - no eggs, bacon, etc, which was really surprising given the volume of international travellers. Internet was expensive, so a one night stay with poor service and a mediocre executive floor at best cost me $465 US for one night including internet and no other additional charges. This hotel is not even close to being on my list as the best airport hotel in the world. In fact, I would rate it as acceptable at best.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back....”
Reviews.Author: bluemaxer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the airport and very convenient. But.... I arrived very late from an extremely long 23 hour transit. Checking took over an hour. There was only 2 people at the front desk doing check-in's. We were all standing a queue and some other quest just keep on jumping the queue. The room was nice and clean. Did not sleep much. The best thing for me was to check out early the next morning. This also took +30 min.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MamaSqueak
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at this hotel was when I missed my connecting flight to SFO because of heavy fog on Christmas day of 2009. CX arranged for my room and meals. The room they gave me was big but unfortunately did not have free wifi in-room. The second time I stayed here was for business. Got a similar sized room as my previous stay. Clean and spacious but still no free wifi. Check-in and check-out was hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “OK, and thanks for Cathay Pacific for arranging this”
Reviews.Author: DRMB
Reviews.Content: I was diverted on a CX flight from Hongkong to BKK back to Hongkong through no fault of CX, who did their best for about 250 stranded pasengers until we could resume the flight next day. CX arranged hotels, meals and phone calls, + onwards journey even though technically they did not have to and we should have claimed all on travel insurance. The hotel was great, the meal was great, the service was great and special thanks to Cathay Pacific, As a One World Platinum they put me up in the best suite they could find, marvelous! really good. Althoug we were delayed by a day it was a good experience. This is how an airline should treat you!

Reviews.Title: “CLUB LOUNGE EXCELLENT, ROOM DISAPPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: donalddaniels
Reviews.Content: The Regal is right at the Airport....walk right in. I had made a booking for a Club Floor room but was not directed to the Club Lounge for check in and had to line up at the reception. I was allocated an OK room facing the carpark but a very long way from the lifts! Disappointed in the amenities. A tiny bottle of mouthwash had a charge of HK$18! And the internet was outrageously priced. The public facilities and spar/pool/gym are excellent, but most airport guests do not use these facilities. I eventually found my way into the Lounge (no directions or information in my club room) and felt right at home. Friendly hostess, OK bar and savouries and good breakfast. However there was no advice as to what my paying extra entitled me to. One would have expected in the room, there would be a Club Floor information sheet. It was only after I checked OUT that I found out that wifi was free for club guests. Some staff training would be useful. On the four times I used the club lounge I was asked for my name and room number. Guest recognition is important.

Reviews.Title: “24 check-in!”
Reviews.Author: moeline
Reviews.Content: Subject to availability, they really will let you check in for 24 hours, regardless of what time you arrive. We had a very early morning arrival, and 45 minutes later were checked in by the competent, if not friendly, reception staff. After a shower and a snooze, we took the reasonably priced, frequent and safe public transport into town for a lovely afternoon and evening, and next morning just had a short indoor stroll back to the terminal to check in. The room was generic with no outstanding features, good or bad. Free wifi is available at the airport, but as usual, extortionately priced at the hotel. Sandwiched between two long haul flights, I felt this was an excellent choice for a 24 hour stop-over with an early start. In different circumstances, I'd choose a hotel in town

Reviews.Title: “Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Bellesister
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a layover because of a delayed flight. The hotel was complimentary from United Airlines. It's adjacent to the hongkong international airport and also close to the MTR station to go to the city. The room is spacious and quite clean except there's some spots in the bathroom. Service was not good though. Staff was not friendly and a bit rude.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the airport”
Reviews.Author: Lorea
Reviews.Content: if you have to catch an early flight, it is very handy since there is a corridor connecting the hotel with the airport. If you want to visit Hong Kong, best to stay in Kowloon or Hong Kong. It is a very big hotel, with average rooms, nothing fancy. There are two swimming pools, both indoor and outdoor and a couple of restaurants in the hotel, where the food is also average. From my room, I could annoyingly hear my neighbour's toilet pipes

Reviews.Title: “Feeling bad”
Reviews.Author: sudharak
Reviews.Content: I checked in at the hotel on Saturday evening. The check in queue was long and I had to spend 30 minutes to check in. The internet connection was down. Front desk would not answer the phone all through my stay. The movie previews were not available.

Reviews.Title: “Next to the airport, otherwise avoid if you can.”
Reviews.Author: Hawwy
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel rooms (2 rooms for 4 of us) offered to us after losing the connecting flight back to Perth. After check in, we found out the internet is not free, there was fee of HK$100/24hour. Internet became something very necessary especially when we were not in our traveling plan anymore. So we requested internet (wifi) access, but was asked for HK$500 deposit regardless we only stayed there for one night. In one of the room, the toilet apparently could not be flushed. Rang the housekeeping, and was promised to have a look. after few hours still nothing happened. My mate as quite handy person, tried to inspect the flushing system, which apparently was not installed properly. The flushing system was then used by manual operation (rather than by button pressing). This was probably better than waiting for the housekeeping that never show up. In the room we didn't see many amenities available (considering some guests probably were in need of these if they end up staying in an Airport Hotel). There was not even a comb in the room. it was also lucky the section in Hongkong was our final trip in China, because here we experienced front desk that was quite rude and unhelpful (compared to other hotels along our trip in China). In the morning when we were about to depart, we checked out from hotel, but apparently the queuing line was quite long. Not sure what kind of line it was, we asked directly to front desk about checking out and asking our deposit refund. Instead of doing a quick check out and refunding, the front desk argued and asked us to queue in the line instead. Apparently there was no dedicated check out line. we tried to queue, but after 5 minutes it was only moved by one person. So we have to go to airport to avoid losing our flight. From this experience, we don't see any much benefit of having the hotel next to airport if we still need to really come early to queue to check out. Other nearby proper hotels that have check out line, are probably better options. In the end, I tried to contact the hotel via email about the deposit refund. But no respond so far. It seems the refund might be needed to boost the morale of the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Fox4520
Reviews.Content: attached to the arrivals terminal, very convenient after long flight, i loved the fact that you get 24 hours from check in, room was clean, well equipped, nice size bathroom, my only complaint would be that the bed was rock hard…. but i guess that is just not my preference…… would stay here again if passing through hong kong, although seemed expensive for what it was based on UK prices, but i guess you are paying for the convenience of stepping off the plane and walking straight into the only hotel connected to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient but that's all!”
Reviews.Author: Vince C
Reviews.Content: There's nothing better than waking up and being right there. However, customer service is severely lacking. Not acknowledging that you're standing at the front desk is very, very rude. All I wanted to do was confirm my room number. When I was first in line, there were 4 clerks. Without looking at me, they all left.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location for the weary traveller”
Reviews.Author: Macben_1969
Reviews.Content: Location was our prime consideration when booked a room at this hotel. We will be going to Disneyland in the morning. Disneyland resort hotels were cheaper and nearer, but were fully booked, so we have no choice but to get this one since we will be coming in late from Manila flight. After going thru long lines at immigration, we were again in the long lines at front desk of the hotel since the staff was few at that time in servicing the steady stream of tourists checking in. We booked a superior room for the night which is around HK$2k. After claiming our baggages, we proceeded to the hotel which is connected by a linkbridge to the airport. The hotel has a huge lobby and has a nice interior.The best part was, we were upgraded to an apartment--which is more than double the rate of our reserved room!! In this apartment, we have a king-sized bed with own TV and a sofa(not sofa bed) in the spacious living room with flat screen tv, and a kitchen complete with ref, stove, toaster, microwave, kettle and utensils, china ware. Free bottled water available, as well as coffe/tea. Wifi available in the room for a fee. The living room and the bedroom have a balcony with views of the lobby. It also has a coffee table outside which we didnt use. The bathroom was clean with hot/cold water, but the tub was shallow and small for me (a six footer) and close to overflowing, shower head was low and would have preferred it in a detachable flexible hose-type shower head. The BR is equipped with hair dryer, outlets for shavers and toiletries were complete. The room was sound-proofed so you can sleep well. The hotel have lots of food choices but we didn't eat there because of budgetary constraints. We decided to just take an early lunch at Disneyland so what we did was go to the airport which has a 7-11 store and bought our drinks and bread. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The kids were also glad because they have plenty of room to play around in the living room. Definitely recommended for those travelling from afar and with children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Per T
Reviews.Content: I must say that this hotel has a very high service level and the location is very very good

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced, low service...disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: FloridaPeapod
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its immediate proximity to the Hong Kong airport. We booked a very nice room online that was to include a king bed and a buffet breakfast. I had clarified we would be checking in VERY late and that I needed a crib in the room upon arrival. The hotel was overbooked and we got bumped to an apartment which was later called an "upgrade." NO WAY. It was a dump. The only plus was the bed linens which were clean and crisp. The bed was tiny, there was no warm or even room temp shower water, and the walls, carpet, furniture etc were dingy. Honestly, it looks to me like the hotel is well equipped and pretty. Maybe the newer rooms are all wonderful. But our experience - charged for breakfast, no crib in room, dumpy room, no willingness to amend the situation...it was a nightmare. If you need to stay right by the airport then have at it but know that, for 300 bucks, you may end up with the 40 per night quality we got.

Reviews.Title: “best airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dewi_Puji
Reviews.Content: best airport hotel, ever. 5 star service, great tours into the city, stellar service and I walked to catch my flight the next day.

Reviews.Title: “a great place if younhave a long layover”
Reviews.Author: ReneLes
Reviews.Content: had over 12 hours to wait between flights ... after 14 hours getting here, we thought a room would be a great idea. Great location, end of terminal one by Starbucks rooms were very clean and comfortable, very modern

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short stop”
Reviews.Author: WorldwideVikingo
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to this hotel and have to admit that I have been impressed every time. The rooms are comfortable, clean and well maintained, the gym is good, the services in the spa are good as well. The only bad thing I have to say about this hotel is the lack of staff at peak hours in the lobby, average time to check out or in each person takes a long time (approx 10-15 minutes), and last time I was there, there was a long line of people waiting (43) and only 3 persons on the desk. This was at 11pm when many flights are arriving and going to the hotel. If they add 10-12 more staff during this peak period, then it would get 5 star from me.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient to the airport but overall just average rooms”
Reviews.Author: MacTexas
Reviews.Content: For a one night wait between flights is a perfect location. You can walk from customs to the hotel without going outside. The rooms are incredibly average for international hotels but they do have good TV with lots of english chanels. The one really bright spot was the restaurant (China Bistro). Their steaks were some of the best i've ever hadm the staff friendly and the atmosphere relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Room Just OK”
Reviews.Author: lncclc
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay in Hong Kong in order to catch your connecting flight, this hotel is ok. It is expensive for what you get. The check in line is the worst, with the most inefficient staff. We had to stay there twice, coming and leaving Asia, and it was bad each time. The rooms are just ok. We had a running toilet one night, and the beds and pillows are hard. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “So much potential, but a dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Nick T
Reviews.Content: This airport hotel in Hong Kong is very conveniently located, jut a short walk from the arrivals hall. The decor and room layout is excellent. However it's the little things that let you down. In order to get internet access, I had to call the front desk, then go down to the front desk to rescan my credit card, then it still wouldn't work. I tried getting through to the front desk for over an hour till I finally got through to someone who reset my password and I finally got in. Also the room service took about an hour to arrive. Granted they were probably busy due to the delay of a Cathay flight that we were all on, but I might as well have just stayed in the Cathay first class lounge where I could have showered and had free food and internet anyway. Having said that, the staff are friendly and the bedding and room wqas spacious. I was givene a smoking room as that is all they had left, but it actually didn't smell at all. I would not hesitate to stay here in the future, but will plan around some of the small inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient to the airport”
Reviews.Author: ItsJoeZ
Reviews.Content: Great location to terminal 1. Easy inside walk to/from the airport. It was my first time to Hong Kong and I used it as a layover hotel since I arrived late into Hong Kong and didn't want to figure out how to get into the city late at night. If you don't want to eat on the hotel premises, you can always walk back to the airport for the several fast food places there. The room was clean and quiet. Staff was wonderfully nice and helpful and speaking english was not a problem. Getting over to Hong Kong island takes about half an hour and $100HK so this place is not good to be your base for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Was told by the receptionist "free room'”
Reviews.Author: Chnice
Reviews.Content: Due to flight CX690/1OCT11 from Singapore to Hong Kong was delay, I misconnect my flight KA850 from Hong Kong to Wuhan. I was met on arrival by CX staff was told I hev to stay overnight in Hong Kong as the next availabe flight is 2OCT departing 0850. Was given a hotel voucher for the layover at Regal Airoprt Hotel. When checking-in, I request for a non-smoking, high floor room. I was shocked to be told by the receptionist, "this is a free room". I am guest and a customer, am I wrong to request ? And anyway, this is not free, Cathay Pacific Airway is paying for it due to their flight delay. And when asked her about the phone call that I was told by CX that I can have 15 minutes in the room. Again she say no. After checking with one of her colleague, she say 3 minutes... When I went to the restaurent for dinner, no hotess to seat me..have to find my own table. Most of the table was uncleared. I managed to find a clean table with setting. It was a buffet style dinner. The food was okay. When I ask for a pair of scissor for cutting the alaskan crab leg, I was told there is no more scissors. OMG you mean the scissors is all used and throw type. They can't wash it? Is this the kind of service that was rated by Skytrax as one of the top hotel ? Maybe 5 stars rating with 2 stars service.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book room 1025”
Reviews.Author: Foolfin
Reviews.Content: After complaining for the 4th time about plumbing noise and bangs... above my bed I was finally told they have the hotel's lounge's kitchen above my room so you could hear the staff operating the kitchen's washing machne etc. all evening. After calling the reception 4 times I was told they cannot "control" what the staff does in the lounge...after the 5th call and couple of hours in total they asked me to change room when I wanted to avoid he noise, which I did. Overall a huge an boring airport hotel which is is greatly situated when you need to be by the aiport or the local convention center...

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for transit in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: GuaguaBeijing
Reviews.Content: Regal airport Hong Kong is maybe the cost convenient airport hotel in the world within only 5 minutes of walk once you clear customs formalities. We spent one night for transit back to Beijing, and think it's a good choice when transiting in HK. The room is very spacious with extra large king size bed, easy to accommodate up to 2 adults and one child. We tried the open air swimming pool before taking our connection flight. It should be the biggest hotel pool in the city. The room is very quiet despite it's airport location, so no worries on the sleeping quality. Check in and check out are quick. Staffs at the gym and bar are very helpful. The only down side of the room is it smells a little bit too much air fresher or detergent... when we first walked into the room.

Reviews.Title: “Slept like a baby, 5mins walk to airport.”
Reviews.Author: nicbing
Reviews.Content: I missed a connection and had an unexpected night in Hong Kong. Hotel was easy to find; follow signs within airport. Plenty of ATMs if you're not prepared to spend the night in Hong Kong. Staff at the Hotel were lovely and helpful. Huge rooms, air con, plenty of restaurants to choose from; all sorts of food on offer. I chose a traditional Chinese restaurant then a more western restaurant following day. Both were fab, quick service, delicious food. Fridge in rooms, Tea and coffee facilities, lots of nice thoughtful touches; I was thrilled that there were toothbrushes and toothpaste! Sky TV too. I was just thrilled to have a nice, comfy bed for the night to catch up on my sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stop over, high quality.”
Reviews.Author: Barry P
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of Airport. Comfortable, friendly, good range of restaurants. Good stopover to/from UK to NZ. Specifically requested this hotel from travel agent having previously stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Regal Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avidNHtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last night of our Hong Kong visit. You can easily walk to the airport through a covered passageway. The restaurants at the hotel were expensive--had we realized it was so easy to walk to the airport that would have been a better choice. But we were there on Easter Sunday which may have influenced the restaurant menus.

Reviews.Title: “#1 Airport Hotel in the World? NOT at All!”
Reviews.Author: jashock
Reviews.Content: The Skytrax Members who voted this the #1 Airport Hotel must have been upgraded to Club rooms with free mini-bar privileges! My reservation was prepaid weeks in advance with a couple of not difficult requests. Upon check-in I had the luck to have one of the less rude front desk clerks. They said they had no room with two beds and tried hard to get me to take a room with one bed. The situation might have been better if the front desk clerk could speak and understand English; she couldn't. Most couldn't. While waiting over 30 minutes to check in because management can't do their jobs, I heard a Japanese flight attendant tell her front desk clerk, "I don't know how to do your job, but I would never talk to a customer the way you did to me." Between the rudeness and the ineptitude of management to have a room ready (did they read the comments about late arrival? did they note the number of beds needed? did they note request of feather-free for a severe asthmatic? No on all 3 accounts), it was a most unpleasant experience. This is not the perfect antidote after a long flight. The next point was an argument with an employee while one of our party scoped out the emergency exits on our floor. Then came the free Wi-Fi that had not been connected by the front desk clerk, even after seeing it noted on the reservation, resulting in a 40 minute phone call to the Philippines (who were much more pleasant than any employee at this hotel) before finally getting connected- so much for the hotel offering free Wi-Fi on my room package. The breakfast buffet was a typical buffet. The fruit was truly awful, but looked pretty. The hot food chef was verbally abrasive when I took an egg from under the heat lamp. Since there is no sign how was I supposed to know that those eggs are not for every hotel guest? Thankfully screaming back in Mandarin got me an egg. Don't try English, it's not understood. The room itself was roomy by HK standards. It was clean but already showed signs of needing repairs, especially in the bathroom. There were two tiny bottles of water for free. Then you pay a fortune for bottled water. Since everything at the hotel closes by midnight, you would need to walk back to the airport to get any other supplies, including more water. Check out was with another impersonal, poor English communicating desk clerk capping an overall lousy experience especially for the price we paid. Would I stay here again? If I needed to: it's but a 10 minute slow walk from one end of the airport. But I would rather go into town and have better service and better food for this price. Do not expect much English here. (Chinese/Cantonese speakers are treated like royalty; the rest like dogs.) And do not expect much more than a nice, quiet room for which you pay handsomely and you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient!”
Reviews.Author: cavamebri
Reviews.Content: Great spot, so close to airport, yet no sound of airplanes. The room was great and the hotel was nice too. The best bit for us was the jet lag massage we had at the spa- very very good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: daisy111Sydney
Reviews.Content: Very convenient - right at the airport - only a short walk from the arrivals hall. The foyer is impressive. Check-in was easy. The room was a little tired, it has been a while since it saw a make-over, but it was pleasant enough. I loved the shoe polisher on each floor - novel idea and my shoes were definitely shiny. The spa was excellent the restaurants were good too. The concierge was very helpful - gave me many options on how to spend my day in Hong Kong. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Last choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: PandaMoy
Reviews.Content: Location - Average If you are on transit, the hotel is great as it is only a 10 mins walk to the airport. If not, it is REALLY far from the city. The train takes 30 mins or the bus will take 45 mins. Giving the location good if you are on transit, if you are on holiday, the location is terrible. Staff / Service - Good The staff at the counter was friendly and helpful Breakfast - Not included Room - Excellent The rooms are good and clean. The size of the rooms are reasonable too especially in HK when alot of the hotel rooms are pretty small. The one thing which I felt was bad - the smoking floor is a total maze!
