You might have to walk like 5 to 10 mins to your room if you are in the centre as it is a BIG circle and you cannot cut through in between. Anyway, no shopping or anything interesting staying in this hotel. The one entertainment is the airport. If you are on transit, this hotel is fine, if not, there is nothing special since it is too far from city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: messagepraveen
Reviews.Content: This was a good place to stay in June 2011, attached to Airport, I had a conference in this hotel it made our stay and conference go smooth. Food was nice, they have multiiple speciality food section but predominatly chinese food.

Reviews.Title: “much improvement in non-smoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: minion21
Reviews.Content: checked in aug 25 and stayed till aug 30. hot and humid in hkg during this time so i got to take a dip in both indoor n outdoor pools, each had a lifeguard despite its small size. lockers rooms equipped with steam n sauna, gotta try it next time. airport connection still flawless despite the heat outside, temp control consistently cool from airport, connecting bridge, lobby, corridors and room itself. most noticeable is the elimination of stench of cigarettes in non-smoking rooms in the south tower, where i stayed this time. connection to hkg island is a breeze via airport express, you might wanna avail of the 3-day tourist pass which includes one-way or two-way airport express, depending on your choice. regal also has shuttle going to nd from tungchung where you find citygate outlet stores where great bargains await you. disneyland is only a couple of stations away from tungchung mtr station, be there before 9am to avoid the crowd. also in tungchung is the ngongping 360 cable car going to the giant buddha. suggest after u do ur shopping in either hkg or kowloon, nd get ur hands full, take d airport express back to regal airport hotel, it'll take u back in a whisk. and d most amazing thing in staying in an airport hotel is there's no need to rush n no need to transport ur heavy load when checking-in ur airline.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient if in airport”
Reviews.Author: GabyP
Reviews.Content: Very convenient if you need to stay at the airport. The room was spacious, clean and very quiet: although we were facing one of the landing runways we didn't hear a sound!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel by the airport”
Reviews.Author: Jerry S
Reviews.Content: I was flying in from the main land United States and was planning to be in Hong Kong for 3 days. The trip would consist of myself and my cousin, but I came in a day earlier than my cousin. So for 1 day, I was by myself. For the majority of the trip, my cousin and I were planning on staying at the Golden Crown Guest House (which is an amazing guest house to stay in). However, since I arrived a day earlier, I couldn't add an extra day to the Golden Crown Guest House. So upon pondering my predicament, I thought it would be best to stay near the airport so it would be easier to meet with my cousin who was arriving the next day earlier in the morning. With that said, I've looked at different options around Hong Kong International airport and I decided on the Regal Airport Hotel since it's literally connected to the airport itself. Once you arrive, if you go to terminal 1/A, the walkway to the hotel is located right behind the Starbucks stand. Super convenient. The hotel offers a unique check-in/check-out time. Basically, you can check in any time and check out time is 24 hours from the time of when you check in. Wireless internet services is offered at the hotel for a very expensive surcharge. I believe if I remember correctly, I paid $30 US for total usage. I booked through a travel website, but I believe if you book directly through the Regal hotel's website, they offer free internet services when you stay. The staff was very friendly and professional. For example, when I arrived, I checked in, got in to my room and showered. Well, the bath water wouldn't drain and for the life of me, I couldn't figure out how to get it to drain. So I called the front desk with my dilemma and was expecting to wait 20 or 30 minutes for someone to come and fix the bathtub. To my surprised, 2 minutes later, someone knocked at my door, fixed the problem and was out all in 5 minutes. Impeccable service. The hotel is very, very, very luxurious. Fountains, top notch restaurants, ect. It has just about everything plus it's connected to the airport which has a 7-11 and a variety of restaurants of many different cuisine at the airport to satisfy your taste buds. This hotel is definitely expensive so it shouldn't be expected to be anything less than top of the class. (On a side note, a lot of the hotels around the airport and in downtown are pretty expensive as well, hence that's why my cousin and I stayed at a guesthouse for the remainder of our time in Hong Kong.) The rooms are very clean, very spacious, and full of detailed personal conveniences. The only thing I regret, is that I didn't stay in my room for most of the time I was there. As soon as I arrived, checked in, and clean up, I was out the door looking for adventures and didn't return until very late at night. Overall the hotel is an excellent stay, but it is very far away from downtown Hong Kong. So I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you are planning on sightseeing around Hong Kong, but if you have a 24 hour layover or for some reason, you need to stay near the airport, the Regal Airport Hotel is a very fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Comfortable Hotel, Literally on the Airport.”
Reviews.Author: ko_racer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel the night before returning to the UK, it's so easy to get to as it's attached to the airport. Staff were very helpful, room was a lttle dated but was comfortable. There's a helful TV channel showing flight departure status too. Didn't get much chace to check out the other facilities, but would use this hotel again for a pre flight sleep. A little pricey, but that's to be expected with Airport Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, shoddy hotel and poor value”
Reviews.Author: Gloomybear505
Reviews.Content: There is definitely value in having a hotel within an Airport terminal, but when it comes to just not caring at all about basic service or upkeep of a property then its value diminishes to the point of not worthwhile at all. This hotel falls within this category. Check in was unattentive at best, our first room had a horrible odor and we needed to change to a new one, and the new one had hair in the bathroom and lodged on one of the coffee cups. No in room coffee that morning. The breakfasr buffet in the restaurant was half hazard and service was poor. very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Linnbada
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very quiet considering its proximity to the airport - within walking distance. We had a late departure and the hotel was kind enough to give us a very late check out time. They also let us store some luggage while we were passing through on our way to Cambodia for a minimal fee of $1 per piece. The room was very clean and spacious by Hong Kong standards. I would definitely recommend this hotel for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional & ridiculous club level staff”
Reviews.Author: Mei L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel due to the convenience of location being connected to HKG. Throughout my stay (one week), I experienced some good & bad service which didn't bother me too much. However at the very end at checkout in the afternoon with the club level staff (I selected the club level package), I was totally pissed off with what happened. I got my bill which required payment of the meals plus a laundry charge. I immediately told the club staff the laundry charge was a mistake since I got 2 free ironing/pressing per day for staying at club level room & all I requested was pressing 1 new shirt. She removed the laundry charge and let me paid only the meals. After the payment, she got on the phone to ask another staff regarding the laundry charge. Afterwards, she told me that it seemed like the laundry staff not only pressed my shirt, but also washed it, & hence I had to pay for the washing fee. She asked if I could wait for 10 minutes for laundry staff to investigate if they washed my shirt or not, she explained that because if they did wash it then I had to pay for the washing. Of course I told her No & I would not wait because it was their mistake to not follow my order form & I would not agree to pay. Who know how long the "10 minute" could actually take??? I told her if they insisted to charge the cost, i would dispute through credit card (It's definitely not about the small amount of money but about principal ). She sensed the tension & called the laundry to stop the investigation. Seriously, she expected me to wait for at least 10 minutes for that? I was in a rush to check in to my flight and would rather spend extra time shopping inside the airport. What kind of club level customer service was that? They made a mistake & wanted me to pay for it & wanted me to sit there wasting my time to wait for the investigation. It was an awkward ending & she did not apologize at all. I could have asked for compensation for washing my new shirt without my permission as well if I had time to sit there. Other cons & pros: Cons --- my package included free buffet breakfast daily, I had it once but followed with bouts of diarrhea, never went back for breakfast again --- had to change rooms twice due to construction noises of club levels. Although I still had club level benefits after moving to regular floor, housekeeping was worse including no more fruits in the room, less bathroom supplies like comb. I called to request a comb, & operator told me there was no comb in the hotel! I told her that I had comb at club level room & moved down due to noises, she immediately sent someone to bring me a comb. What a stupid lie. --- I asked for detergent to do self-service laundry. The club level staff told me where in the hotel that I could get it done, but told me incorrectly that there was no detergent & I had to buy my own. She suggested me to find a shop at airport to get detergent. I couldn't find it & she suggested me to go to the city to buy detergent! However the next day when I talked to staff near the gym where the self-service machines were, they told me they had detergent available for a small cost. I was just not pleased at how difficult & how long it took me to get something simple done. A simple request & need that should have been met easily yet the club level staff did not want to help & offered wrong information --- did not give me any reward points or Asia miles because I did not book directly with the hotel. I booked through hotels.com & they said they could not give me even a single point or mile. The only reward points I got were the expenses at hotel restaurants. But there was a huge difference of points I could have gotten for hotel stays compared to meals. --- Loud & whining staff at 2nd floor chinese dim sum restaurant. I ate there twice. First time was during quiet hours late afternoon, it was very quiet but the staff kept complaining loudly about their long hours of work. The 2nd time it was near the end of lunch hours, staff was so busy cleaning up and setting up clean tables for the evening that they basically ignored me, hard to even get attention for hot tea refill. ---non-smooth wireless service, whenever I let my smart phone idle for a moment, I had to sign in again for internet service, so the internet service kept getting interrupted. It was better with laptop though. --- old furnitures & bathtub Pros --- the only hotel that's directly attached to airport (that maybe reason why you couldn't expect much customer service since they don't worry about volume of customers, not sure if other Regal branches also has similar "cold" attitude & management) ---Great shanghai food at G level, good customer service. ---30% discount for restaurant if you pay for club level rooms ---Staff at entrance to airport walkway was helpful with bags Overall, I would not stay again if it's not attached to airport. The hotel itself was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for layover”
Reviews.Author: edmiester
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many of times thru work and found it to be very comfortable. Although you are so close to the airport you do Not! here any of the aircraft as all windows are double glazed with darkout curtains,rooms are clean and comfortable, good size bathroom too. And during the hot month you can go down to the pool for a swim,(indoor and outdoor pools, wireless in rooms are ok but better of using ethernet either way. there is a free shuttle bus that takes you to a Mall called CITY GATE and you can do a little shopping or near by is the Chair lift that takes you to the Big Buddah HKG$120.00 round trip worth it views are great. Also in the airport at Terminal 2 are a few restaurants where you can eat but the hotel itself has a preety good Buffet B/L/Dinner. I have one grip!! check inn and check out can be extemely sloooow!!! you wonder why as there are many at the desk?? and there are 2 people checking out 1 person. It's funny they look you straight in the eye as you are trying to grab there attention and then they look away and go out the back office . Go Figure? this was the only let down.

Reviews.Title: “OK for Airport Hotels-But allow plenty of time for check-in”
Reviews.Author: MikeyR
Reviews.Content: I am NOT a fan of airport hotels, they are simply depressing places, and tend to be overpriced, and charmless. I tried the HKIA Regal Airport Hotel as I had a long layover and wanted to stay close to the airport. As far as airport hotels go, this is probably better than others, the rooms are spacious, beds are OK, and there's the basic minimum of amenities. A few things that are missing: 1. Decaf coffee (might sound pedantic, but when you trying to get a precious few hours of sleep, it maters) 2. Cleaner bathrooms, the grouting was black and nasty, and the towels are paper thin, the shower drain didn't drain, so I was showering in half a foot of water 3. Free WiFi The biggest issue I had with the hotel is the check-in/check-out process, each took more than 40 minutes. When you consider that they have a half daily rate (must be out before 11pm), then 40 minutes to check-in is a long time, there were 4 staff members, and 4 open terminals, priority is for airline crews, and it moves at a snail pace. The checkout was just as bad.. Overall, an OK hotel for an airport, but I was expecting a lot more from a place in HK, and for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but could be better”
Reviews.Author: fitzrovians
Reviews.Content: The Regal is excellently located for stop-overs in Hong Kong - literally connected to the main terminal building at the airport via an air conditioned corridor. Check-in times can be frustrating - it took us 25 minutes to get into our room - which it not exactly what you want after an intercontinental flight. It probably doesn't meet the hype of it's consistently high rankings in various hotel assessments - corridor decor is unattractive with garish carpets and tacky paintings and rooms are quite small. Quiet, apart from the noise of the essential air con, but other nearby airport hotels probably give better value. ALSO - be wary that you will be automatically enrolled in the Regal's Rewards scheme - something that yields you tons of unwanted spam emails.

Reviews.Title: “From holiday into business”
Reviews.Author: SmileyPic
Reviews.Content: It was a business stay with my husband, as we headed back to Tokyo from Penang. I took the opportunity to slow down and enjoy the OM Spa. Ms Moon was a delightful reception at the spa. Wonderful advice and I enjoyed hot stone spa and the OM signature massage, having too many golf rounds while in Penang. Room was wonderful and amazingly quiet despite of being allocated very close to one of the runaway. I certainly look forward to another stay with this hotel given another chance. A convenient and reasonably charge of same-day-return airport express ticket to Hong Kong city centre is also an added benefit for some shopping chance.

Reviews.Title: “Walk off your plane into your bedroom!”
Reviews.Author: Professional-Pilgrim
Reviews.Content: Well, not quite, but you just have to clear customs and immigration, pick up your bags from the luggage carousel, and stroll into this hotel that is integrated into one of the best airports in the world. Service is professional, rooms are very comfortable, and the breakfast buffet incredibly varied. As always in Hong Kong, a good hotel is rarely a bargain, but if you want to spend the least amount of time getting to one from the airport, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for transit stay and quite convenient”
Reviews.Author: craig_traveler
Reviews.Content: Connected ot the airport by a walkway from the arrivals level. Rooms large, views of airport and or bay are pretty good. This hotel offers a day rate of about $85 for those with very long connections. This is a busy hotel and lines at check in can be long. Plenty of airport eating options available so not necessry to choose from the hotel restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but they need to fix a few things”
Reviews.Author: klebbeck236
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and we'd consider staying here again. The room is fine (average size) and you get two free water bottles. We didn't hear any airplanes nor did we hear anything from neighboring rooms. It's quite convenient to get to and is just past the Starbucks after you exit the baggage claim. The price was reasonable at 1,275 HKD. So here were the problems: 1) Check in: It's way too long. All the agents seemed like they were rushing around and doing their jobs as best as they could but there is something wrong with the process. We noted that one person took about twenty minutes to check in once she got to the agent. I have no idea how long she waited in total. It took us about five minutes once we finally got to the agent but it was about 30 minutes in total. This seems to be a recurring theme in other reviews. I highly recommend getting the express check-out if possible so you can avoid the line on the way out. 2) There was a slight musty smell in the room. 3) One of the two outlets didn't work. I would think that this hotel is used by a lot of business travelers and this would be simply unacceptable. 4) They should have universal power outlets.

Reviews.Title: “World best airport hotel? nope”
Reviews.Author: MariaandOlivier
Reviews.Content: I just had one night in transit, and was really disappointed. The only friendly staff were the bell boys, the reception and business center help were inefficient and seemed bored to assist. And I only checked in and out, no fancy demand whatsoever from my side. One thing that really put me off is that internet is charged... For a 2500HK$ night in their "club suite", that is just ridiculous. Their morning breakfast is plain boring and would fit a 2 star hotel. The "suite" was good, however the complimentary water bottle hidden away. A lot of annoying details that made the stay not so great.

Reviews.Title: “Longest check out ever.”
Reviews.Author: traveller2255
Reviews.Content: I had three rooms with my kids and used them for 10 hours end of July.  Stay at this hotel only If you have to. It's a 3 stars at best. Took me 45 minutes to check out! That's the longest check out process ever experienced by me. Long que and inexperienced staff. Check in wasn't too fast either. Bad room service food. Tasted very bad and left us all disgusted. Swimming pool was ok. But no shallow water for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “so convenient”
Reviews.Author: tav_mind
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a short covered walk from the baggage area - like it is part of the airport! This is brilliant for a stop-over. It is quiet and standard fare otherwise for a huge hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cetainly not 'the best airport hotel in the world'. Average hotel at best.”
Reviews.Author: Norwatt
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location with you being able to walk from the arrivals hall to the hotel which is why we used it as really easy with luggage and a small family. But that's pretty much its only good point. It has lots of signs up proudly stating that it is the 'best airport hotel in the world'. This is certainly not the case, maybe Skytrax have not ever stayed in any other airport hotels? The Hilton at Narita and the Sofitel at Gatwick both outclass this hotel as a start. As stated in other reviews, check in and out takes a long time. Regardless of the eight desks that exist, management need to realise you need to put staff behind them for them to operate. There were only two desks open whenever we were there and there was always a queue. We booked two rooms and requested them to be connecting as we were travelling with a small family. We even emailed their reservation desk a few days before to check they had the request (which they had). Got to check in and told no connecting rooms available. Argued with front of house staff until mysteriously connecting rooms were found. This shook my faith in the hotel as usually if you request and then check they got the request hotels usually manage it. Suspect that very little care is taken on special requests, so families beware! Once we arrived in the room the connecting doors were locked. Phoned reception and no one answered. Tried again and rung for a long time and still no answer. This was the first time I have ever been in a hotel and had reception not answer the phone. Phoned house keeping, who answered after a reasonable time who sent someone up who didn't have the key. Said he would come back and didn't. Phoned again and no one came again. Eventually after we went down to the reception desk, they managed to get someone to unlock it. This was hours after we had arrived in our room and we thought was just terrible service. Whilst the rooms were quiet from aircraft noise the phones in the rooms mysteriously rang at various times in the night and early morning with no-one ever there. Ended up having to unplug them as they had no 'do not disturb' feature. Staff also entered our room one evening past 11pm to 'help us check out' (which we weren't until the next day). They knocked only as they unlocked and opened the door and arrived in the room before we could even get near the door. Thank heaven we weren't in any kind of compromising position! We will never be leaving the chain off a hotel door again. Staff repeated the same at 9am to see if we wanted the room cleaned even though we were checking out two hours later. We thought barging into the room without knocking and waiting for an answer first was extremely bad practice. Lots of other things let the hotel down. The safe in one room didn't work (didn't bother reporting it as it took four calls and over five hours to get them to manage something simple like unlock a connecting door). Toilet also constantly running in one of the bedrooms (fixed that myself as again easier than phoning them). The ironing board collapsed when you actually tried to iron on it. All the bathroon floors were extremely slippery. I fell three times in our bathroom despite trying to be careful and the lobby toilets with the same flooring permanently had a wet floor warning board up even though the floor was dry so it is clearly a known problem. Has a really odd childrens playground which has just three plastic climbing things in it, which are in full sun and are so hot they are untouchable by 11am. Nice idea, but like many things in the hotel, poor delivery. On a postive side the concierge were really good and efficent. Answered the phone in about three rings, did what you asked quickly and pleasantly and efficently. Maybe they should be running the hotel? Spa staff also nice (but oddly never ask if you would like a locker key even though it it obvious you need one), pool nice. Beds were also comfy. So apart from the location and concierge, the hotel really isn't worth staying at. The hotel could be really good, but the delivery of most aspects lets it down. We had a dreadful time. It's the details that define the difference between an average hotel and a great hotel. This is definitely average at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport location and great room”
Reviews.Author: jaime000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while doing an overnight in Hong Kong. Everything was very nice. Great check-in and wonderful room. I did not hear a thing even though there were obviously airplanes arriving and departing. The only reason I did not give this property five stars was that even though I waited a reasonable time to be checked in I went down to the lobby later on. The line was very long and only two desk clerks were on duty. This property is in desperate need of registration help.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to break your journey”
Reviews.Author: daveevans22
Reviews.Content: Very comfy,lots of faclilities, great staff and good prices. Ask about upgrading to an exec suite, if you use use all the facilities, wi-fi, food, drinks, you'll save money and have a much better room.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the air traveller who arrives late or leaves early”
Reviews.Author: goodfoodfanOZ
Reviews.Content: You reach the hotel via a sky walk from the arrivals terminal. We had a flight out at 7.30 am and spent the night at the Regal airport hotel which was very convenient. Check-in was slow and unfriendly, check-out was fast and unfriendly. Front desk certainly could not care less about customers. Room was small but modern with a fantastic and very big king size bed and we slept very well. Bathroom is very small as well with shower over bath. L'Occitane amenties in the bathroom. We booked a club level room. The Club Lounge offered a very good selection of hot and cold food and drinks and you really don't need to go over to the airport to have dinner. The lady in the club lounge was a lot nicer than her collegues from front desk. For convenience reasons we would stay there again for one night if it makes air travel less stressful. It is not cheap though and if you can plan ahead you can save money by booking their 30 days in advance non-refundable rate.

Reviews.Title: “well needed resting place”
Reviews.Author: tassie7
Reviews.Content: We were returning from europe to australia and had an 18 hour transit in hong kong. we were all exhausted as none of us slept on the plane and we had another 12 hours till home. The room cost $160 u/s for 12 hours. We asked for twin but ended up with family suite as no other rooms. The room was spacious, but smelt musty. All we wanted to do all day was sleep and we advised the reception staff of this. The room they allocated us was right beside a room the were doing repairs or something on. There was a constant loud drilling most of the day. By the time we said something they offered to move us, but we were to exhausted. There was no other form of compensation, just the reception staff saying too bad, sorry, but you can have a voucher for a drink next time yo stay!! It was nice to have somewhere to stretch out considering the airport lounge wanted to charge us $160 u/s per person for 3 of us which is robbery!

Reviews.Title: “Strictly Transit Only”
Reviews.Author: BillM1964
Reviews.Content: You can walk to the hotel from the Arrival Hall, which is why I stayed here and will again. But that is this hotel's sole redeeming feature. If you are in HK for any reason other than a short transit - avoid this hotel, which is 3 star at best. Dreadful rooms- no walk-in shower. Check-in and check-out is a farce. Expect / allow 30 minutes for each. The queue snakes around the hotel lobby to undermanned and mostly vacant counters. When you eventually get there expect the rudest service you can imagine. I was racially abused by the counter staff who presumed, because I am a Caucasian, that I do not speak Cantonese. I do because I lived in HK before and my wife is Chinese. Wholly unacceptable. For convenience it is worth putting up with this appalling hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEST AIRPORT HOTEL WE KNOW”
Reviews.Author: anndenMelbourne
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous airport hotel this is! If there is better we would like to know where it is. Well sized rooms, comfortable beds and NO AIRCRAFT NOISE! What a discovery! Changi airport management should come here and try it out. Windows are at least 8 cm gap double glazed and planes fly past them just like a glider. Serice was good, food acceptable, and it's an easy walk from the arrival teminal. Plenty of restuarants to suit all tastes and a spa for those who would like it. What more could anyone want of an airport hotel apart from free high speed broadband and they have that too!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Great Work Regal Hotels

Reviews.Title: “Best airport hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: NLThompson
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Regal Airport Hotel in Hong Kong on our way to and from Europe. Except for a slow and chaotic check-in the first time, everything about the hotel was excellent. Well appointed rooms, excellent executive lounge and outstanding service throughout the hotel. I'm planning on staying at this hotel when I travel through Hong Kong again in October.

Reviews.Title: “This should be kept a secret”
Reviews.Author: ty_of_perth
Reviews.Content: On a recent business trip I decided to break a long haul flight with a stop in Hong Kong. I chose the Regal Airport Hotel for one primary reason, and I am glad I did. They have a unique 24 hours stay arrangement where I checked in at 20:30 and I checked out at 20:30 the next day. The bonus came with the fact that the room is superb, the bed was soft and comfortable by Asian standards, and quiet. Situated at the airport and connected by an enclosed walkway, it is just a few minutes walk away. The airport express train is also right there in the main terminal, so the hotel can also be used as a base if required. The costs of the train was not too expensive and gets you into Hong Kong Central very quickly. The Star Ferry is then just around the corner if you want to go to Kowloon. I only stayed one night, so cannot comment on other aspects of the Hotel, but I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 5:00 PM after a 14 hour flight.. What we liked about this hotel was that the reservation was for 24 hours from the time of check in. As our next flight departed at 7:00 PM the following evening this worked out very well. We upgraded to the executive package upon check in(they were offering a special) which we found to be good value as it included a nicer larger room, free cocktails and appetizers in the evening , a full buffet breakfast the next morning,free internet and use of the spa and fitness facilities.Very pleasant room and nice hotel facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good feeling”
Reviews.Author: matgray
Reviews.Content: Book in was abysmal, I was 4th. in line and it took me 30 minutes to reach the desk. As my flight wasn't until 11.30 p.m. next night I asked for a late check out; The answer was a curt denial as I had made a booking for only 1 night. Even though I requested a room near the lift I was given a room far away from it. Won't be staying here again even though the location is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - if you have meetings at the airport”
Reviews.Author: maoodi
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, clean & comfortable rooms, good house keeping and service. If you are on a business trip book the "executive" room, the extra costs includes wi-fi, ironing, breakfast and access to the lounge. I will recommend this hotel if you have meetings near the airport or a conference or for a one night stay - this is because all the action is in the city and you have to take the "airport express" to get there. (BTW- this train is an EXCELLENT service!)

Reviews.Title: “Better than just a transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenNZ12
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay. We arrived in Hongkong with 12 hours to shed and in the afternoon got a room spare of the moment at the Regal. Superb service and the room was so nice we wished we had of stayed longer. Although it was pricey it was so well worth the 5 hours sleep and shower we got. We'd defiantely stay here again. In the morning we caught the bus to the cable car on lantau island and then caught the cable car up to see the Big Buddah. Awesome trip and would definately recommend morning because by afternoon the lines are astronomical.

Reviews.Title: “Management could be more professional!”
Reviews.Author: kejey
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you're looking for a stopover between flights. I had 5 nights mixing conference and leisure. A "free" shuttle that transfers guests between the hotel and the outlet malls however is not all what it seems. We waited at 9.45pm for the return shuttle only to be randomly told by a guy on the street that the shuttle wasn't coming. Two train trips later and we arrived back at the hotel 115 HKD lighter and it was now 11.30pm. On top of this we went to reception to check that our burst toilet pipe from the ungodly hour of 4.45am had been fixed to find that it wasn't and we had to change rooms. I asked that the Manager call us which he did, and questioned about the shuttle. Yes I was tired and grumpy but all he could do was laugh, tell me it was an accident on the road, and laugh again. Not professional as far as I'm concerned. And as for the jeweller in the reception area...all I can say is "what a piranha!" I made the fatal mistake of showing interest in a ring and everytime we walked past he came out of his shop and straight for us. Not a comfortable way to check out when you're trying to run the gauntlet. All round the food was pretty average. Sure they have just won the Skytrax award 2011 for best airport hotel however simple things like universal adapters in the room should be standard rather than having to ask reception.

Reviews.Title: “The best transit break you could experience”
Reviews.Author: hongkongtransit
Reviews.Content: Recently flew from London to Sydney with a 9 hour stop over in Hong Kong. We decided to make the most of this time and get a room at the Regal Airport. My daughter and I had a fabulous break, whilst she enjoyed a gym workout, I had a beautiful swim in the outdoor pool (even though the indoor pool looked equally enticing). We then decided to treat ourselves to a spa treatment which was incredible - such a beautiful room, fabulous treatment and such incredible value. We then showered and enjoyed a terrific meal downstairs. Neither of us wanted to leave but getting on another nine hour flight was a breeze as we felt so refreshed. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED and worth having a longer delay at the airport just for this experience..

Reviews.Title: “The best for one night in the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Principissimo
Reviews.Content: The Regal hotel is perfect if you have to spend one night in Hong Kong airport. It is directly linked to the terminal with 5 minutes walk. At the basement of the hotel you'll find some restaurants. I had dinner in a japanese and it was really very good. Rooms are nice and no noises from outside. I was on the club floor and had complimentary breakfast in a nice lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: Wildlilac
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location - right next to the airport. Stayed in this hotel for one night, on transit to Canada. The bed was not very comfortable and not very clean. The bathroom was a tad small and dim. You can eat at the airport or in the hotel. Or you can take a free shuttle to the Citygate mall. There are restaurants, a grocery store and you can do some shopping there too. Unfortunately I would rather stay at the Novotel (again) that is attached to the Citygate mall when I'm in transit in HK next time around - cleaner room.

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: watsonjohng
Reviews.Content: I usually have an aversion to staying in airport hotels, so I was truly amazed to find the Regal Airport HKG so welcoming and accommodating. The service was first class as was the room. The biggest surprise was the excellence of their restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms & service - but excellent location for transit through Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: CarKri02
Reviews.Content: We arranged a day stay at the hotel whilst transiting from Australia enroute to Canada with a 9 hour stopover. I found this hotel online and checked out the reviews on trip advisor before booking it direct through their website (you are unable to book a day stay through any of the regular accommodation sites). Overall, this hotel was perfect to rest and refresh ready for our continued journey with our 2 young children. I would highly recommend staying here if you are stuck in HK for several hours waiting for a connection. Good points - excellent location: only a short walk across an enclosed pedestrian bridge from the airport - you can see the hotel from the windows of the luggage hall; allow 30-45 mins to disembark from the plane, catch the train to the arrivals area in the terminal (this is easy - clearly signposted and trains run every 2-3 mins), clear immigration, and walk to the hotel (this was easy enough for us to do, even with 2 young kids in tow) - great health spa - can book a massage/treatment before or on arrival - my masseuse was excellent! - pleasant poolside area with excellent changerooms - quiet rooms (we had a room overlooking the runway with no external noise whatsoever) - regal club room came with free internet access A few annoyances: - variable staff - the health spa staff were very helpful, the reception was a little hit & miss - despite requesting a 7am check-in at the time of booking our room was still not ready when we finally arrived at 9am after our flight was delayed (they did however supply us with a free buffet breakfast voucher which we enjoyed) - priority check-in ignored - we had also booked a Regal Club room with priority check-in - I had to wait at the priority check-in counter on two separate occasions with different staff where I presented to see if our room was ready yet, whilst several people that arrived after me at the standard check-in counter were served first! - uninspiring rooms with bland decor - we booked a regal club room which was very standard in its presentation (so much so that I rang the assistant manager when we arrived to confirm if we were actually in a regal club room); however, it was comfortable enough, clean and the bathroom was nicely refurbished and well stocked with necessary toiletries - corridors in our wing smelt like guests have previously smoked there, even if not presently allowed - I was much relieved to find the room was odour free though - regal club room comes with club access with free refreshments, but we discovered when we arrived that we couldn't use it because children are not allowed Overall, if you are transiting through HK with several hours between connecting flights then I would definitely recommend staying here. We thoroughly enjoyed the ability to lie supine, go have a spa treatment, and take the kids to the pool for a refreshing swim. If you are staying overnight or longer, then I would definitely recommend to head into Hong Kong proper instead.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience trumps price”
Reviews.Author: Canadian079
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the Hong Kong Airport for one night while on our way to Singapore. Access to the hotel is directly from the airport, about a five minute walk from the luggage retrieval area. The hotel lobby is large, bright and well appointed. We had made our reservation directly from the hotel website. We had booked their advance internet option which was less expensive than any of the discount internet websites. The reservation came with free access to broadband internet, pools and gym. Check-in was fast and efficient. Our room was quite large by Hong Kong standards. It was very clean and well appointed. The bed was king size and very comfortable. The bathroom was fine as well although it could be updated somewhat. The bathroom plumbing was not well sound proofed – it sometimes sounded like the person using the bathroom next door was in our bathroom. The hallways are of the art deco style – with mirrors and nice colours that make them quite attractive. The gym was well equipped for a good workout after a long flight. The pools were described as being heated. But they were both very cold. The saunas and steam rooms (one for women and one for men) were great – very hot and clean. We would recommend this hotel for one night during transit. It is expensive though. But by the time you pay for a hotel in the city along with the transit fares the cost worked about to be about the same and much more convenient. There is nothing to do in the area so using the hotel facilities makes sense. Food and drinks are easily obtainable in the airport at a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate location for business & pleasure”
Reviews.Author: jstavenow
Reviews.Content: Easy check-in directly at the airport. Easy transport by airport-train to downtown Hongkong where you can reach excellent restaurants & bars and shopping within walking distance. In a few minutes by taxi you can reach the cable car. Take a trip and have a breathless view over Hongkong area. Excellent service at the hotel from arrival to departure!

Reviews.Title: “Overprice and non-smoking tooms that smell of cigarette smoke”
Reviews.Author: steve2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient for a stop over and early morning flight. The facilities were nothing special and not worth the HK$ 2478 (special rate) AUD$315 per night.. Overpriced for the standard of the hotel. Our non-smoking room 1158 smelled of cigarette smoke. Internet is expensive although ours was included in rate (for one wifi device)

Reviews.Title: “Long checkin delay, charges for everything”
Reviews.Author: JosephAlsop
Reviews.Content: I paid a high rate so as to not have to take the train into Hong Kong. Instead of the fast 25 minute train ride to a better hotel, I waited in the checkin line for an hour. Then the WiFi didn't work and they overcharged for it, but at that point I just wanted to checkout as quickly as possible

Reviews.Title: “Mouthwash in the minibar menu.”
Reviews.Author: Audriano
Reviews.Content: Cathay Pacific (great caring airlines) booked this one for us, as we missed the connecting flight in Hong Kong - and as far as I understand this is the only hotel IN (not "close to") the airport. Which is convenient. But apart from location and good food, that's all good there really is. The staff (some of them) are apathetic and sometimes on the verge of being cocky and rude. The wi-fi costs...wait for it...17 US Dollars - for 24 hours (when you only need one or two) and mouthwash is included in the minibar menu. The room had no A/C and the whole hotel smelled of something artificial - some perfume you just can't escape and get rid of. The "smoking floors" aren't ventilated and smell badly of tobacco - the guests must be puffing one after another their whole stay. That's the impression I got. I had to switch to a non-smoking floor. But then I got a room close to the elevator - it was very noisy - elevators making a whole bunch of sounds the whole night; but my earplugs saved me... The "rubber carpet" inside the bathroom looked really cheap and disgusting. Get rid of it! Now. So if you're a 'up in the air' type of cynical traveler and absolutely NEED to stay close to the airport - I guess, Regal's the one (cos you're out of options anyway).

Reviews.Title: “If you need a airport hotel in Honk Kong ...”
Reviews.Author: oguzk
Reviews.Content: If you need an airport hotel in Hong Kong stay there. Its in the airport you can reach the hotel with a very short walk. We had to stay overnight in Hong Kong, we were reaching the airport so late so we preferred this hotel and we had no problem. After we checked out, also they kept our luggage all the day when we enjoyed Giant Buda in Lantau island. We can recommend the hotel if you need a hotel around airport.

Reviews.Title: “Apart from location, it wasn't my greatest experience.”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_boy1969
Reviews.Content: The only thing this hotel has going for it is it's location. The front counter service is appalling. I arrived in the morning and had booked an early check in prior to arriving, they assured me it will be ok. They made me wait just under 5 hours before they could offer me a room so I had to sit in the foyer and wait! Absolutely no sympathy and no care. Every hour I would ask if my room was ready and they did not take any initiative to keep me informed as to how much longer I had to wait. If I didn't continue to ask them I reckon I would still be there waiting. Seriously, the staff working on the front counter need some real customer service training. I've stayed at other hotels in HK and they know how to treat their customers. Not these guys. Once you go upstairs in your room I guess you find all that you expect. A clean room, spacious enough and a reasonable bed to sleep on. Having said that, I will never stay there again due to the way they treat their customers.

Reviews.Title: “It's Just an Average Hotel Placed at the Airport... So You Pay for Convenience!”
Reviews.Author: Bette M
Reviews.Content: Gigantic, but ugly lobby, brusque front desk staff that detest airport traveler guests and utterly outdated rooms (5 star at least 10 years ago). Hordes of airline staff overtake the front desk... despite that they have a designated area. The designated line is for "no charges incurred" check-out... they all have at least one charge so have to join the hotel guest lines for check-out. Breakfast is in the basement! The simplest of buffets spread out to give the impression that it is extensive. The room manager hovers over his staff and the guests like an irritating gnat! Overall, book here only if you must. Like if us, if you arrive late at night and have a morning connecting flight. In that regard, it serves its purpose, but at astronomical rates. Otherwise, it only serves to be the uglier side of Hong Kong's "can build it real big" structures.

Reviews.Title: “scam photos”
Reviews.Author: qrm2
Reviews.Content: I saw on a website a photo of the deluxe suite, had a tub in the room next t to the four poster bed etc. and thought why not splash out and get a nice room. What we got was nothing like the photo (turns out its a picture of the spa). The room had no heating!! They brought in a wonky old electric radiator that stunk when turned on. When you factor in the price very poor value for money, the only saving grace was that you can walk to the the airport. So the question would i recommend to a friend tough call if you need an early start yes but go for the cheapest room.

Reviews.Title: “high charges for internet access”
Reviews.Author: colesm
Reviews.Content: I checked in to this hotel at 23.00 and checked out at 0530 the following day - I logged on to the wifi system with my laptop and with my iphone - the charges were £22 I call this excessive. The charges are per device. No other problems with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: hgaur
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient for catching a flight from the airport. However, it is quite expensive and other cheaper hotels are available. I had read good reviews about this hotel and so decided to stay here. The checkin was a bit chaotic. They should employ more people at the check in. The hotel is close to the airport express line which takes you straight to the airport quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Souless business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Markymoke
Reviews.Content: Just two good things about this hotel, check-out and nice beds. I had no choice in staying at this hotel due to my airline messing up my flight and they booked this hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “The loudest plumbing in the world and the worst sound proofing”
Reviews.Author: TheHorseys
Reviews.Content: The Regal has two advantages - a bridge linking it to the arrivals area of HK airport, and a great gym, but otherwise the hotel has few other redeeming features. Who builds an airport hotel which is not properly sound proofed against the noise of planes? You're going to get loud planes in an airport and if you build an airport hotel the guests should not be disturbed. Worse, the plumbing is absurdly loud. So a plane makes noise in the early hours. I wake up, and so does half the hotel. The other guests then go to the toilet and the flushing keeps me awake for longer. If anyone takes a shower at five thirty anyone nearby is going to hear it (that would be me). My sleep quality here was the worst I have ever had on a trip. Coughing in the corridors can be heard as the doors are so thin. Jet engines late into the night and the rush of water through pipes. The front desk staff were not very service oriented and seemed harried. There was a long queue for check in at 11pm and under stress, the staff practiced a style of barking answers at guests in a manner which went out of fashion with the advent of customer service training in other hotels twenty years ago. The English language of the staff was much poorer than in other Hong Kong or Shenzhen hotels in which I have stayed. The carpets are bright and jaunty in the corridors, but the room decor was tired (cracked tiles in the bathroom, taupe carpets and sad fawn coloured walls), breakfast was lacklustre (bacon which resembled strips of shoe leather and very limited selection). Yes you can get a cappucino, but that is not enough to make me want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great facilities”
Reviews.Author: lauzc87
Reviews.Content: My flight was delayed in Hong Kong for 9 hours, so Cathay Pacific used the Regal Hotel for us to stay. I found the hotel to be very, very clean and it had fantastic facilities, spa, pool etc. I didn't find the reception staff to be as helpful as at other hotels and found them to lack good manners and customer service skills. A smile, please and thank you go a long way! The room which I stayed in was very large in comparison to other hotel rooms in Hong Kong and was extremely clean and tidy. The bed was very comfy and I had a fantastic nights sleep. My room overlooked the run way and cargo planes, but I didn't find this caused any problems. The hotel is situated around 5 minutes walk from the main airport terminals with good signage and very easy to walk to.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: Amritkar
Reviews.Content: 2nd November - 5th Novemer 2010 Very Cosy, quite but still connected. Very good connectivity between airport and the city center. Me and my wife - Priti, had a good business as well as personal time. The Conference & Exhibition venue was close by and shopping / site seeing at Kowloon and Hongkong was simply superb.. The room view was great and with multi national cuisine the stay was just perfect. The room TV was good in particular the updates from the airport - arrivals and departures made us feel more relaxed at the time we were to check out. Would definitely recommed to one and all visiting Hongkong for business and pleasure Nilesh and Priti Amritkar Envirocare Labs Pvt Ltd, Thane, India

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, worth the value.”
Reviews.Author: TIRUMAL
Reviews.Content: we had booked a room at the hotel during the stay during Oct, 2010. the hotel is excellent and is connecting to the airport. we can directly enter into the hotel 2nd floor where in they have the reception, from the hong kong airport. we can walk through. location wise great, our room was upgraded automatically without paying and extra and the rooms were excellent. the view from the room also was too good as we could see the sea from there. great great location. there are atleast 3 restaurants out of which one is a chines and other a buffet lunch and dinner. we had our lunch at the buffet restaurant which had a variety of dishes. Non veg lovers will love them the most. the chinese restaurant is the best, loved it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “NOT YET”
Reviews.Author: bengcosbimm
Reviews.Content: ACUTALLY I AM staying THERE overnight this january 2011, I HOPE im gonna SATISFIED COZ ItS KIND OF EXPENSIVE.. i am hoping that this the best hotel I ever stay...THANKS

Reviews.Title: “Regal rip-off”
Reviews.Author: GlobalHealthGuy
Reviews.Content: There are two reasons to stay at the Regal Airport Hotel-HK: it's at the airport and it's got a decent fitness centre. That's it. Otherwise it's just a glitzy lobby. Rooms are comfy enough, but I expect better at this price and for a Four/Five Star. There was mildew in the bathtub, paint around the toilet base was chipped and peeling, Internet is not free (at this price? you've got be be kidding!), my On Demand movies were not working, and in-room amenities were aenemic, restaurant prices are gobsmacking. Unless you really are pressed for a convenient transit hotel, hop the train to a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FlyPrinces8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a business trip. We had a meeting rate which included breakfast and internet, so the rate was very reasonable. The hotel was attached to the airport and was very easy to get a cab, shuttle, or train! The ride to Kow Loon and Hong Kong was very quick. There were multiple restaurants: the breakfast buffet was regular dependable breakfast food and the chinese restaurant had a good variety! There were complimentary bottles of water in the room and there were good tv channels! I would stay at a Regal again!

Reviews.Title: “SUPER EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: henri066
Reviews.Content: very good service,excellent polite and kind crew; these people made us feel like we were there personal guests.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the day rate”
Reviews.Author: questoz
Reviews.Content: made the booking online, direct with the hotel. I only needed the room for a few hours for a lay down, shower and check emails. At check in got told room wasn't ready, will be a 2 hours. Finally got a room that was dirty and the internet didn't work. Next time I will stay at the airport and pay to go into the Pay-In Lounge at Hong Kong airport.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but way too expensive and nothing special”
Reviews.Author: CositaBerlin
Reviews.Content: I have chosen the airport hotel since I had to leave Hong Kong early next day. Despite the quite convenient location the hotel is not much to talk about. The service has been ok but not outstanding. The room had already been a deluxe room but did not look like that at all. I wonder what the standard room looks like then. You could always hear the neighbor using the shower or the toilet. The nice thing though is that the hotel is directly connected with Terminal 1 and it takes only about 5 minutes to walk from the hotel to the terminal. Poor price-performance ratio!

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it - absolutely brilliant!!!”
Reviews.Author: Danniboii100
Reviews.Content: Our Virgin Atlantic flight back to England broke down on the runway so they checked us in to the Regal Airport Hotel, said they would drop off our bags in our room and gave all 3 of us free dinner buffet vouchers, which was nice. Check in was very smooth. We immediately went to the buffet place as we were so hungry. They seated us in seconds and let us enjoy the meal. There was such a large selection which didn't have a chance to get round to all of it! There was a chocolate fountain for the marshmellows which my children absolutely loved and a wide range of cusine for me as well. My favourite was the grain-fed chicken. That is so rare! Most chicken is fodder-fed and does not taste as nice as grain-fed chicken. Before we went to our room, we checked out the complex. There was some singing entertainment and a nice little shop in which we bought some souvenirs to take home with us. Great! We decided to go to the room with the place having impressed us so much and our stomachs bursting. The room did not disappoint. It was spanking clean, and because it was on the wrong side of the airport, was very quiet as well. The beds were so comfy, much better than lots of hotels we stayed at. We asked them to give us a wake up call at 5am (that was the inconvienient time our new flight was leaving at - the kids weren't too pleased!!!) and fell asleep straight away. I didn't want to leave! Brilliant Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: maeve27
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one day in January when our flight was re-scheduled. The rooms were spacey and beautiful. The food was wonderful. You can just take the train to go around Hong Kong. The beds were big and comfy and just invites you to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Berto13749
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week on a reunion of the ex HKG Airport Managers association. We stayed at the executive floor and were thoroughly spoiled by very attentive staff in the Club lounge as well as everything else being perfect, No wonder you were again voted bast airport hotel in the world. Well done and Thanks Albert and Angie Janssen

Reviews.Title: “Recommend for stop over night as in airport and can take luggage up”
Reviews.Author: TRAVEL68
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 kids stopped at Hong Kong Regal Hotel coming back from Europe, we enjoyed it as it was in the airport and you could take all your luggage with the airport trolley upto the door of the hotel and then the concierge transferred it to your room. Had 1 room, little bit small the room but just to sleep was ok. We liked it as when we needed to eat we just went into airport terminal and all food courts were 5 min walk from hotel. Also we did not hear the airplanes going at all.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay and easy for downtown as well”
Reviews.Author: pa3576
Reviews.Content: I am a regular visitor to the HKG Airport Regal...especially the Executive floor. You will struggle to find a better hotel and better value in HKG. Don't be put off by it being at the Airport. The train is 24 minutes to central and runs every 12 mins. Day returns are the same as one way. Good rooms and very good staff . I have given up on staying down town. You can base yourself at the airport for much less and still be in town in less than half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Bugy_10
Reviews.Content: I have business needs to often travel to and through Hong Kong and always select Regal Airport Hotel. The staff in the Club Lounge are of the highest trained , courteous and efficient. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Loaction but poor family policy”
Reviews.Author: 0362Paul
Reviews.Content: The Regal is a great stopover hotel if your are there for a day as we were. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the hotel is attached directly to HKG international airport. It is also a short taxi ride from Disneyland whch is why we stopped the night. On arrival it became clear that the hotel has just 3 rooms with 2 queen size beds and neither had been allocated to us. We were tired and so we accepted the room on offer ( we had little choice) but it was made clear to the hotel that this was really not acceptable as they had been told months ago that we were coming. To their credit they accepted that they were at fault and provided a rollaway and no cost and breakfast for all 4 of us which was a nice touch and an excellent piece of service recovery. The rollaway accomodated the 8 year old and the 6 year old slept with us. The bed was enormous and we all slept well. If coming here with kids make sure you ask for a room with 2 double beds. They also have a policy of 24 hour access to the room so if you arrive at 11pm you can stay till 11pm the following night, no noon check out nonsense here. This is a great idea and perfect at airports.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 30 Days”
Reviews.Author: JWilliamsFlask
Reviews.Content: I loved the location. Local transportation abounds. As all hotels, food and dry cleaning was expensive. Service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to be stuck”
Reviews.Author: katiekins570
Reviews.Content: I was put here by my airline after my flight was delayed until the next day. While I was pretty cranky about the whole situation, the hotel was not a bad place to be stranded. On the plus sides, the room was very comfortable, the little patio area was nice with a view of the pool, the pool seemed nice (but I was stranded without my luggage so no swimsuit), and it was extremely accessible to the airport, which was very convenient. Also, the buffet restaurant was surprisingly good, specializing in seafood. The house-cured smoked salmon, sashimi, and chocolate fondue fountain were highlights. Downsides: the business center was very expensive, which was frustrating as I needed to get in touch with people about my changed travel plans. Also, the walls were very, very thin, meaning that starting around 5am, I kept waking up hearing other people showering.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the airport, great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: jstrickland
Reviews.Content: The airline put us up due to an overnight delay. We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel. We loved that it was attached to the terminal and we could walk to our gate in the morning rather than wait for a shuttle. The lobby is big and fancy, albeit somewhat randomly decorated. Rooms were nothing too special, but clean and modern-looking with nice amenities and good water pressure in the shower. The best part of our stay was the breakfast buffet. It was huge and had an amazing variety of both American and Asian foods, with table service by great waiters. We were pleased with our stay and would stay again if we had a flight to catch early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could've stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: willtravel67
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of an early flight out, otherwise, to be honest, would've remained at the YMCA Salisbury in Kowloon. However, having said that, as good as the YMCA was, this was a far superior quality hotel, for not a whole lot more money, and we even had our very own 747 parked outside the window (room overlooked the apron) to boot! We only had about 7 hours in the room, after a splendid meal in the hotel's Chinese restaurant, because of our early departure, but would've liked to have had more time to enjoy the luxurious room we were allocated. The room was so good, I'm still not sure we didn't get an upgrade without being told. It was modern, ,with every expected 5 star luxury and was very comfortable, as I say, just a shame we couldn't have stayed longer. The only thing to point out would be, if our experience is anything to go by, to make sure you allow, as we did, plenty of time to check out, as the queues were quite significant, even at 5.45 in the morning, other than that though, a very pleasant place to stay if you have an earlish departure or a lay-over of several hours.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Defenders
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel June 14th it is at the Hong Kong airport. You pick up your bags and walk to the hotel. It's convenient especially when you arrive late or have an early flight out. Hotel is expensive for an average hotel. Room service is pricey (US $10.00 for soup plus gov't and service tax). Breakfast buffet at restaurant is so average. They need to work on their website. I initially booked a room in the club level, I indicated there were 2 adults and 1 five year old child in my party. I received two separate emails confirming my booking. Two days before my arrival I received an email indicating my room would be changed because children are not allowed in the club lounge or floor. I stayed two weeks later at Novotel Citygate which has a free shuttle to and from airport. It is nicer and less expensive. Novotel is connected to a mall so you have other restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay with when you are in short of time but want to take a nap / short tour in Hongkong”
Reviews.Author: Marutha
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay with when you are in short of time but want to take a nap / short tour in Hongkong. I stayed in this hotel when I could not catch the connecting flight at Hongkong and airline provided this hotel for a night and half of day. It is conveniently located within airport and with all facilities. Eventhough I am not sure about tariff and other details, it is worth for money hotel. I stayed there on a wednesday night and Thursday was my fasting. I went out for sight seeing and came back to hotel by around mid day. I have decided not to take lunch since I take only vegetarian during fasting but to my surprise I got Indian vagetarian food and it was really nice. Also I have to mention about cleanliness which is really impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the early morning HKG flights...”
Reviews.Author: idontlikechina
Reviews.Content: I tend to stay at this hotel whenever the rates are not outrageous, but usually only on the night before I depart HKG for home, as if I am going to have anything more than a day in Hong Kong, or upon my arrival, I try to get closer to where I can pick up a train into China without dealing with getting into the city in the morning when everyone and their sister is trying to do the same thing. With the hotel attached to the airport, there is never a need to use a hotel shuttle, it's a quick walk from the hotel's reception desk to the airport, which is by far the only reason I can see anyone spending the premium to stay here and is definitely the best thing about this hotel. And for being so close to the airport, it' is a very quiet hotel, which is nice too! The rooms are pretty basic, not a lot of frills, with the same little sketch of some nude body in every bathroom I have ever been in. They will try to upgrade you to the Regal floors, but there was always a charge and for what it sounded like you get, I never found that worth the $'s. There are some good resturant choices in the hotel and a few shops that nobody ever seems to be in too.. The hotel is clean and convenient and when in transit, that's the most important feature in my opinion. If you do stay here, dont' forget the airport express train if you want to head into the city, as it is a lot cheaper and faster than a taxi, unless you have 3 or four people, then it's close to a wash on cost, but the train will get you there in just over 20 minutes, without dealing with traffic, which is nice. You may also want to keep in mind that at check out time in preparation for a morning flight, nearly every other person using that hotel all have the same 8am or so flight time out of there and as such, there may be a long line of people waiting to check out...so you may want to check out the express check out options when you check in if you are going to be in a hurry in the morning of your departure.

Reviews.Title: “A warm bed awaits you as soon as you land!”
Reviews.Author: Almacastellino
Reviews.Content: I booked for 3 nights Walk out of the immigration in Hong Kong and before you can reach the departure gate of the Airport you are in the Hotel. When on a business trip I always stay at the Regal Hotel In Hong Kong. When you have done more that 6 hours of flying in an Economy seat, the first thing you look forward to is a nice comfortable hotel. No matter what time of day you arrive, the hotel is always just a few steps away!!!! The Regal Hotel is In the Airport and has all the trimmings you need to feel pampered. I Always head for the room service menu and order a large breakfast. The service is good and in no time you have it at your door. Since my flight gets in early morning i always have a few hours to relax before i head for a meeting. The room is large and comfortable and and the bathroom is well stocked with all the shower gels and creams you need. Like any 5 star hotel it comes with all the facilities you need.Laundry, 24 hour room service, business Centre. And Internet. When business is done i take the city shuttle the hotel provides to its other hotel in the city and then take the MTR, depending where i want to go....If i don't feel like going far, I go to the Novotel, City Gate near Tung Chung station and shop in the 3 level shopping mall there. The restaurants in the Departure hall of the Airport offer some great eating places. And coffee shops. The view of the planes taking off and landing is also a nice way to spend time when business is done and you are planning your next day. If Business allows you some free time then head for Ngong Ping 360 which is a short distance away. The 5 Km plus Cable Car ride to the Buddha statue offers a spectacular view of Lantau Island.

Reviews.Title: “With any luck, I will never have to stay here ever again”
Reviews.Author: LondonBusinessAgent
Reviews.Content: For a period of time, this hotel was contracted to a company I have dealings with and when in Hong Kong we HAD to stay here - thank god that contract was terminated. The rooms are basic and cheap at best, this is not a premium property. The walls are paper thin - over the 18 or so times I stayed here (by sufference) I heard all sorts of conversations, bodily functions and (ahem) nocternal activities of those in adjacent rooms. The very least you expect from an airport hotel is sound-proofing - unless you are on the outside facing rooms (which are well insulated from aircraft noise - note NOT from the next room) you will be woken every 5 minutes or so from a plane taking off - also note HKG is a 24 hour airport, this noise is ALL NIGHT... do not expect to sleep well. The only shopping and food near by is in the airport terminal and average at best. If having to stay at the airport for a connecting flight, might I suggest the nearby Marriott or the Novotel Century City. Not only will you be out of the terminal, you can shop, eat and have access to entertainment beyond the dubious pleasure of being forced to endure the sounds of next doors copulation at 4am.

Reviews.Title: “Average Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fryfrye
Reviews.Content: The 4 and 5 star reviews baffled me so I wanted to clearly state that this hotel is nothing special. Its perfect for a one night stay at the HKG airport, clean, safe, comfortable. But its really nothing special when compared to other hotels in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: dga1775
Reviews.Content: The hotel is meticulously clean, has all of the amenities that you would want, i.e., spa, work out facility, swimming pool, free transportation between other Regal Hotels located in Kowloon, Causeway Bay, Shotin, Honk Kong. Regal Club floors are excellent, Regal Club lounge is open from 6:30 AM - 11:30 PM and is fully staffed and has free internet access. You have direct access to the airport without having to go outside and the Airport Express train that goes to Kowloon and Hong Kong is located in terminal 2 that is directly connected to the hotel. Steak House, Japanese and Chinese restaurants, coffee shop for casual dining, lobby lounge - Excellent property and I highly recommend using the Regal Airport Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: miraphx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 days in HK on our way to Bali and I waited till the last minute to book a room cuz there were so many choices and I knew nothing about the city. Finally husband took over and booked us at the Regal Airport on a recomendation from a friend. I was worried that the location would be too boring and I expected the room to be super tiny as that is the reputation of HK. It turned out to be perfect for us. The hotel is actually adjacent to the airport and the metro trains wich take you to Central, Kowloon, and the Asia World Expo. So we easily commuted to all the places we wanted to go and didn't have to worry about getting back to the airport on the morning of our flight. Our room was on the 12th floor and was very clean, comfortable and spacious. I slept great, never heard any planes.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the club floors”
Reviews.Author: Airbusflyer09
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel quite often because it’s our standard company accommodation and I don't like it. Its greatest advantage is without doubt that it is close to airport, so it would be your first choice if you are tired and need a bed as fast as possible after a flight. But if you go there make sure not to book a room on the “club” floors because this room are old and in rather poor condition. Most of the toilets don’t work very well and smell bad, the whole bathroom is in poor condition. It is very annoying to use the elevator to the club floors because you need the room key to get access to the club floor level and that system does not work well most of the time. Some of the other rooms are renovated and some are not, so it’s worth asking first before you accept a room. The internet access in the room is slow and expensive (120 HKD for 24 hours). The whole hotel looks a little old and outdated. I can not recommend this hotel because there are better and newer hotels closeby like the Marriot or the Citygate Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Liz_Peter
Reviews.Content: Due to a problem with my wife's Chinese visa we were stuck in Hong Kong for an extra night. Not wanting to go back to the centre again to travel back in the morning we decided to try the airport hotel. We knew it would be expensive but it ran to well over US$200 for what was a reasonable room. We weren't here long enough to use the facilities and quite honestly we couldn't have afforded to be! Thankfully they do a lunch buffet which was reasonable priced and we stocked up on some very good curry!

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong's most convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: CroomstyxKent
Reviews.Content: I had a short overnight stay here between flights, and used only the room, no facilities but was impressed with what I saw. The hotel is super convenient as it's adjacent to the airport and about a 5 min walk from arrivals to reception, wheel your trolley to the entrance where they take your luggage and deliver it to the room. I had booked a Superior Room wiht a queen bed which was the cheapest available, but as was with my 2 kids, I requested and got twin beds, together with an extra bed free of charge in the room. Having also stayed at the Marriott Sky City a week earlier (no extra bed and a much longer transfer time ) I'd say the extra £10 or so that the Regal cost me was money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, decent price”
Reviews.Author: crbguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night before catching a flight out of Hong Kong. The convenience of this airport is terrific, but I was also pleasantly surprised by how nice my room was. The hotel's amenities are also nice, with many different restaurants/lounges, and with a full-service spa. The food and drinks in the hotel were expensive, but the spa services were not. The staff was very nice, but I really did not have any unusual issues, so I did not require much from them. Given its location next to the airport, you would not want to stay here for an extended stay in Hong Kong, because it is too far from everything else. But, before catching a flight out, or just after arriving in Hong Kong, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back when I have more than one night to spend”
Reviews.Author: AdoptiveDad
Reviews.Content: We spent one night there when adopting our second Chinese child. We had a stressful trip from Guangzhou even though the flight it short (we had small kids and got in after midnight). The hotel is adjacent to the airport and we took our airport baggage carts over the walkway right up to the bellhops in the hotel. That made things so much easier than if we had to catch a shuttle to another airport, only to do the reverse the next day. It amazed me how different the feeling was between mainland China and Hong Kong even though we'd only gone about 100 miles. The staff had on Hawaiian shirts and the mood in the hotel reminded me of the attitude at the Hyatt on Maui-elegant and relaxed at the same time. The room was one of the most comfortable Chinese rooms I've been in (I've stayed in 8 Chinese hotels so far for a total of about 4 weeks during my 2 trips). I woke up more rested than I expected and we headed down for our breakfast. The breakfast area was quite nice. Being next to the airport we didn't have to rush to get our stuff ready for our flight. Getting through all the lines and to the gate is a pain, but that's true on almost any international flight. Our stay was part of a package so it's hard for me to comment on the prices as well as I can the room. I recommend this hotel particularly for anyone concerned about making connections at the airport. That part was very convenient. I'm irritated that I've been to the Hong Kong airport twice but I've never been able to leave the premises. Family members have been to Hong Kong and enjoyed it. We want to go for real, and not just to get a connecting flight, esp. to see Hong Kong Disney. I'd like to stay at this hotel when we finally do go there. True, I can't say that I used many of the hotel's services and, granted, we were there for only one quick night, but we were both impressed and-assuming money is not an issue for us-I'd like to come back. It made a good first impression on us.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convienient”
Reviews.Author: WineloverMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We had a 9.00 am flight back to Australia so staying at the airport seemed like a good idea. The Regal is attached to Hong Kong International airport so it is ideal for travellers in transit or people catching early flights. It has a number of resaurants offering a broad range of food, the one we went to was quite good, it had a buffet on offer but we choose a la carte. It has a gym and a pool . The only down side was the bed was a bit hard. Overall a nice hotel to relax in before or after travelling

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay with friendly staff and good food.”
Reviews.Author: Carbheatcold
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for a period of nearly 6 consecutive months and got to know the staff well, particularly in the bar and the Head Chef, Will. The service was generally very good, yes there were some not so good days where service was slow, but over the course of the stay these were few and far between. The room was comfortable and well equiped with amenities and the cleaning was good although I found the TV channel selection limited for my liking. They did have Discovery Channel, National Geographic a film channel as well as news channels in different languages but no music channels. If you like a bath then the baths are a bit low but the shower was very powerful. Laundry was OK and reliable and as we were long stayers we were able to use the pound wash rather than dry cleaning. The pound wash was basic and a lot cheaper but did the job however a few items ended up smaller as a result.
