As we had got to know the Head Chef Will he was keen to cook 'off menu' meals for us including cornish pasties, sausage and mash, yorkshire puddings and he was always ready to tackle any cooking request. The bar food menu over the period we were there never changed and was limited but the quality of the food was always good but the steaks could be expensive. There are a good variety of restaurants to eat in including a Japanese restaurant, Chinese and a buffet restaurant, the only one I tried was the buffet and that had a good selection of dishes. The hotel always had something going on for special occassions like Valentines Day, New Years Eve and Chinese New Year. The New Years Eve's event was very good including a band Location was very good for the airport and Asia World Expo (10 mins walk away) but at least 20 mins fast train ride from Hong Kong Island and downtown but the return train trip is only about 100HK Dollars, roughly £9. Asia World Expo hosted some big concerts during our period in Hong Kong. Tung Chung is the nearest town and has cable car access to the Big Bhudda but also a railway station to get into Hong Kong for approx 20HKD. Public transport works seamlessly and is cheap including all the ferries to the various islands.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: temmert45
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business in Hong Kong during Chinese New Year. The night before my flight I moved to the Regal hotel. I have stayed here often over the last three years and enjoy its location next to the airport. I booked a room on the club floor. The room and the club lounge are just has they have been the last three years. The room and the lounge were well maintain but just needed to be up to date. In fact, the style theme for the hotel seems to be a bit outdated. The attendants at the club lounge were very pleasant and accommodating. I recognized one of them from a previous visit. After work, I brought two of my colleagues to the lounge floor and was abruptly stopped and informed that I would have to pay an additional HK$88 for more than one guest. I am sure it is policy and I understand the charge but the rude manner that I was informed of this in front of my guests seemed completely unnecessary. We left there and went to the club floor at the newly opened Marriott that my colleague was staying at. The Marriott has much nicer rooms, a much nicer lounge with better selection of food and beverages and more professional staff. Though it is hard to beat the convenience of the Regal at the airport, I will likely not stay there again unless the Novotel CityGate and the Marriott are full.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Asia!”
Reviews.Author: RaymondC2
Reviews.Content: Room amenities at rooms of Regal Airport Hotel Hong Kong Hong Kong include wireless internet access, IDD telephone with voicemail system, auto wakeup call system, desk-top alarm clock, satellite TV, mini bar, individually controlled air conditioning system, etc. Electronic safety deposit box is also available at each room to safeguard your personal valuables. Room styles at Regal Airport Hotel Hong Kong Hong Kong include Spa Deluxe, Spa Suite, Deluxe Suite, Royal Suite as well as Presidential suite, and so on. To take care of your accommodation needs, 24 hour room services, non smoking rooms and in-room fax facilities are also provided by Regal Airport Hotel Hong Kong Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect for airport but more than just an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen0101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when moving out of Hong Kong and we were very pleased to be able to enjoy our final night in the country. Very nice room, clean and comfortable. Excellent club facilities, we very much enjoyed the food. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Good selection of restaurants. It was good to find an airport hotel that takes such good care of customers, so many are cold and unwelcoming. Just a short walk through to flight check in. I left a jacket in the wardrobe which was found and posted back to us. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic EVERY Time”
Reviews.Author: Woodangme
Reviews.Content: I only stay here now; the service and personal attention are top notch. So close to the airport you don't even need to think which is comforting after traveling 15-16 hours to get here.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient but with thin walls”
Reviews.Author: latebloomerSydney
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay in an airport hotel then this is a pretty good one. Very conveniently located just a 5 mins walk from the arrival gates, undercover all the way. The corridors are a bit reminiscent of a beehive but the rooms are comfortable and clean. The buffet breakfast is good value if you're a big eater with quite a bit of variety but you can just as simply grab something light back in the airport. Our only complaint was that the walls are a ibt thin. We could clearly hear the conversation from the room next door which was a bit annoying. All in all, if you are transiting through HKG overnight then staying here is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Untrustworthy”
Reviews.Author: HKfamilyholiday09
Reviews.Content: Having just flown into Hong Kong at 11pm, staying at the Regal seemed the obvious choice. The hotel itself was wonderful, clean and inviting with it's 24hr stay policy. The problem I had was I noticed my nightwear and travel document wallet was missing upon arrival at our next destination (checked out at 9pm & arrived at new housing by 9.45pm - we actually had the room until 11.45pm) I rang immediately to be told the housekeeping was closed for the night and to ring in the morning. Having spoken to them again and stating exactly where these items were they insisted that nothing was left in the room. Even speaking with the front desk manager did nothing to help the situation,.My understanding of this was if I was silly enough to forget them then possession was theirs!.... Extremely disappointed as everything else was wonderful. My impression now is that they are all thieves. DONT leave anything you need in your room because it will be gone for good.!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NextStation
Reviews.Content: Good service and polite staff, very good breakfast food, so many choice of differnt kind of food.

Reviews.Title: “stay @ executive floor”
Reviews.Author: Gsquard
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay close to the airport - this hotel is best solution. They also have a free shuttle bus to city centre. If you book well in advance, you'll get a discount up to 35%, which is a good value. Executive floor is worth paying extra: club lounge with snacks and drinks in the afternoon, great breakfast (same lounge), free use of business center, free internet etc. Perfect bed! slept like a baby! Indoor Swimming pool could be better - quite small and not well kept.

Reviews.Title: “peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: blackwatercore
Reviews.Content: I read before going to this hotel several mixed reviews, several of them knowingly being fake, local competators most likley, no hotel is perfect however finding a hotel trying to be perfect is a pleasure to stay at, you get a warm greeting which is nice in such a large hotel, the four story lobby is very open planned and pleasant to walk in to, its not the best designed hotel I have stayed at, yet better than most in HK city, I dined in the cafe, lobby lounge and the grill all very different and all serving fresh imported products, ther are pleanty of managers within the hotel asking you about your comments which shows confidence, I met the same chef manager for breakfast lunch and late dinner and always with a smile, housekeeping seem to work very hard to keep the hotel in such good shape, and all the staff generaly seem to want to assist you, phone for somthing and you get it, christmas decorations seem old fasionedand a little over the top, more style and less of the other, the rooms are very quiet although you can hear people next door, you can see the planes very close to the hotel however you cannot hear them, the room is ideal for peace and quiet, good prices at the moment I expect things to be different in the coming months. I recomendyou try this hotel as I did and you will be pleasantly surprised, it recently won awards I noticed and may continue to do so if it keeps up the same standards, exelently places within the airport itself saving time and energy HK Central 30 mins away, if you have the time

Reviews.Title: “If only all airport hotels were as good.”
Reviews.Author: PetroniusMinor
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night between flights at this large hotel.It was everything an airport hotel should be. You walk under cover from the terminal to the hotel, one is met by friendly & efficient staff, & stay in a comfortable room with all the necessary facilities (ours was a Club Superior). From our room you could see the aircraft taking off & landing but the triple glazing cut out all the noise. Because we had had a meal on our flight in we just had a few drinks & some food from the Club Lounge buffet but there are several restaurants in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for Lay-overs...5 Star and very clean and great service”
Reviews.Author: Life-ona-Beach
Reviews.Content: I am writing this as we are in the place now and I have noticed some questionable (competition ?)bad reviews in previous posts and want to let everyone know the place is 5 star and meets/exceeds standards for comparable hotels. We checked in late (23:00) from a flight, being a very seasoned business and holiday traveller, this time to check in always will indicate the level of service to come and how well things are run. Well the concierge met us at the door and took our bags immediately (we walked over from the terminal- 5 mins) , then directed us to a well manned reception desk. I had called in the reservation 12 hours earlier without credit card for security , they had the reservation, checked us in under 3 mins, spoke excellent English (everyone did) and had the bags up to us under 5 mins. This is high standard for any hotel and very good considering the time of night. The rooms are very modern with LCD, cable TV, Internet wired and wireless, room size is double what a Sheraton or Marriott gives you in other countries. They have a work station, large King sized bed that was so comfortable after a long trip. The bathroom was very modern and clean and a great shower with plenty of hot water. Towels and Linen in the room are high quality (think Westin). The mini bar is basically stocked and the aircon a tad too cool so we shut it off. There are extra blankets available in cupboard as well as the customary safe. The windows in the room are extra well insulated against noise and you would not know you are by the airport. We are only staying 16 hours before moving on but do note that they rent their rooms on a 24 hours basis, meaning your rate is for 24 hours from check-in. Very handy for lay-overs at odd times. All in all we will use this place again and if we had more time Disneyland is a stone throw away...maybe next time ! Watch in general for bogus bad reviews in Asia as competition is fierce and generally if a reviewer had a short nickname and less than 2 or 3 reviews then it's questionable most times...not all !

Reviews.Title: “Always a great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaBu
Reviews.Content: The Regal Hotel at the Hong Kong International Airport is always a good choice if you need to make an early morning flight the next day. It is so convenient to the international arrival and departure terminals. You can walk there. You don't have to go outside and wait for a shuttle bus. The hotel offers several excellent restaurants and they are not fast food places. We had an exquisite Cantonese cuisine dinner at their Rouge restaurant. The rooms are comfortable, quiet and stylishly furnished. You don't even feel like you're in an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel - Convenient & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Canada_is_Home123
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here before heading home from Indonesia. It was conveniently located and when I arrived, the lobby was decorated for Christmas! I had a room on the 10th floor - part of the upgraded rooms and was really happy with it. The bed was very comfortable and I ordered room service, and it was tasty. My only complaint was that the shower was the worst I have ever had - no pressure and the temperature kept changing.

Reviews.Title: “Good transithotel”
Reviews.Author: apa_kabar
Reviews.Content: We staye here one night to break up our flight from Europe to Australia. The room was clean and elegant,and very good insulated to sound. We were very happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What A Shocker - Best Airport Hotel, I Don't Think So!!! Who Votes For This?”
Reviews.Author: 787col
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here alot in the past on an airline stopover, company choice, I was always unhappy with my stays. Staff never cared, overall cleaniness/decor of hotel is poor, and internal room noise will keep you awake for hours. But I did always enjoy the China coast Bar and the music-singer. Anyway I read recntly that they won an award for BEST AIRPORT IN THE WORLD and thought may be things have changed, how wrong I was. WHAT a SHOCKER, I thinks it's a typo should be worst, and the last reviewer(Airportroamer) must have the wrong hotel. The musty smell from the carpet/corridor/rooms and the front desk girl not even caring made me immediately checkout and go to the brand new Marriott. Also they have now changed the entertainer in the China Coast Bar, she has been replaced the by a tone deaf singer who is obviously an amatuer or the manager's wife? Business traveller Magazine, how is it possible to rate this the best in the world you have now creditiblity at all with me !!!!!! check out the review on this site.. Do yourself a serious favour and stay at the Skycity Marriott or the Novotel near the airport or better stiill go into town...

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Airportroamer
Reviews.Content: The Regal Airport hotel recently won the award for Best Airport Hotel in the World. It certainly deserves this accolade. Most airport hotels are dull, impersonal, dirty and frenetic. The Regal is the opposite to these usual traits. Over the years, I have stayed many times in this hotel, as well as its predecessor at the old Kai Tak airport in Hong Kong. The key to any hotel is consistency, and the Regal is just that. A truly welcoming staff who remember you from previous visits, visible and proactive management and squeaky clean rooms. I can speak with some authority on the consistency, as I was a "long stayer" for 4 months at the Regal in 2008. You get to see under the skin of an hotel when you stay that long, and I was never disappointed. Well done Regal, and best of luck next year with the award.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stopover”
Reviews.Author: travellinman2009
Reviews.Content: Great location, just a short walk from the airport terminal. We booked a room on the Executive floor and the 6pm checkout time allowed us a full day of exploring Hong Kong before taking our evening flight. The train connection to the center of Hong Kong is very fast and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stop Off Point Between Flights”
Reviews.Author: Olicia
Reviews.Content: We have used this hotel several times as a respite between countries and long haul flights. It is just terrific. You can walk from both terminals at the Hong Kong Airport (it is attached to terminal one). The staff is excellent from the bell hops to the waiters to the front desk to the maids - all are pleasant and eager to help. We were able to store luggage between trips, mail the too many gifts we bought home, swim, eat and drink in comfort. We then left for a 13 hour flight in great shape. A great place to rest and recharge.

Reviews.Title: “Sooo close to the airport when your just off the plane”
Reviews.Author: farmerfyfe
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite on the club level with the greeting service. Hadn't got to bed before we left so being met and shown to the hotel was great. Check in was prompt friendly and efficient and the room was prepared for us. The suite was very spacious and the bed is ENORMOUS and very comfortable. Bathrooms are well appointed and everything works. The electronic light controls by the bedside are annoying. The wontons at breakfat are a must. Took a long swim in the OM SPA pool top work out the kinks after the flight. Nice pool - 25 meters down one side to swim laps. All the staff, everywere are focused on providing you with good service. For an airport hotel it was surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Lame”
Reviews.Author: fathead77
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this hotel is the location. Unbelievably hokey lobby (some sort of weird cruise ship theme). Hard beds, shabby interior, poor facilites, really not that good especially considering the price. Can't comment on the food as we got in late and left early. Think the Novotel down the road might be a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all the best airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: sk9758
Reviews.Content: A sudden change of plans due to the typhoon resulted in transiting through HKIA. The best option available was to try this hotel. I managed to get a good deal late night through the counter in the arrivals hall and walked via the connecting bridge to the hotel. The lobby was huge and check in was swiftly done by a good staff. However, the rooms were very disappointing. They were long past its age and the furniture, carpets reminded me of a B&B in UK. Bathrooms were tiny and toiletries of poor quality. The air-condition system was terrible and again of very poor quality with inadequate cooling. Bedding and mattresses were horrible. Luckily I had to manage for just 5 hours and spent a miserable night there. The only positive grace was the good staff and easy access to the terminal building which helped me grab the first flight available out of HKG. I would have never thought this hotel has won the best airport hotel award. For me, it should only go to the Crowne Plaza Changi. At the most this hotel deserves a 3 star level.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value and helpfullness!”
Reviews.Author: lucilleinoz
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Regal Airport - for 1 night Very handy into Kowloon for the afternoon - fantastic rate! helpful staff, great food thoroughly recommend as an overnight or two option for Hong Kong and a 5 min walk to the departure terminal!

Reviews.Title: “destress ,quick access to the city”
Reviews.Author: movershaker_9
Reviews.Content: brilliant place to destress out of the busy city, and just 28 min to the the city central. try the massages & restrauants

Reviews.Title: “Good for transit”
Reviews.Author: bwkchang
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel one night for transit to other place. The hotel is very nice and next to airport. Service is good. Breakfast is good. Room is clean and equiped with big LCD TV. Fast internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!...for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: a07
Reviews.Content: great hotel if youre lookin for an airport hotel...breathtaking views of hongkong

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient airport hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: sfslinky
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Regal Airport Hotel last month. It was extremely convenient to help break up an overseas flight with a night's rest after first flying nonstop for sixteen hours from the States. We landed in the evening, had a buffet dinner at one of the hotel's restaurants, washed up and had a good night's sleep before flying out again first thing in the morning. The hotel is connected to the Hong Kong airport with a walkway so it is extremely convenient when you land and the next day when you have to catch your second flight. The only funny thing was the hallway where our room was located. There were many mirrored walls which made me feel like Bruce Lee in that fighting mirror scene at the end of "Enter the Dragon" or "Game of Death." It was a strange sight for a weary traveler trying to find the room for the first time. The room was very comfortable, we received our wake up call on time and caught our second flight out in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: GMVince
Reviews.Content: My name is Vince Palumbo and I am a coach/player for the Australian Stickfighting Team, and I would like to tell you all about this beautiful Regal International Airport Hotel which is in Hong Kong. Me and my team of 16 athletes did a one night stop-over in Hong Kong on our way to the Philippines where we were travelling to so that we could all compete at the 2009 World Stickfighting Championships which were being held in Cebu City there in Philippines. Our stay at the Regal International Airport Hotel in Hong Kong was just fantastic, and we all enjoyed the hotel and service very much, so if ever you need to do a stop-over there in Hong Kong for the night, please do not hesitate to contact the manager at the hotel by the name of Mt Jon Chiu, and I am sure that he will bend over backwards to really try and accommodate you or your group. So go ahead and spoil yourself for the night, and I am sure that you will be pleased with the service that you recieve there, ok! Enjoy this Fantastic Hotel in Hong Kong! Regards from GM Vince Palumbo (Australia)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Husbandandwife22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were stuck in Hong Kong for a few days and needed to be close to the airport. We booked the hotel through the Hotel desk in the arrival hall which gave us a good price for the first night. We negotiated the other nights and managed to get the discounted rate again. It is connected to the airport via a walkway and as it was pouring with rain we has no trouble staying dry. Our non smoking room had been used by someone who smoked and staff were helpful and moved us to another room immediately. The room key kept the lights on, the only trouble was when you went to sleep you either had to pull out the key which meant no lights on and a fumble to the bathroom or you slept with lights on. Three nights was enough. We did manage to get the airport express into Kowloon which was very easy. Complimentary water and fruit were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Airport Hotel in the World my a....”
Reviews.Author: ZGtomcat
Reviews.Content: I read recently thet this property has been woted best airport hotel in the world (belive it was British edition of Business Traveller Magazine). What a lie!!! Tasteless interior decorations, rude staff who ignores your complaints (mine was about internet usage and it was worthless even though I filed the complaint with internet provider after being previously forwarded to them by hotel operator). All in all, stay if you must!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK room... no high speed Internet”
Reviews.Author: totochi
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night due to a 13 hour delay on a Cathay Pacific flight. Check-in/check-out was quick and the room was better than average. Cathay paid for the room but the rate that night was ~$180 which was a bit pricey. There was no free high-speed Internet; I called the front desk & operator and was rudely told that Internet does not come with room and they hung up on me before I could ask how to pay for it... twice. I had to bring my computer and walk back to the airport terminal to use their free wireless connection. Lame.

Reviews.Title: “Good Transit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ewoker
Reviews.Content: I only stayed overnight as i had to catch a plane the next day to Shanghai. The hotel was modern and clean and the hotel staff were very efficient. Check out was quick and easy. Highly recommended if you want a good airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: With the possible exception of the Fairmont Vancouver Airport, the best airport hotel I have evr stayed in. Facilities and service were outstanding and staff were amazingly considerate of teh fact that I was temporarily in a wheelchair. There are several restaurants offering different cuisines, but we ate in the coffee shop, which had an excellent buffet dinner and breakfast. It is not convenient for downtown, although you can be there in less than an hour via the Airport Express train (at a price). However, it is convenient for local attractions on Lantau Island (e.g. Desney World) and there is a ferry to Macau from the airport. Spending several hours at the airport in transit? Instead of finding somewhere in the airport to eat go to the hotel for a gourmet experience.

Reviews.Title: “4-star lobby with 1-star guestrooms”
Reviews.Author: muffine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights because we arrived at 1am and we were offered an extra free night. we requested a non-smoking twin room, but somehow we could still smell smoke in the room. there was only one small pillow on each bed, and there was no blanket except one thin velvet cloth. The room was equipped with a small tube TV, and the bathroom was filthy, with mold in the corners. the airport is far away from the center of the city, and there's nothing around the area. i do not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra convenient but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Gulf-Neil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel feels 'new' . Clean, trendy & great selection of restaurants & bars. However, the 'standard' rooms are small. Not cheap but very convenient for short stop overs & easy to get to Disneyland or Hong Kong Island or even a beach! Now there is another option, Novatel. Its a HK$20 taxi ride from the airport & a cheaper alternative but i haven't stayed there, just had a look around.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended & great location”
Reviews.Author: Haven123
Reviews.Content: This is the second visit to this hotel within the past 2 weeks, enroute to the airport for an early-morning flight. I arrived at 1.30pm for check-in, which was efficient and pleasant and was upgraded to an executive room, possibly as I showed a bit of interest in the Regal rewards programme brochure on the counter, which includes upgrades as part of the benefits package. The room itself was indeed upgraded from my last visit. Soft furnishings and carpets and a view of the South China Sea and runway and I was on the 9th floor which is recommended. As mentioned in my previous review, the food and beverages are quite pricey, however, I arrived in time for the daily curry buffet in the foyer cafe. This allowed a choice of 4 different curries, carved meat, rice and vegetables followed by a selection of desserts (including Bread & Butter pudding with hot custard) for about £10 per person. This was fantastic value and worth every penny. The food was absolutely delicious. Alternatively, there are several cafes/restaurants in the airport terminal building (within 5 min walk from reception), including the local chain of cafes called "Cafe De Coral". Highly recommended hotel in terms of location and price, although you have to pay extra for breakfast, which personally I would advise in getting this at the airport instead e.g. at the 7eleven.

Reviews.Title: “The Airport Hotel for late arrivals and transit travelers”
Reviews.Author: elfazy
Reviews.Content: A great place for tired transit travelers with a direct link to the airport. So you are paying for the location and convenience. It's about US $180 for a room WITHOUT Breakfast (Breakfast costs an extra US$32 ). The hotel exterior,entrance and halls are luxurious but the rooms are like 3 stars quality so not up to what you may expect based on the rate the exterior look of the hotel. Food and beverages are over priced so you better have your meals at one of the so many restaurants at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: TravelMan05
Reviews.Content: Staff did not display the smallest indication of concern in regards to serving me at any point. Following this when I finally got to see an attendent they informed me that the room that had been reserved for me by Cathay Pacific for my layover was no longer available becuase they were not taking any more Cathay passengers. If you are considering staying here I would strongly suggest otherwise. Hong Kong is a small island, stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Oh, I do like to be beside the runway!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the Regal Airport Hotel in transit in HKG. The Hotel entrance is not properly signposted from much of the Airport Terminal. Check-in was lousy: Long queues and staff disinterest until we complained. The hotel itself has some good designs and modern rooms with comfy beds. However, many of the rooms are very close to the airport runway and the sound insulation is not sufficient to block out the noise of an aircraft take-off. We didn't eat, but got up early to catch a plane - which is convenient from the Regal, without needing transport. However, the hotel needs to improve its service and insulation!

Reviews.Title: “Only okay if paying less than US$ 150 per night”
Reviews.Author: ILoveCoconuts
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during a 12-hour layover in HK. Selected the hotel due to its close proximity to the airport. Bad mistake. I couldn't sleep at this place. Next time, I'll go into the city. This hotel is expensive for what it is. It is worth maybe US$200/night at absolute best, on a good day. The staff is rude. The rooms are basic. I assume they attempted to go for a euro/asian minimalist look but instead it simply looks and feels like a two-star hotel - just a tad better than a standard highway motel room. The beds are small and very uncomfortable. Reminded me of a futon. The hallways smell like smoke. The tiny little tv automatically started to promote Asian porn when I turned it on - quite funny actually. I assume they want people to spend the money on it. Checking in and out is a nightmare - such a slow process. Perhaps most frustrating is that they charge so much for the place and the online photos show attractive, comfortable rooms. We stayed at the Peninsula and other top hotels and have no problem spending money on a nice hotel. This place however, takes complete advantage of their monopoly at the airport and has no right pricing themselves so high. It is not worth the prices they charge. Do your best to stay at a hotel off the airport property.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrangeWhale
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Regal Airport Hotel from 14-18 May 08. We were there for a business convention. Hotel is big, with all the necessary comforts that u would expect from a 5 star hotel. Service was prompt, but cold. There was no renovation, noise as reported by other travellers. We had very peaceful sleep throughout our stay. The airport was just a few minutes walk away, connected by a walkway. We usually walk over to the airport for our meals, very wide selection there. Overall, our stay was enjoyabe.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Oasis”
Reviews.Author: g1tou
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. The first stay they were slow in checking in and out but I had dropped in on a whim due to being too fatigued to go into HK and having to fly out the next day. I can't say enough good about the place. It's a perfect place to get reset after a long flight. The building is solid concrete and virtually sound proof. The decor throughout the place from the entrance to the interior halls is tranquil and opulent with low lighting in the right places. They had some nice piano music playing in the spacious atrium lobby as my father and I checked in after a very long flight from San Francisco. Check in was quick, courteous, and efficient with no problems whatsoever. Not sure why some reviews are so negative. Perhaps some people are a bit strung out from a long flight. Long haul fatigue can crush your patience. As for the reviewer who was critical in general of HK customer service, except for one cabbie and shuttle driver, I've not found better customer service and courtesy anywhere on the globe! I've certainly never had a problem at this hotel and heartily recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Sharp glass on floor of room”
Reviews.Author: lindfieldfamily
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Regal Airport Hotel by Cathay Pacific with my 9 year old son at 1am. This was our second night running in an airport hotel following some weather disruption compounded by some extreme Cathay incompetence / indifference. We discovered quickly that the Regal room had not been properly cleaned. The carpet had a large number of extremely sharp glass shards (I have kept two of them for posterity) from a previous breakage of some kind which had not been properly removed by hotel staff. Sadly we discovered this only when my son cut his foot deeply on one of these shards on the way to the shower, bleeding profusely and required medical attention from hotel staff. We then had to move room of course. The Regal Hotel staff seemed more concerned about their own legal liability (and maybe this is not misplaced) and took photos of the injury. More distrubingly they also tried to get me to sign a legal disclaimer which I refused to do. Best Airport Hotel in Asia? I think not.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but not bad as airport hotels go”
Reviews.Author: Brookman-Dublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 10 hours (daytime) during a stopover from Perth, although we needed to stay for 12 hours, but the cost was prohibitive. It was 200Euro for the 10 hours! We didn't have any problem checking in, but again, as someone else mentioned, the hotel desks at the arrivals area in the airport are absolutely useless! We had tried to find this hotel on our way to Perth, knowing we'd need somewhere on the way back, and not one person could tell us that there was a hotel at the airport!!! Anyway..we found the right desk on the way back, and after my husband tried to get a better rate (didn't) we checked in. We had a room overlooking the sea, but the smog or fog was quite bad, so there really wasn't any view! Our room also overlooked the swimming pool. We were on the 12th floor which was nice. We didn't hear any planes landing or taking off - it's like we were in a different place to the airport. We went down to the Om Spa and booked a few massages for later in the day, before our long flight to Paris. This was ideal!! Except for the cost of the hotel, I thought it was perfect for our needs. It really is close to arrivals, and we also were able to go into Hong Kong for a few hours after we rested.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for night stop over”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: located perfectly just a few minutes walk from arrival area go out and make a left 5 min walk and you are there new hotel in new airport so everything was perfect for me big room clean bath only con: is expensive considering that in my case just use 8 hours the bed didnt use any aditional services for snack i went back to less expensive food restaurants at airport

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over!”
Reviews.Author: kmgk
Reviews.Content: Flight had been moved to a later date, but food and accomodation was provided directly from the airline. We were very impressed with this hotel! Lobby was fantastic and rooms were so expansive! The hotel also offers many different restaurants, which is a plus, so many to choose from! You'd think that airport hotels could sometimes be noisy and boring, but this was definitely far from that! It was a good and quick stop over!

Reviews.Title: “Depressing and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Expat92_3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because I basically had no choice, with a very early flight the next morning. Rooms are tiny - like a Japanese style "business hotel" with pre-molded bathrooms. Don't remember whether the hotel is non-smoking, but my room definitely was, and yet the whole place stank of smoke, as well as some other undefined smell in the rooms that made sleep difficult. Uncomfortable bed, inedible room service dinner, inevitable queues at reception... This is a 2-star hotel charging 5-star prices, but they have a captive audience. I heard that a second hotel will open at HK airport - maybe it will be better?

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: WPW
Reviews.Content: We were put up here one night because of a flight delay. At first, I did not like it at all, possibly because I was in a bad mood from the flight delay. But I must admit they did check in a couple of hundred people quite quickly (I guess they get lots of practise). It is attached to the airport, so it is just a short walk, once you get yourself on the right level (which took us a while). It is a bit sterile, like most airport hotels and the HK airport, but after my initial irritation I got fairly comfortable. My room was a bit noisy. There was a woman nearby with a laugh that could penetrate any sound barrier and they seemed to be having a little party, which I might as well have been at. And the plumbing was noisy all night. However, my companion said his room was very quiet, so maybe I just got unlucky. Otherwise the room was clean and comfortable, although the furnishings seemed cheap and flimsy. I didn't realize until the next morning there was a nice garden you could go out and relax in. And actually breath some relatively fresh air, which is a welcome break from the HK airport where they force in rancid frigid air 24/7. The pool and spa also looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for night whilst in transit”
Reviews.Author: Herefordshire
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews we did wonder what we were going to find on arrival, we need not have been concerned. The hotel is fantastic. As we walked into the hotel entrance a porter was waiting to take our luggage for us and gave us the choice of having it stored or having it taken to our room. Check in was very quick and the member of staff who dealt with us was really friendly. She arranged with the porter to bring our luggage straight up to the room. The public area's in the hotel were beautiful and clean. The room was large and very comfortable with a double bed, sofa and table and chairs. The towels were soft and there were plenty of toiletries in the bathroom. We didn't use any of the resturants but opted for room service. The meal arrived withing the 20 mins stated and was lovely and hot still. There is complimentry bottles of water in both the bedroom and the bathroom which was very welcome after being on a plane for so long, and the usual hospitality tray and selection of items to purchase from the mini bar. The spa area is great and we would throughly recommend having a massage. It was a lovely way to finish the evening and very relaxing after a 12 hour flight. The pricing is very competetive. We would not hesitate in recommending this hotel for anybody who has an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Worst In Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: AccidentalTourist101
Reviews.Content: I travel through Hong Kong a few times a year. I try different hotels usually for the experience. However, in May of 2007 I didn't have a lot of time and I just wanted to stay close to the airport. I've heard poor things about the Airport Regal, but I thought I'd give it a try anyway. What a mistake. Very expensive for what you get. Modest accommodations, reasonably clean, labyrinthian room locations, very slow check in/out desk. On top of that the hotel nickel and dimes for everything! I guess that would be ok if the room cost was less, but it is not. Most hotels in Hong Kong offer complimentary water because the tap water is so bad...in fact, it is unpotable at the airport. The Regal, however, offers no such amenity. Most also offer free internet --not the Regal. I contacted hotel management by email when I got home to complain. I did get a response a week or two later and all they had to say was that they think their pricing structure is competitive so they make no apologies. Bottom line: This is a sub par hotel by every measure. If it didn't have a virtual monopoly in location to the Airport it would go out of business. I'd recommend you avoid this hotel at all costs. The train system in Hong Kong is excellent so I'd suggest staying on the island or in Kowloon. Plenty of great hotels in both places within walking distance of a train station.

Reviews.Title: “Heard of a 10 hoiur stay room type?”
Reviews.Author: sinoturkey
Reviews.Content: They will not honor my booking through Hotels.com($177). They told me that they do not like Hotels.com and claimed that they will send an email to Hotels.com to complain. It was lateand I was forced to pay again(about $190). There is truth to what Regal claimed. I went on Hotels.com to book a room at Regal by entering chick in 9/19 and check out 9/20, a one night stay to catch a plane to Thailand the next morning. After I made the booking, I printed out a receipt and behold, when I check in at the hotel, the hotel pointed out that the receipt says both: 1. Check in Sept. 19 Check in time 2PM; Check out Sept. 20, Check out time 12PM, AND 2. Room type: Day use room-10hrs Usuage between 6AM-20PM. Yes, 1 and 2 are contradictory but the hotel chose to look at room type. I think it is bad that the hotel would not accomodate knwing that it was a good situation to squeeze me becasue it was late and I have nowhere to go. Of course, the Hotels.com receipt is fraud on its face and I wonder if I should report this practice to the DA's office. I surely do not wants others to be victims. Please be careful when you want to stay at Regal and make sure you read Hotels.com receipt carefully, "your booking is confirmed" on the site just won't do it.

Reviews.Title: “good for travellers”
Reviews.Author: GreatTiger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regal Airport Hotel for three nights on business. Staff at the reception were friendly but honestly I just want to check in, receive my key and thats it. I am not looking for entertainment at the check in counter and I was please by the efficient services. Rooms were ok, normal space and standard furniture. I like the bed, hard but convenient. Room was also clean, no complaints. There were several restaurant, all of ok quality but expensive. If you just want to fill the stomach there are cheaper alternatives in the airport terminal. I was there on business and met several people. Even business talks can be done in the bars or the lobby, enough space and privacy. Nice is the walking distance to the terminal and also that you will get free vouchers for the train into town (be aware, they look like tickets but they are vouchers, you need to exchange at the railway station into tickets). Good and covenient for business travellers, but not charming enough for a family vacation but who would spend a family vacation in an airport hotel anyway? travel safe.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, clean airport hotel, but it is out at the airport”
Reviews.Author: puddlejump
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when I went to visit a client, which happened to be an international airline headquartered out at the Hong Kong airport. We were very close to the client, being at the airport, but we were far from the city of Hong Kong. This hotel is quite new and very modern, and getting to Hong Kong is convenient using the HK Airport Express train. The room was smallish, but very new and clean. I did not eat in the hotel, and spent most of the trip at the client's headquarters, which is a campus unto itself. This is convenient if you are doing business at the airport, but not if you are a tourist or doing business in-town; definitely a business traveler's hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: JC1973_7
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the most depressing hotels I have ever stayed in. Due to a flight cancellation I was forced to stay in this place. I paid £170 for single occupancy for one night (breakfast not included). Had there been a choice I would have gone elsewhere but this is the only hotel within walking distance of the terminal building. The staff are unwelcoming, the rooms tired looking and the room service disgusting. Such a depressing hotel. Its only saving grace was a fairly average gym. Unless you have a very early morning flight my advice would be to take the airport express into town and stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “2 stays - 2 different reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times on route to Europe from Australia. We have mixed feelings about this hotel. The positive being is the location to the airport, basically you just walk from customs through the airport to the hotel. It takes approx 6 minutes. Just follow the signs. The negative – something always goes wrong……. Check-in. - Check in went very smoothly and we were allocated to our room 6161 which was prepaid on the internet. My husband gave reception his credit card and preferred member card when checking in….unknown to us at the time the staff member had not swiped his credit card. Room - Our room was spacious and extremely comfortable., it consisted of a king size bed, dining suite, small settee, coffee table, working desk with internet connection. Bathroom – The bathroom was normal size with a shower over the bath. Toiletries were generously supplied. Staff and service – This is when our trouble and the negativity begins, on arriving into our room we started to undress for a much needed shower, two maids just walked in without knocking and calmly checked our mini bar. (so we thought)… only to find later they had actually locked the mini bar… we rang reception to get it unlocked…which took about 3 phone calls to get some action. When opened our mini bar had no alcohol in it , so we just decided to head downstairs for dinner in the Chinese restaurant. The staff were incredibly slow and we waited at least forty minutes before getting served. Our problem then became obvious when our bill arrived, we were not allowed to charge it to our room……evidently the problems all related back to check-in…staff not swiping our credit card…so we were treated like thieves.(hence the locked mini bar). My husband was furious and lashed out at reception….the manager then kindly suggested we could have a free breakfast......but hubby was so incensed, and livid for being treated like a thief…nothing would have made him happy. Overall – This hotel serves a purpose and it’s a great stopover hotel with some fabulous facilities like the outdoor/ indoor swimming pool, restaurants and bars. Its just a pity that every time we have stayed here there is always an annoying problem. It would be nice once to have a hassle free stay, than having to say…. “here we go again”… RETURN STAY - We booked a suite this time with a fab rate through their hotel site.Our suite 6127 is enormous with separate lounge room with a dining suite, plasma TV, working desk, coffee table, and lounge suite. Our separate bedroom again is enormous with a king size bed, dressing table, plasma TV, walkin wardrobe, and separate dressing room. Bathroom- walk-in shower, bath and excellent tolietries. Another toliet and wash room lead from the entrance hallway. This stay was perfect without one hiccup ----at last....Tip- join up with Regal Rewards and book a Regal Club room, you get 20% of meals and other reductions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if pricy stopover”
Reviews.Author: Thorndon
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Regal in transit on Cathay from New Zealand to London. I normally stay in Central or Kowloon when visiting HK, but there seemed to be no point in doing that for a 12 hour layover. You have to enter Hong Kong through immigration. The hotel is then a short level covered walk through a parking building from Zone A of the terminal. The route is marked on overhead signs in the terminal as "Airport Hotel" but the route is not immediately clear. Reception was courteous and efficient. We were quickly in our clean room, five star facilities, well sound-proofed, and with broadband internet and a good business desk. We slept well. We did not test the meal services, arriving after dinner and breakfasting with Cathay the next day. Hotel security was excellent. This is amongst the most comfortable airport hotels I have stayed in. It is priced to be just cheaper than travelling to and from equivalent five star Kowloon and Central hotel options, which makes it look expensive, but it is a good option by HK standards. I did find considerable variation in the prices offered by different booking services however. As the only real hotel choice at HK Airport it has something of a monopoly position, and if you want a cheaper stay you have to travel some distance instead.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: 55flyingW
Reviews.Content: My experience was very similar to a previous reviewer (ChaunceyGardiner,). I was also on the 11th floor (at the same HKD 2,000 rate) which entitled me to free Internet and health club access, but no Regal Club privileges (available for an upgrade, which I declined). Rooms are nicely appointed and have standard luxury amenities: wired and wireless Internet access, wide screen TV, high-grade bedding, linens and towels, bathrobes, name-brand toiletries, French-press coffee, mini-bar, in-room safe, ironing board, etc. Good working desk space and comfortable sofa. There is ongoing renovation in the hotel (no noticeable disruption to my stay) and I suspect my room may have been recently refurbished (the all-white upholstery was spotless). Rooms have double-thick windows with a nearly 12-inch air pocket, which seems to effectively buffer any noise from the airport (I was on the runway side of the hotel overlooking the terminal). Lights and air conditioning are controlled by inserting the room card in an actuator, so the room was hot when I arrived (an apparent energy saving measure) but quickly cooled down. Lights and AC are all adjusted from a single bedside control panel. Didn’t avail myself of the restaurants on this short stay, but room service was speedy and the food hot. At check-in, the staff warned me that there would be a celebration beginning at 10 o’clock for some of the hotel staff on the 11th floor and inquired whether I would need a room further away from the festivities. Ideal for a short layover.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable airport hotel, on premises of Chek Lap Kok”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed here before, and it’s an effective hotel for what it is: transit crashpad. It’s a reasonable trolley push from baggage claim, and (for those of us who fondly remember the old airport) an enormous leap forward from the Regal Kai Tak. I had gotten a good (HKD2000) rate, although I’ve paid as low as HKD1600 before. I asked for a tarmac view room, but they did not have any. The young man at check-in then pronounced that he had upgraded me to the Executive Floor. What he SHOULD have said was that he was putting me on the 11th Floor, without Lounge access. It was a little embarrassing heading into the lounge, having my room number checked on the computer, and then being escorted back out. I did speak to a manager about this, and suggested they work on clarity and careful use of terminology… There’s a couple of restaurants in the hotel, but they’re pretty generic hotel issue. One of them is, though, 7x24, so you can get coffee in the very early hours. However, there’s about four good eateries back in the landside part of Terminal 1, and a bunch of new restaurants over in T2 (which just opened, but is a bit of a hike from the Regal). The T1 restaurants are closer, and are located on a loft space above and just past the ticketing area. They include Grappa’s, one of my favourite Italian restaurants in this part of the world. Rooms here are smallish, but for a transit hotel, they’re fine. Comfy bed and feather pillows. I was impressed this time, as they have L’Occitane toiletries… maybe that’s because I was on the Executive Floor… don’t recall that from prior stays. Didn’t try the internet, as the airport itself has free wifi throughout. Check-out is an issue at this property, and it’s irritated me before. There is no room bill under the door in the morning (and no newspaper either!), so you and your bags have to stand in line to check out. In all fairness, they did have six people working check-outs, but I don’t understand why they can’t have kiosks like some hotels, or at least drop a bill and let us run. I burned through 20 minutes waiting with all the other suits to get checked out. Given the distance into town, this is an excellent alternative to schlepping into Kowloon or Central if you’re only transiting. There’s supposed to be another hotel under development near the water, also on airport grounds, but it didn’t look like ground had even been broken.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good...but pricey”
Reviews.Author: hallomainz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regal for one night during a layover on my way from Europe to Australia. I chose the Regal because of its location at the airport and the close proximity the Tung Chung mall and the NP 360 aerial tram. Being the only hotel by the airport, the Regal is rather expensive. But after an 11hour flight, checking in at 7:30am I jumped at the opportunity to upgrade my room to Regal executive class. That allowed me to get into the room on their executive floor right away, and to keep it until 6pm the next day, which fit my schedule perfectly. It also included 24 hour free wireless internet, breakfast buffet and 'cocktails and canapées' in the evening which turned out to be so opulent, that they served as dinner to me. The room was spaceous and clean. All functions such as lights and A/C were remote-controlled. The bed was very comfortable, big screen TV had an abundance of international channels. Bathroom was of normal size but spotless. From my window I could see airplanes landing, but to my amazement I did not hear them. Staff was very friendly helpful and efficient. Everybody I dealt with spoke at least basic english. Staying at thr Regal was a very pleasant experience. I and would certainly come again, if only they weren't so expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: THOMOPOL
Reviews.Content: Basic luxury hotel in the airport.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: texanaussie
Reviews.Content: We had a 12 hour layover in Hong Kong from London to Sydney and decided to book here to sleep/shower. It was expensive but we didn't expect much from an airport hotel. The hotel is connected to the airport via an enclosed walkway and directions are well marked. Check-in/out was quick and we were impressed by the quality of the room and the bathroom. The pool area looks nice, but the weather was not cooperative. We did not try any of the food outlets, but it looked like there were a lot of options.

Reviews.Title: “Come for the convenience, don't stay for the food.”
Reviews.Author: Tubbytoast
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the business club level of the hotel. The room was very clean and well-appointed, and the club lounge always had a helpful, English-speaking staffer available. Check-in and check-out were quick and easy. The hotel laundry service (50% discount for business club guests, which made costs quite reasonable) was excellent and on-time. At the business centre we thought the HK $14.00/page fee for printing out from the computer was a rip-off. The included club lounge breakfast varied widely, from good to inedible. Don't bother coming late to breakfast, as only "dregs" were available. Be aware that the free room service breakfast only covers the American set meal, something which we found out only by asking. We dined in one of the hotel restaurants, Cafe Afficionado, and found the food to be mediocre and prices high. I have the sense that service on the non-business club level is not as good for the Western traveler; tried asking a question of one of the main front desk staff employees; she spoke almost no English and was not able to help at all. Staying at the Regal Airport was a convenient and "no-brainer" way for us as first time visitors to HK to be close to the airport and have easy access to public transport. However, it was quite expensive and having learned the basics of getting around, we will stay in the city on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, but too expansive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Conrad for only HK$2000, but we have to pay HK$2200- for our last night in HK, in order to catch the early fly. The hotel is not the same class as Conrad, it is really over priced. However, the Staffs were very friendly and gave us a big rooms. The Check in was really busy, that they really need to get more hands. Hotel is so close to the airport, that is really part of it.

Reviews.Title: “It's a monopoly... so, what do you expect?”
Reviews.Author: LaurentBeijing
Reviews.Content: I (too) often have to stay there, due to my flight schedules. I believe anyone who experiences the Regal AP shares the same point of view. - unpleasant staff (I read "pathetic" in one review... how nice!) - freezing, worn out (sometimes dirty), noisy rooms - understaffed check in / out counters, with a permanent long line (since you are most likely flying out, allow ample check out time to avoid a rush to the plane!) - rates that would put you in palatial suites in most cities around the world. BUT This is your only choice if you need to stay at the Airport... Couldn't Hong Kong, self labeled "Asia's World City", have more than 1 hotel linked to its Airport? It is about time to bring competition in the field. Perhaps at that moment, the Regal AP reaches a proper level of "decency" in terms of value-for-money. For the time being, I will try Disneyland, and the areas on the Airport Express line.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: YYCworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I have read many bad reviews about this property, so I was prepared for the worst. I was very pleasantly surprised. I booked my room through asiarooms for a very reasonable $151 USD including taxes (I have seen reviews from people who have paid double and even triple this price) and requested a Non-smoking King with runway view. I was expecting to get none of my requests met based on the low rate I paid and to be relegated to the worst rooms in the hotel like you get when booking thru Priceline. WOW...every request was met and as an added bonus we were given a great corner room which angles out like a pie wedge making is MUCH larger than almost all the other rooms. The front desk agent gave us her business card at check-in and said to call her if there was anything she could do to make our stay more pleasurable. Is this really the same hotel everyone complains about?? We can not complain about this property. Maybe we were lucky, but they made our last night in Asia on our way home from Thailand to Canada a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but modern airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having arrived in Hong Kong from London en route back to Australia I had no choice but to stay at Regal airport hotel even though I felt price was a bit high... Situated so close to the airport the convenience is what you pay for and it is a very modern and sleek hotel.....I arrived around 10.30pm.....the reception check-in was very busy....it took me about 20 minutes to check in.....which with so many people to check in was reasonable....but with hotel this size (1000 rooms from website) 5 reception staff does not seem adequate to accomodate the service. I was impressed that the reception staff were even able to smile and maintain a friendly disposition with the number of customers they were dealing with. Another problem was ordering room service as I found staff unable to explain what the food was or how it was cooked...........being an international hotel I would have thought this would not be an issue...so I ended up going down to coffee shop... My overnight stay however was very pleasant.....however I would have liked room rate to include breakfast...that was a disappointment....

Reviews.Title: “Decent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Merlin5
Reviews.Content: Like most people we stayed overnight here between flights - arriving around 10 pm on a Thursday evening and leaving 11 am the next morning, going home. Contrary to expectations due to some revues on TA the Check-In staff were welcoming, smiling and helpful. We had booked our room through Asia Rooms and all was as requested. Our room looked recently decorated/refurbished and was perfectly clean. The size was adequate for an overnight stay. The shower in the bathroom was excellent. The only negative comment would be that the bed was extremely hard (and I like hard beds - but this was too much). The convenience of the hotel cannot be over-stressed - it was just so easy getting off our flight and walking to the hotel and vice versa. We had drinks and a snack in the bar on the ground floor of the hotel - the service was excellent as was the food and drinks. A nice touch was the piano player and blues singer. Breakfast was included in our rate and was above average - plenty to choose from and excellent quality. Check out staff were again friendly and helpful and there were no hidden extras. I would defintely stay at this hotel again if it were just for the between flights stopover (otherwise I would want to stay in Hong Kong as we did on our way out). Yes, it is pricey - but most airport hotels around the world in this sort of walkway linked location are and if you shop around you can reduce the price quite dramatically. Any questions - let me know Merlin

Reviews.Title: “Even worse now !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: asiatraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed each time when passing through HK on business trips for the past 2 years now which was about twice a month. My last 2 stays in December and the one just last Friday were horrid ! Seems the service has disappeared completely. Staff was just rude and obnoxious throughout. On check out I asked to speak with the general manager as I really felt insulted by the front staff but was kept waiting in lobby for close to an hour only to be told the general manager was too busy !!!!!!!!!!! Disgraceful management!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad (Cold) Experience”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryFamilyOf3
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night between our flights from Australia to North America and arrived late in the evening. The room temperature never rose above 18 degrees Celcius and the shower taps were broken and therefore shower temperature adjustment was extremely difficult. Service was just OK and the breakfast which was included in our package was pretty good. For the price of the room we did not feel we received good value at all. Room was clean but bed was like sleeping on a sheet of plywood and there were no face cloths.

Reviews.Title: “Bad times”
Reviews.Author: rowie747
Reviews.Content: Like so many others, stayed here for one night so I could catch a morning flight next day. Room was ok, horribly inflated price but I was paying for the convinience I suppose. What got me though was the service I received at check in and check out. Really pathetic Is putting things nicely. The front office staff member called me up to the reception desk with dictorial like fashion. No greeting, no smile. Check out was same deal. Wasnt asked how my stay was, no warmth or empathy. I understand this is a "airport" hotel but I dont care. I paid good money and the service I received did not warrent it. Only stay here if your depserate.
